meaning_1: smooth; tender; not harsh; not rough
ru_meaning: деликатный; тактичный; вежливый; не резкий; не грубый
Example1:
akakkasaṃ viññāpaniṃ, giraṃ saccam'udīraye,
yāya n'ābhisaje kañci, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

meaning_1: having no doubt; not uncertain
Example1: puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akaṅkhī hoti avicikicchī niṭṭhaṅ'gato saddhamme. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

meaning_1: nothing; lit. not something
Example1:
na brāhmaṇass'etad'akiñci seyyo,
yadā nisedho manaso piyehi,
yato yato hiṃsamano nivattati,
tato tato sammati'm'eva dukkhaṃ.

meaning_1: unfit to be talked to; should not be spoken to
ru_meaning: не подходит для разговора (с); не следует говорить (с)
Commentary: (ANa) akaccho'ti kathetuṃ na yutto.
Example1: sac’āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno aññen’aññaṃ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeti, kopañ’ca dosañ’ca appaccayañ’ca pātukaroti, evaṃ sant’āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.

meaning_1: not done; not performed; not acted
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ tathāvādinā bhikkhunā, akaṭa-anudhammena taṃ diṭṭhiṃ appaṭinissaṭṭhena, saddhiṃ sambhuñjeyya vā saṃvaseyya vā saha vā seyyaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: who has not performed the legal procedure; who has not been dealt with according to the rule
ru_meaning: кто не выполнил правовую процедуру; с которым не поступили в соответствии с правилом
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.69) akaṭ'ānudhammo nāma ukkhitto anosārito.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ tathāvādinā bhikkhunā, akaṭ’ānudhammena taṃ diṭṭhiṃ appaṭinissaṭṭhena, saddhiṃ sambhuñjeyya vā saṃvaseyya vā saha vā seyyaṃ kappeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: who has not done good deeds
Commentary: (ANa) akatakalyāṇo'tiādīsu kalyāṇaṃ vuccati puññakammaṃ, taṃ akataṃ etenā'ti akatakalyāṇo. sesapadesu'pi es'eva nayo.
Example1: puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akatakalyāṇo hoti akatakusalo akatabhīruttāṇo katapāpo kataluddo katakibbiso. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

meaning_1: who has not done wrong; who has not done dirty things; who has not committed sins
ru_meaning: кто не делал ничего плохого; кто не делал грязных вещей; кто не совершал грехи
Commentary: (ANa) kibbisan'ti samalaṃ aparisuddhakammaṃ
Example1: puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akatapāpo hoti akataluddo akatakibbiso katakalyāṇo katakusalo katabhīruttāṇo. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

meaning_1: who has not done good; who has not made merit
ru_meaning: кто не делал добро; кто не делал заслуг
Commentary: (ANa) puññakammam'eva hi kosallasambhūtattā kusalaṃ
Example1: puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akatakalyāṇo hoti akatakusalo akatabhīruttāṇo katapāpo kataluddo katakibbiso. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

meaning_1: ungrateful; lit. not knowing what is done
ru_meaning: неблагодарный; досл. не знающий что сделано
Example1:
assaddho akataññū ca, sandhicchedo ca yo naro,
hat'āvakāso vant'āso, sa ve uttamaporiso.

meaning_1: knowing the uncreated; who knows the unborn
ru_meaning: знающий не сотворенное; кто знает не рожденное
Example1:
chinda sotaṃ parakkamma, kāme panūda brāhmaṇa,
saṅkhārānaṃ khayaṃ ñatvā, akataññū'si brāhmaṇa.
Example2:
assaddho akataññū ca, sandhicchedo ca yo naro,
hat'āvakāso vant'āso, sa ve uttamaporiso.

meaning_1: who has not done evil; who has not done wrong
ru_meaning: кто не делал зла; кто не сделал ничего плохого
Example1: puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akatapāpo hoti akataluddo akatakibbiso katakalyāṇo katakusalo katabhīruttāṇo. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

meaning_1: who has not made a refuge from fear; who has not made a protection against terror; (comm) who has not protected the fearful
ru_meaning: кто не укрылся от страха; кто не защитился от ужаса; (комм) кто не защищал напуганных
Commentary: (ANa) bhītassa parittāyakattā bhīruttāṇan'ti vuccati.
Example1: puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akatakalyāṇo hoti akatakusalo akatabhīruttāṇo katapāpo kataluddo katakibbiso. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

meaning_1: who has not done cruel deeds
Commentary: (ANa) luddan'ti kakkhaḷakammaṃ.
Example1: puna caparaṃ, brāhmaṇa, idh'ekacco akatapāpo hoti akataluddo akatakibbiso katakalyāṇo katakusalo katabhīruttāṇo. tam'enaṃ aññataro gāḷho rog'ātaṅko phusati.

meaning_1: not done; not made; not created
Example1: no ce’taṃ abhavissa ajātaṃ abhūtaṃ akataṃ asaṅkhataṃ na’y’idha jātassa bhūtassa katassa saṅkhatassa nissaraṇaṃ paññāyetha.
Example2:
akataṃ dukkaṭaṃ seyyo, pacchā tappati dukkaṭaṃ,
katañ’ca sukataṃ seyyo, yaṃ katvā n’ānutappati.

meaning_1: something not done; unperformed  action
Example1:
akataṃ dukkaṭaṃ seyyo, pacchā tappati dukkaṭaṃ,
katañ'ca sukataṃ seyyo, yaṃ katvā n'ānutappati.
Example2:
na paresaṃ vilomāni, na paresaṃ kat'ākataṃ,
attano'va avekkheyya, katāni akatāni ca.

meaning_1: not doing; not making; not practising
ru_meaning: не делающий; не совершающий; не практикующий
Example2: pānīyaparibhojanīya-upaṭṭhapanañ'ca; chand'ārahānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ chanda-āharaṇañ'ca; tesaññ'eva akata-uposathānaṃ pārisuddhiyā'pi āharaṇañ'ca

meaning_1: who does not participate in the Uposatha
Example2: pānīyaparibhojanīya-upaṭṭhapanañ'ca; chand'ārahānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ chanda-āharaṇañ'ca; tesaññ'eva akat'uposathānaṃ pārisuddhiyā'pi āharaṇañ'ca

meaning_1: not boasting (about)
Example1:
santo ca bhikkhu abhinibbut'atto, iti'han'ti sīlesu akatthamāno,
tam'ariyadhammaṃ kusalā vadanti, yass'ussadā n'atthi kuhiñci loke.

meaning_1: not confused; without doubt; lit. not asking 'how?'
ru_meaning: свободный от сомнений; досл. не спрашивающий 'как?'
Example1:
yass'ālayā na vijjanti, aññāya akathaṃkathī,
amat'ogadham'anuppattaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.
Example2: vicikicchaṃ pahāya tiṇṇavicikiccho viharati akathaṃkathī kusalesu dhammesu, vicikicchāya cittaṃ parisodheti

meaning_1: free from mud; free from filth
Example1: te taṃ sarasiṃ ogāhetvā soṇḍāya bhisamuḷālaṃ abbuhetvā suvikkhālitaṃ vikkhāletvā akaddamaṃ saṅkhāditvā ajjhoharanti.

meaning_1: class of devas; lit. not the youngest
ru_meaning: класс божественных существ; досл. не самый молодой
Example1: tassa hi pathavito yāva akaniṭṭha-brahmalokā nīl'ādiārammaṇaṃ samosarantaṃ paripuṇṇabhāvaṃ kātuṃ na sakkoti

meaning_1: unpleasant; unwelcome; disagreeable
Example1: idha yassa te honti aniṭṭhā akantā amanāpā rūpā saddā gandhā rasā phoṭṭhabbā dhammā, ye vā pan’assa te honti anatthakāmā ahitakāmā aphāsukakāmā ayogakkhemakāmā
Example2: yan’dunnimittaṃ avamaṅgalañ’ca, yo c’āmanāpo sakuṇassa saddo, pāpaggaho dussupinaṃ akantaṃ, buddh’ānubhāvena vināsamentu

meaning_1: not allowable; unsuitable; inappropriate; lit. not to be fit
Example1: ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisa, ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.

meaning_1: un-constructed; un-fashioned; un-fabricated
Example1:
vītagedho amaccharī, na ussesu vadate muni,
na samesu na omesu, kappaṃ n'eti akappiyo.

meaning_1: unblemished; spotless; pure
ru_meaning: безупречный; не опороченный; чистый; не запятнанный
Example2: bhikkhu yāni tāni sīlāni akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni asabalāni akammāsāni bhujissāni viññuppasatthāni aparāmaṭṭhāni samādhi-saṃvattanikāni

meaning_1: non-doing; non-action; absence of action
Example2:
sabba-pāpassa akaraṇaṃ, kusalassa upasampadā.
sacitta-pariyodapanaṃ, etaṃ buddhāna sāsanaṃ.

meaning_1: should not be done; could not be made
ru_meaning: не должен быть сделан; не может быть выполнен
Example1: ayaṃ vuccati ariyasāvako akaraṇīyo mārassa akaraṇīyo pāpimato”ti
Example2: ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisa, ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.

meaning_1: undoable (for); lit. not to be done (for)
Example1: pariccattaṃ kho rañño nāgassa jīvitaṃ. n'atthi dāni kiñci rañño nāgassa akaraṇīyan'ti.

meaning_1: not doing
Example1:
yañ’hi kayirā tañ’hi vade, yaṃ na kayirā na taṃ vade.
akarontaṃ bhāsamānaṃ, parijānanti paṇḍitā.

meaning_1: without trouble
Example1: yato kho ariyasāvako imehi sattahi saddhammehi samannāgato hoti, imesañ’ca catunnaṃ jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhamma-sukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasira-lābhī.

meaning_1: who gains without trouble
Example1: yato kho ariyasāvako imehi sattahi saddhammehi samannāgato hoti, imesañ’ca catunnaṃ jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhamma-sukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.

meaning_1: they did; they made
Example1: bhikkhū ghaṭikārassa kumbhakārassa āvesanaṃ uttiṇam’akaṃsu.
Example2:
na v'āham'etaṃ tathiyan'ti brūmi, yam'āhu bālā mithu aññam'aññaṃ,
sakaṃ sakaṃ diṭṭhim'akaṃsu saccaṃ, tasmā hi bālo'ti paraṃ dahanti.

meaning_1: unwilling; reluctant
Example1: seyyathā'pi, ānanda, puriso daliddo assako anāḷhiko, tassa akāmakassa bilaṃ olaggeyyuṃ, idaṃ te, ambho purisa, maṃsañ'ca khāditabbaṃ, mūlañ'ca anuppadātabban'ti.

meaning_1: unwillingly; reluctantly; with no choice in the matter; whether one wants to or not
ru_meaning: независимо от желания; вынужденно; без выбора в этом вопросе
Commentary: (VINa) akāmā parivatthabban'ti na kāmena, na vasena, atha kho akāmena avasena parivāsaṃ samādāya vatthabbaṃ.
Example1: yesaṃ bhikkhu aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā āpajjitvā yāvat’īhaṃ jānaṃ paṭicchādeti tāvat’īhaṃ tena bhikkhunā, akāmā, parivatthabbaṃ.

meaning_1: who is not a doer; who is not an agent; who is not the perpetrator; innocent
ru_meaning: не деятель; не исполнитель; не преступник; невиновный
Example1: akārako'mhī'ti yo vādaṃ upeti so imehi dvīhi kāraṇehi vādaṃ upeti.

meaning_1: (in debate) counter-argument
Example1: ṭhān'āṭhāne na saṇṭhātī'ti kāraṇa-akāraṇe na saṇṭhāti. tatr'āyaṃ nayo, sassatavādī yuttena kāraṇena pahoti ucchedavādiṃ niggahetuṃ

meaning_1: not do-able; could not be done; impossible to do
ru_meaning: не выполнимый; не может быть сделан; невозможно сделать
Example1:
ekaṃ dhammaṃ atītassa, musāvādissa jantuno,
vitiṇṇaparalokassa, n'atthi pāpaṃ akāriyaṃ.

meaning_1: having not caused to do; having not made
Example1: divāṭṭhāne nisinnakāle pana okāsaṃ kāretvā'va pucchantassa kathetabbo, akāretvā pucchantassa na kathetabbo.

meaning_1: (vinaya) out of season robe cloth; unexpected robe
ru_meaning: (виная) внесезонная ткань для одеяния; неожиданная одежда
Commentary: (VIN 1.4.3) akālacīvaraṃ nāma anatthate kathine ekādasamāse uppannaṃ, atthate kathine sattamāse uppannaṃ, kāle'pi ādissa dinnaṃ, etaṃ akālacīvaraṃ nāma.
Example1: niṭṭhita-cīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kaṭhine bhikkhuno pan'eva akālacīvaraṃ uppajjeyya, ākaṅkhamānena bhikkhunā paṭiggahetabbaṃ paṭiggahetvā khippam’eva kāretabbaṃ.

meaning_1: who speaks at the improper time
Commentary:
(MNa) akālavādī'ti akālena vattā.
(ANa) akālavādī'ti kālasmiṃ na vadati, akālasmiṃ vadati nāma.
Example1: samphappalāpī hoti akālavādī abhūtavādī anatthavādī adhammavādī avinayavādī; anidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti akālena anapadesaṃ apariyantavatiṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ.

meaning_1: out of season; unseasonal; lit. in wrong time
ru_meaning: не сезонный; досл. в неверное время
Example1: seyyathā’pi gimhānaṃ pacchime māse ūhataṃ rajo-jallaṃ, tam’enaṃ mahā-akāla-megho ṭhānaso antaradhāpeti vūpasameti

meaning_1: not delayed; immediate; timeless; (comm) giving immediate fruit
ru_meaning: незамедлительный; безотлагательный; вневременный; (комм) дающий немедленный результат
Commentary: (SNa) attano phaladānaṃ sandhāya n'āssa kālo'ti akālo, akālo'y'eva akāliko.
Example1: “iminā tvaṃ dhammena diṭṭhena viditena akālikena pattena pariyogāḷhena atīt'ānāgate nayaṃ nehi -
Example2: svākkhāto bhagavatā dhammo sandiṭṭhiko akāliko ehipassiko opanayiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhi

meaning_1: at the wrong moment; at an unsuitable time; at an improper time
ru_meaning: в неподходящий момент; в неподходящее время; в неуместное время
Commentary:
(MNa) akālenā'ti vattabbakālassa pubbe vā pacchā vā ayuttakāle vattā hoti.
(ANa) akālenā'ti kathetuṃ ayuttakālena.
Example1: samphappalāpī hoti akālavādī abhūtavādī anatthavādī adhammavādī avinayavādī; anidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti akālena anapadesaṃ apariyantavatiṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ.

meaning_1: did; made
Example1: m’āyasmā attānaṃ avacanīyaṃ akāsi, … , āyasmā’pi bhikkhū vadetu sahadhammena, bhikkhūpi āyasmantaṃ vakkhanti sahadhammena.
Example2: adāsi me akāsi me, ñātimittā sakhā ca me. petānaṃ dakkhiṇaṃ dajjā, pubbe katam’anussaraṃ.

meaning_1: I did; I made
Example1: so kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, yo c’āyaṃ kāmavitakko yo ca byāpādavitakko yo ca vihiṃsāvitakko — imaṃ ekaṃ bhāgam’akāsiṃ
Example2: evaṃ vadeyya — ‘ahaṃ, bhante, pāpakammaṃ akāsiṃ gārayhaṃ mosallaṃ, yena me āyasmanto attamanā honti taṃ karomī’ti.

meaning_1: (something which) should be not done; ought not to be made
ru_meaning: (то что) не должно быть сделано; не следует совершать
Example1:
yesañ'ca susamāraddhā, niccaṃ kāyagatā sati,
akiccaṃ te na sevanti, kicce sātaccakārino,
satānaṃ sampajānānaṃ, atthaṃ gacchanti āsavā.

meaning_1: who gains without difficulty
Example1: imesañ’ca catunnaṃ jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhamma-sukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī.

meaning_1: not difficult; trouble-free; easy to get
ru_meaning: не трудный; без проблем; легко получаемый
Example1: imesañ’ca catunnaṃ jhānānaṃ ābhicetasikānaṃ diṭṭhadhamma-sukhavihārānaṃ nikāmalābhī hoti akiccha-lābhī akasiralābhī.
Example2:
“dhanañ’ca puttaṃ bhariyañ’ca, chaḍḍayitvāna niggatā.
kaṭacchu-bhikkha-hetū’pi, akicchāni nisevare.

meaning_1: with nothing; having no; possession-less
ru_meaning: ни с чем; не имеющий; неимущий
Example1:
na c'āhaṃ brāhmaṇaṃ brūmi, yonijaṃ mattisambhavaṃ,
bhovādi nāma so hoti, sace hoti sakiñcano,
akiñcanaṃ anādānaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.
Example2:
tatr’ābhiratim’iccheyya, hitvā kāme akiñcano,
pariyodapeyya attānaṃ, cittaklesehi paṇḍito.

meaning_1: nothing; lit. not anything
Construction: na > a + ka > ki + iṃ + ci
Example1:
na brāhmaṇass'etad'akiñci seyyo, yadā nisedho manaso piyehi,
yato yato hiṃsamano nivattati, tato tato sammati'm'eva dukkhaṃ.

meaning_1: non-doing; not doing
Example1: ye'pi te, bhikkhave, ahesuṃ ukkalā vassabhaññā ahetukavādā akiriya-vādā natthikavādā

meaning_1: (proponent of) doctrine of non-action; doctrine of inefficacy of action
Example1: ye'pi te, bhikkhave, ahesuṃ ukkalā vassabhaññā ahetukavādā akiriyavādā natthikavādā

meaning_1: straight; not crooked
Construction:
na > a + √kuñc > kukk + u + ka
akukku + ka
Commentary: (MNa) akukkukajātan'ti pupphaggahaṇakāle anto aṅguṭṭhappamāṇo eko ghanadaṇḍako nibbattati, tena virahitan'ti attho
Example1: so tattha passeyya mahantaṃ kadali-kkhandhaṃ ujuṃ navaṃ akukkuka-jātaṃ.

meaning_1: growing straight up; not crooked
Example1: so tattha passeyya mahantaṃ kadali-kkhandhaṃ ujuṃ navaṃ akukkukajātaṃ.

meaning_1: free from bad behaviour; free from wrongdoing
ru_meaning: свободный от плохого поведения; без проступков
Commentary: (SNPa) akukkuco'ti hatthakukkucādivirahito
Example1:
akkodhano asantāsī, avikatthī akukkuco,
mantabhāṇī anuddhato, sa ve vācāyato muni.

meaning_1: nothing to fear from anywhere; with no reason for fear; lit. from nowhere fear
ru_meaning: нечего не боящийся; без повода для страха; досл. из ниоткуда страх
Commentary: (DHPa) n'atthi kutoci bhavato vā ārammaṇato vā etesaṃ bhayanti akutobhayā, te akutobhaye.
Example1:
te tādise pūjayato, nibbute akutobhaye,
na sakkā puññaṃ saṅkhātuṃ, im'ettam'api kenaci.

meaning_1: unshakable; unwavering
Example2: ñāṇañ’ca pana me dassanaṃ udapādi — ‘akuppā me vimutti, ayam’antimā jāti, n’atthi-dāni punabbhavo’ti.
English chant 2: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

meaning_1: not being shaken (by); not being disturbed (by); not being agitated (by)
ru_meaning: не трясущийся; не беспокоящийся; не волнующийся
Example1: tañ'hi'ssa, bhikkhu, n'atthi yena jāyetha, ajāyamāno kiṃ jīyissati, ajīyamāno kiṃ mīyissati, amīyamāno kiṃ kuppissati, akuppamāno kissa pihessati?

meaning_1: for one not doing (something)
Construction:
na > a + kubba + nta + to
akubbanta + to
Example1:
yathā'pi ruciraṃ pupphaṃ, vaṇṇavantaṃ agandhakaṃ,
evaṃ subhāsitā vācā, aphalā hoti akubbato.
Example2:
pāṇimhi ce vaṇo n'āssa, hareyya pāṇinā visaṃ,
n'ābbaṇaṃ visam'anveti, n'atthi pāpaṃ akubbato.

meaning_1: not doing; not making
Example1:
okaṃ pahāya aniketasārī, gāme akubbaṃ muni santhavāni,
kāmehi ritto apurekkharāno, kathaṃ na viggayha janena kayirā.

meaning_1: not doing; not making; not creating
ru_meaning: не делающий; не совершающий; не создающий
Example1:
mamāyite passatha phandamāne, macche'va app'odake khīṇasote,
etam'pi disvā amamo careyya, bhavesu āsattim'akubbamāno.
Example2:
ubhosu antesu vineyya chandaṃ, phassaṃ pariññāya anānugiddho,
yad'attagarahī tad'akubbamāno, na lippatī diṭṭhasutesu dhīro.

meaning_1: unhealthy thinking; unwholesome thought; unskilful thinking
ru_meaning: нездоровое мышление; не благая мысль; неумелое мышление
Example1: tayo'me, bhikkhave, akusalavitakkā — kāmavitakko, byāpādavitakko, vihiṃsāvitakko.

meaning_1: unbeneficial; useless; unskilful
Example2: dukkhaṃ, bhikkhave, kusīto viharati vokiṇṇo pāpakehi akusalehi dhammehi, mahantañ’ca sadatthaṃ parihāpeti.
Example3: bhikkhu anuppannānaṃ pāpakānaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ anuppādāya chandaṃ janeti vāyamati vīriyaṃ ārabhati cittaṃ paggaṇhāti padahati

meaning_1: who is honest; who is not deceitful; who is straight-forward
ru_meaning: тот кто честен; кто не обманывает; кто прямой
Example1:
patilīno akuhako, apihālu amaccharī,
appagabbho ajeguccho, pesuṇeyye ca no yuto.

meaning_1: imperfect; incomplete; not an adept
Example1:
sakaṃ sakaṃ diṭṭhiparibbasānā, viggayha nānā kusalā vadanti,
yo evaṃ jānāti sa vedi dhammaṃ, idaṃ paṭikkosam'akevalī so.

meaning_1: unskilled (in); not expert (in); not proficient (in); not a master (of)
ru_meaning: не обученный (в); не эксперт (в); не специалист (в); не мастер (в)
Example1: idha, gahapati, assutavā puthujjano ariyānaṃ adassāvī ariyadhammassa akovido ariyadhamme avinīto sappurisānaṃ adassāvī sappurisadhammassa akovido sappurisadhamme avinīto

meaning_1: verbally abused
Example1:
akkocchi maṃ avadhi maṃ, ajini maṃ ahāsi me.
ye ca taṃ upanayhanti, veraṃ tesaṃ na sammati.

meaning_1: freedom from anger; absence of anger; meekness; lit. non-anger
ru_meaning: свобода от гнева; отсутствие гнева; мягкость; досл. не гнев
Example1: vicikicchissa purisapuggalassa tiṇṇavicikicchatā hoti parinibbānāya. kodhanassa purisapuggalassa akkodho hoti parinibbānāya.
Example2:
akkodhena jine kodhaṃ, asādhuṃ sādhunā jine,
jine kadariyaṃ dānena, saccen'ālikavādinaṃ.

meaning_1: without anger; friendly; well disposed
ru_meaning: беззлобный; свободный от гнева; дружелюбный; хорошо расположенный
Example1:
vicikiccho vā tiṇṇa-vicikiccho nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi?
kodhano vā akkodhano nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi?
saṃkiliṭṭha-citto vā asaṃkiliṭṭha-citto nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi?
Example2:
akkodhanaṃ vatavantaṃ, sīlavantaṃ anussadaṃ,
dantaṃ antimasārīraṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

meaning_1: verbal abuse; insult
Example2:
akkosaṃ vadhabandhañ'ca, aduṭṭho yo titikkhati,
khantībalaṃ bal'ānīkaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.
Example3: atha kho āyasmā raṭṭhapālo sakapitu nivesane n’eva dānaṃ alattha na paccakkhānaṃ, añña'd'atthu akkosam’eva alattha

meaning_1: verbally abuses; insults
Example1: sace taṃ, puṇṇa, sunāparantakā manussā akkosissanti paribhāsissanti, tatra te, puṇṇa, kin’ti bhavissatī”ti?

meaning_1: sharp-shooter; lit. target piercing
Commentary:
(ANa) akkhaṇavedhī'ti avirādhitavedhī, akkhaṇaṃ vā vijju vijjantarikāya vijjhituṃ samattho'ti attho
(ANa) avirādhitaṃ vijjhatī'ti akkhaṇavedhī.
Example1: seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, issāso vā issās'antevāsī vā tiṇapurisarūpake vā mattikāpuñje vā yoggaṃ karitvā, so aparena samayena dūrepātī ca hoti akkhaṇavedhī ca mahato ca kāyassa padāletā.

meaning_1: target; mark; butt
Example1: seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, issāso vā issās'antevāsī vā tiṇapurisarūpake vā mattikāpuñje vā yoggaṃ karitvā, so aparena samayena dūrepātī ca hoti akkhaṇa-vedhī ca mahato ca kāyassa padāletā.

meaning_1: gambler; who is addicted to gambling; lit. corrupted with dice
ru_meaning: игрок; пристрастившийся к азартным играм; досл. испорченный игрой в кости
Example1: appamattako so, bhikkhave, kaṭaggaho yaṃ so akkhadhutto paṭhamen’eva kaṭaggahena mahantaṃ bhogakkhandhaṃ adhigaccheyya.

meaning_1: impatient (with); intolerant (of); not able to endure
Example1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu akkhamo hoti rūpānaṃ, akkhamo saddānaṃ, akkhamo gandhānaṃ, akkhamo rasānaṃ, akkhamo phoṭṭhabbānaṃ.
Example2: mār’ātirekam’abhiyujjhita-sabba-rattiṃ, ghoram’pan’āḷavakam’akkhama-thaddha-yakkhaṃ, khantī-sudanta-vidhinā jitavā mun’indo.

meaning_1: word; sound; syllable; lit. indestructible
Example1:
vītataṇho anādāno, niruttipadakovido,
akkharānaṃ sannipātaṃ, jaññā pubb'āparāni ca,
sa ve antimasārīro mahāpañño, mahāpuriso'ti vuccati.
Example2: ye pana te sutt'antā kavikatā kāveyyā citt'akkharā cittabyañjanā bāhirakā sāvakabhāsitā, tesu bhaññamānesu sussūsissanti, sotaṃ odahissanti

meaning_1: announced; told; declared
Example1:
etādis’āyaṃ santāno, māy’āyaṃ bālalāpinī,
vadhako esa akkhāto, sāro ettha na vijjati.
Example2:
ye ca kho sammad-akkhāte, dhamme dhamm’ānuvattino,
te janā pāram’essanti, maccudheyyaṃ suduttaraṃ.

meaning_1: to be spoken (about); to be declared (by); lit. to be said (by)
ru_meaning: следует говорить (о); может быть объявленным; досл. может быть сказан
Example1: jhāyīh'ete, bhikkhave, samāpattikusalehi samāpattivuṭṭhānakusalehi samāpajjitvā vuṭṭhahitvā sammā akkhātabbānī'ti vadāmī'ti.

meaning_1: speaker; who tells
Example1:
tumhehi kiccam'ātappaṃ, akkhātāro tathāgatā,
paṭipannā pamokkhanti, jhāyino mārabandhanā.
Example2: pisuṇaṃ vācaṃ pahāya pisuṇāya vācāya paṭivirato hoti, ito sutvā na amutra akkhātā imesaṃ bhedāya, amutra vā sutvā na imesaṃ akkhātā amūsaṃ bhedāya

meaning_1: says; tells; explains
Example1:
tvañ'ca me dhammam'akkhāhi, taṇhānigghātanaṃ muni,
yaṃ viditvā sato caraṃ, tare loke visattikaṃ.

meaning_1: announcing; telling
Example1: chanda-parisuddhi, utu’kkhānaṃ, bhikkhu-gaṇanā ca, ovādo - uposathassa etāni pubbakiccan'ti vuccati.
Example2: utu-akkhānañ'ca; bhikkhugaṇanā'ca; bhikkhunīnam'ovādo cā'ti.

meaning_1: saying; speaking; declaring; announcing
Example1:
pasaṃsito vā pana tattha hoti, akkhāya vādaṃ parisāya majjhe,
so hassatī uṇṇamatī ca tena, pappuyya tam'atthaṃ yathā mano ahu.

meaning_1: is considered; is said to be
Example1: seyyathā'pi bhikkhave ye keci pupphagandhā vassikaṃ tesaṃ aggam'akkhāyati

meaning_1: tale; story; narrative
Example1: itthi-kathaṃ sūra-kathaṃ visikhā-kathaṃ kumbhaṭṭhāna-kathaṃ pubbapeta-kathaṃ nānatta-kathaṃ lok’akkhāyikaṃ samuddakkhāyikaṃ iti’bhav’ābhava-kathaṃ

meaning_1: asserting; declaring; saying; announcing
Example1: paṇḍitā h’āvuso, manussā vīmaṃsakā — ‘kismiṃ pan’āyasmantānaṃ chandarāga-vinay’akkhāyī satthā’ti? - ‘rūpe … vedanāya … saññāya … sankhāresu … viññāṇe chandarāga-vinay’akkhāyī satthā’ti.
Example2: tiṭṭhat’eva nibbānaṃ, tiṭṭhati nibbānagāmī maggo, magg’akkhāyī’haṃ tathāgato

meaning_1: said; told; stated; declared
Example1: evaṃ vutte, bhāradvājagotto brāhmaṇo saṃviggo lomahaṭṭhajāto bhagavantaṃ etad'avoca, etad'eva kho pana mayaṃ bhoto gotamassa ārocetu'kāmā. atha ca pana bhavaṃ gotamo anakkhātaṃ'y'eva akkhāsī'ti.

meaning_1: eye
Example1: tato tvaṃ, moggallāna, uṭṭhāy'āsanā udakena akkhīni anumajjitvā disā anuvilokeyyāsi, nakkhattāni tārakarūpāni ullokeyyāsi

meaning_1: could be said; to be said; expressible; lit. to be said
ru_meaning: может быть сказан; следует высказать; поддающийся выражению
Example1:
diṭṭhā'pi sutā'pi te janā, yesaṃ nāmam'idaṃ pavuccati,
nāmaṃ yev'āvasissati, akkheyyaṃ petassa jantuno.
Example2:
akkheyya-saññino sattā,
akkheyyasmiṃ patiṭṭhitā,
akkheyyaṃ apariññāya,
yogam'āyanti maccuno.

meaning_1: conscious of what can be expressed; percipient of what can be named
ru_meaning: осознающий что поддается выражению; воспринимающий то что можно назвать
Commentary: (SNa) satto naro poso puggalo itthī puriso'ti evaṃ saññā etesaṃ atthī'ti saññino, akkheyyesv'eva saññino'ti akkheyyasaññino, pañcasu khandhesu sattapuggal'ādisaññino'ti attho.
Example1:
akkheyyasaññino sattā,
akkheyyasmiṃ patiṭṭhitā,
akkheyyaṃ apariññāya,
yogam'āyanti maccuno.

meaning_1: unbroken; unfragmented; whole
Example2: bhikkhu yāni tāni sīlāni akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni asabalāni akammāsāni bhujissāni viññuppasatthāni aparāmaṭṭhāni samādhi-saṃvattanikāni

meaning_1: not chewing (on); not biting; not gnawing
Example1: pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ādīnavā dantakaṭṭhassa akhādane. katame pañca? acakkhussaṃ, mukhaṃ duggandhaṃ hoti, rasaharaṇiyo na visujjhanti, pittaṃ semhaṃ bhattaṃ pariyonandhati, bhattam'assa nacchādeti.

meaning_1: mild taste; not alkaline taste
Example1: kiñ’ca vijānāti? ambilam’pi vijānāti, tittakam’pi vijānāti, kaṭukam’pi vijānāti, madhuram’pi vijānāti, khārikam’pi vijānāti, akhārikam’pi vijānāti, loṇikam’pi vijānāti, aloṇikam’pi vijānāti.

meaning_1: not safe; not secure; not at peace; not at rest
ru_meaning: не безопасный; не в мире; не в покое
Example2:
handa mayaṃ khem’ākhema-saraṇa-gamana-paridīpikā-gāthāyo
bhaṇāmase
English chant 2: Going to True and False Refuges

meaning_1: went; travelled
Example2:
saṃsaraṃ hi nirayaṃ agacchissaṃ,
petalokam'agamaṃ punappunaṃ,
dukkhamamhi'pi tiracchānayoniyaṃ,
n'ekadhā hi vusitaṃ ciraṃ mayā.
Example3: ahaṃ kho sakamhā gāmā amuṃ gāmaṃ agacchiṃ

meaning_1: not gone to; untravelled
ru_meaning: в который не ходил; который не посещал
Example1:
na hi etehi yānehi, gaccheyya agataṃ disaṃ,
yath'āttanā sudantena, danto dantena gacchati.

meaning_1: not tied; not knotted; not bound
Example1: lābhī tathāgato cīvara-piṇḍapāta-sen'āsana-gilānappaccaya-bhesajja-parikkhārānaṃ, taṃ tathāgato agathito amucchito anajjhāpanno ādīnavadassāvī nissaraṇapañño paribhuñjati.

meaning_1: not tied up; not bound; not enslaved
ru_meaning: не связанный; не привязанный; не порабощенный
Example1: aladdhā ca cīvaraṃ na ca paritassissāma, laddhā ca cīvaraṃ agadhitā amucchitā anajjhāpannā ādīnavadassāvino nissaraṇapaññā paribhuñjissāma.

meaning_1: scentless; odourless; without smell
Example1:
yathā'pi ruciraṃ pupphaṃ, vaṇṇavantaṃ agandhakaṃ,
evaṃ subhāsitā vācā, aphalā hoti akubbato.

meaning_1: came; arrived
Example2:
sabbe sattā sabbe pāṇā, sabbe bhūtā ca kevalā.
sabbe bhadrāni passantu, mā kiñci pāpam’āgamā.

meaning_1: went (to); left (for)
Example1: agamāsi kho, bhikkhave, so kummo taṃ padesaṃ. tam'enaṃ luddo papatāya vijjhi.
Example2: atha kho therā bhikkhū yathāvihāraṃ agamaṃsu. āyasmā'pi mahako sakaṃ vihāraṃ agamāsi.

meaning_1: came (to); arrived (at)
Example1:
sv'āhaṃ idha pañca sikkhā karitvā,
paṭipajjitvā tathāgatassa dhamme,
dvepatham'agamāsiṃ coramajjhe,
te maṃ tattha vadhiṃsu bhogahetu.
Example2: evaṃ gacchante kāle ekaṃ nigamagāmaṃ agamāsi.

meaning_1: travelled; walked; lit. went
Example1: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā maggo gato hoti. tassa evaṃ hoti, ahaṃ kho maggaṃ agamāsiṃ. maggaṃ kho pana me gacchantassa kāyo kilanto. hand'āhaṃ nipajjāmī'ti.

meaning_1: would have fallen into; would be immersed in; could have become; lit. would have gone
ru_meaning: стал бы; был бы погружен; мог бы стать; досл. ушел бы (в)
Example1: ime kho hirī ca ottappañca lokaṃ na pāleyyuṃ, sambhedaṃ loko agamissa, yathā aj’eḷakā kukkuṭa-sūkarā soṇa-siṅgālā.

meaning_1: without making a problem; without making it difficult; without making a fuss; lit. having not made heavy
ru_meaning: без проблем; не усложняя; без суеты; досл. не утяжелив
Example1: vibhajat'āyasmā mahākaccāno agarukatvā'ti.

meaning_1: without making a problem; without making it difficult; without making a fuss; lit. having not made heavy
ru_meaning: без проблем; не усложняя; без суеты; досл. не утяжелив
Example1: vibhajat'āyasmā mahākaccāno agarukaritvā'ti.

meaning_1: convenient; not troublesome; not a burden
Example1: sace te, kassapa, agaru, viharemu ajjuṇho aggisālamhī’ti

meaning_1: not respected; not esteemed
Example1: pañcahi, bhikkhave, dhammehi samannāgato thero bhikkhu sabrahmacārīnaṃ appiyo ca hoti amanāpo ca agaru ca abhāvanīyo ca

meaning_1: goes forth from home to homelessness; leaves home to become a monk
ru_meaning: уходит из дома в бездомность; покидает дом чтобы стать монахом
Example1: yass’atthāya kulaputtā samma’d’eva agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajanti
Example2: yan’nūn’āhaṃ kesa-massuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajeyyan’ti.

meaning_1: lives at home; lives his life
Example1: sace agāraṃ ajjhāvasati, rājā hoti cakkavattī dhammiko dhammarājā cāturanto vijitāvī janapadatthāvariyappatto sattaratanasamannāgato.
Example2: idha ariyasāvako vigata-mala-maccherena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati muttacāgo payatapāṇi vossaggarato yācayogo dānasaṃvibhāgarato. ayaṃ vuccati cāgasampadā.

meaning_1: house; a dwelling place
Example1: ādittasmiṃ agārasmiṃ, yaṃ nīharati bhājanaṃ. taṃ tassa hoti atthāya, no ca yaṃ tattha ḍayhati.
Example2: ‘kacci nu kho’haṃ suññ’āgāre abhiramāmī’ti, pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ.
English chant 2: Ten Subjects for Frequent Recollection by One Who Has Gone Forth

meaning_1: household life; domestic life
Example1:
hitvā agāraṃ pabbajitā,
hitvā puttaṃ pasuṃ viyaṃ,
hitvā rāgañ'ca dosañ'ca
Example2: yan’nūn’āhaṃ kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajeyyan’ti.

meaning_1: layman; householder
Example1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, soṇa, kusalo tvaṃ pubbe agāriya-bhūto vīṇāya tantissare'ti?

meaning_1: household; living as a layman; lit. belonging to a house state
ru_meaning: домашний; живущий как мирянин; досл. состояние принадлежности к дому
Example1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, soṇa, kusalo tvaṃ pubbe agāriyabhūto vīṇāya tantissare'ti?

meaning_1: without greed; without desire
Example1:
yehi vivitto vicareyya loke, na tāni uggayha vadeyya nāgo,
jal'ambujaṃ kaṇḍakaṃ vārijaṃ yathā, jalena paṅkena c'anūpalittaṃ,
evaṃ munī santivādo agiddho, kāme ca loke ca anūpalitto.
Example2:
paṇītaṃ yadi vā lūkhaṃ, appaṃ vā yadi vā bahuṃ.
yāpan’atthaṃ abhuñjiṃsu, agiddhā n’ādhimucchitā.

meaning_1: not sick; healthy
Commentary:
(VIN 2.1.31) agilāno nāma sakkoti tamhā āvasathā pakkamituṃ.
(VIN 2.1.39) agilāno nāma yassa vinā paṇītabhojanāni phāsu hoti.
Example1: agilānena bhikkhunā eko āvasathapiṇḍo bhuñjitabbo. tato ce uttariṃ bhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
Example2: yo pana bhikkhu evarūpāni paṇītabhojanāni, agilāno, attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: unsuitable place
Example1: yathārūpe anāsane nisinnaṃ yathārūpe agocare carantaṃ; yathārūpe pāpake mitte bhajantaṃ viññū sabrahmacārī pāpakesu ṭhānesu okappeyyuṃ;

meaning_1: is considered the highest (of); is said to be the best (of)
Example1: seyyathā'pi bhikkhave ye keci pupphagandhā vassikaṃ tesaṃ aggam'akkhāyati

meaning_1: topmost teacher; highest doctrine; lit. speaking foremost
ru_meaning: высший учитель; важнейшее учение; досл. говорящий о самом главном
Example1:
disvā samudayaṃ vibhavañ’ca sambhavaṃ,
dāy’ādako hehisi aggavādino.

meaning_1: took
Example1:
hitvā sata-palaṃ kaṃsaṃ, sovaṇṇaṃ sata-rājikaṃ,
aggahiṃ mattikāpattaṃ, idaṃ dutiya-abhisecanan’ti.

meaning_1: seized; caught; arrested; grabbed hold (of)
Example1: bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, sakuṇagghi lāpaṃ sakuṇaṃ sahasā ajjhappattā aggahesi.
Example2:
saññāvirattassa na santi ganthā, paññāvimuttassa na santi mohā,
saññañ'ca diṭṭhiñ'ca ye aggahesuṃ, te ghaṭṭayantā vicaranti loke'ti.

meaning_1: fixing the lock; setting the bolt in place
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.19) aggaḷaṭṭhapanāyā'ti dvāraṭṭhapanāya.
Example1: mahallakaṃ pana bhikkhunā vihāraṃ kārayamānena yāva dvārakosā aggaḷaṭṭhapanāya āloka-sandhi-parikammāya dvatti-cchadanassa pariyāyaṃ

meaning_1: bolt; crossbar; lock
Example1: mahallakaṃ pana bhikkhunā vihāraṃ kārayamānena yāva dvārakosā aggaḷa-ṭṭhapanāya āloka-sandhi-parikammāya dvatti-cchadanassa pariyāyaṃ

meaning_1: highest; topmost; foremost; supreme
Example1:
disvā samudayaṃ vibhavañ’ca sambhavaṃ,
dāy’ādako hehisi agga-vādino.
Example2: na, bhikkhave, hīnena aggassa patti hoti. aggena ca kho, bhikkhave, aggassa patti hoti.

meaning_1: tip; top; peak
Example1: tam’enaṃ mūle chindeyya; mūle chetvā agge chindeyya, agge chetvā pattavaṭṭiṃ vinibbhujeyya.
Example2: kodhaṃ jhatvā sukhaṃ seti, kodhaṃ jhatvā na socati, kodhassa visa-mūlassa, madhur’aggassa devate, vadhaṃ ariyā pasaṃsanti, tañ’hi jhatvā na socatī’ti.

meaning_1: highest thing; best thing; ultimate thing
Example1:
“pūti-macchaṃ kus’aggena, yo naro upanayhati.
kusā’pi pūtī vāyanti, evaṃ bāl’ūpasevanā”ti.

meaning_1: hall; room; space; place
Example1: bhikkhu-gaṇanā ca: imasmiṃ uposath’agge sannipatitānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ gaṇanā kittakā bhikkhū honti?
Example2: yāvakīvañ’ca bhikkhave bhikkhū sam’aggā sannipatissanti, sam’aggā vuṭṭhahissanti, sam’aggā saṅgha-karaṇīyāni karissanti
Example3: bhikkhugaṇanā nāma imasmiṃ uposath-agge uposath'atthāya sannipatitā bhikkhū ettakā'ti, bhikkhūnaṃ gaṇanā.

meaning_1: fire
Example1:
atha pāpāni kammāni, karaṃ bālo na bujjhati.
sehi kammehi dummedho, aggi-daḍḍho’va tappati.
Example3: kena ādittaṃ? ‘rāg’agginā, dos’agginā, moh’agginā ādittaṃ, jātiyā jarāya maraṇena sokehi paridevehi dukkhehi domanassehi upāyāsehi ādittan’ti vadāmi

meaning_1: bonfire; mass of fire
Example1: “aggikkhandh'ūpamā kāmā mah'ābhitāpan'aṭṭhenā”ti passanto vikkhambhanato kāme parivajjeti.

meaning_1: burned by fire; consumed by fire
Example1:
atha pāpāni kammāni, karaṃ bālo na bujjhati,
sehi kammehi dummedho, aggidaḍḍho'va tappati.

meaning_1: fire worshipper; attendant of the sacred fire
Example1: brāhmaṇā, bhante, pacchābhūmakā kamaṇḍalukā sevālamālikā aggiparicārikā udak'orohakā soceyyāni paññapenti, tes'āhaṃ soceyyāni rocemī'ti

meaning_1: fire room; heated hall; lit. fire hall
ru_meaning: каминная комната; отапливаемый зал; досл. огонь зал
Notes: (MW) place for keeping the sacrificial fire
Example1: sace te, kassapa, agaru, viharemu ajjuṇho aggisālamhī’ti

meaning_1: flame; lit. crest of fire
Example1:
seyyo ayoguḷo bhutto, tatto aggisikhā-upamo,
yañ'ce bhuñjeyya dussīlo, raṭṭhapiṇḍam'asaññato.

meaning_1: fire sacrifice; fire oblation
Example1:
yamhā dhammaṃ vijāneyya, sammāsambuddhadesitaṃ,
sakkaccaṃ taṃ namasseyya, aggihuttaṃ'va brāhmaṇo.

meaning_1: attends the sacred fire; worships the sacrificial fire
ru_meaning: следит за священным огнем; поклоняется жертвенному огню
Example1:
yo ca vassasataṃ jantu, aggiṃ paricare vane,
ekañ'ca bhāvit'attānaṃ, muhuttam'api pūjaye,
sā'y'eva pūjanā seyyo, yañ'ce vassasataṃ hutaṃ.

meaning_1: is worth; has the value (of)
Example1:
māse māse kus'aggena, bālo bhuñjeyya bhojanaṃ,
na so saṅkhātadhammānaṃ, kalaṃ agghati soḷasiṃ.

meaning_1: has the value (of); comes to the value (of)
Example1:
ken'esa yañño vipulo mahaggato,
samena dinnassa na aggham'eti,
kathaṃ sataṃ sahassānaṃ sahassayāginaṃ,
kalam'pi n'āgghanti tathāvidhassa te'ti.

meaning_1: value; cost; price; worth
Example1:
ken'esa yañño vipulo mahaggato,
samena dinnassa na aggham'eti,
kathaṃ sataṃ sahassānaṃ sahassayāginaṃ,
kalam'pi n'āgghanti tathāvidhassa te'ti.

meaning_1: sacrificial room; room for keeping the sacred fire; lit. fire house
ru_meaning: жертвенная комната; помещение для хранения священного огня; досл. дом огня
Commentary: (MNa) agy'āgāre'ti aggihomasālayaṃ.
Example1: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā kurūsu viharati kammāsadhammaṃ nāma kurūnaṃ nigamo, bhāradvājagottassa brāhmaṇassa agy'āgāre tiṇasanthārake.

meaning_1: hollow; empty; void; vacuous; lit. empty space state
ru_meaning: полый; пустой; незаполненный; досл. состояние пустого пространства
Example1: aghaṃ aghagataṃ, vivaraṃ vivaragataṃ, asamphuṭṭhaṃ maṃsalohitehi upādinnaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā ākāsadhātu.

meaning_1: as trouble; as pain; as bad
ru_meaning: как бедственный; как болезненный; как плохой
Commentary: (MNa) dukkh'aṭṭhena aghato
Example1: so yad'eva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati.

meaning_1: like a misfortune; like a trouble
Commentary: (MNa) rogo'va bhūto'ti rogabhūto. sesapadesu'pi es'eva nayo.
Example1: so tvaṃ imaṃ kāyaṃ rogabhūtaṃ gaṇḍabhūtaṃ sallabhūtaṃ aghabhūtaṃ ābādhabhūtaṃ, idan'taṃ, bho gotama, ārogyaṃ, idan'taṃ nibbānan'ti vadesi.

meaning_1: root of misery; (or) void of a root
Example1: vipariṇāmadhammato asārakato aghamūlato vadhakato vibhavato sāsavato saṅkhatato mār'āmisato

meaning_1: removal of trouble; elimination of suffering; lit. leading out bad
ru_meaning: устранение неприятностей; исключение страданий; досл. вывод плохого
Commentary: (SNa) chandavinayā aghavinayo'ti taṇhāvinayena pañcakkhandhavinayo.
Example1: chandajaṃ aghaṃ chandajaṃ dukkhaṃ, chandavinayā aghavinayo, aghavinayā dukkhavinayo'ti.

meaning_1: empty space; void; vacuum of space
Commentary: (SNt) kenaci na ghaṭṭetī'ti aghaṃ
Example1: vipariṇāmadhammato asārakato agha-mūlato vadhakato vibhavato sāsavato saṅkhatato mār'āmisato
Example2: aghaṃ aghagataṃ, vivaraṃ vivaragataṃ, asamphuṭṭhaṃ maṃsalohitehi upādinnaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā ākāsadhātu.

meaning_1: trouble; misfortune; pain
Commentary:
(SNa) aghan'ti pañcakkhandhadukkhaṃ. dutiyapadaṃ tass'eva vevacanaṃ.
(SNa) aghan'ti evarūpassa hi vaṭṭadukkhaṃ āgatam'eva hoti.
Example1: chandajaṃ aghaṃ chandajaṃ dukkhaṃ, chandavinayā aghavinayo, aghavinayā dukkhavinayo'ti.
Example2: vipariṇāmadhammato asārakato agha-mūlato vadhakato vibhavato sāsavato saṅkhatato mār'āmisato

meaning_1: not smelled
Example1: ye te ghānaviññeyyā gandhā aghāyitā aghāyitapubbā, na ca ghāyasi, na ca te hoti ghāyeyyan’ti? atthi te tattha chando vā rāgo vā pemaṃ vā”ti?

meaning_1: never smelled before
ru_meaning: никогда не обонял; не чувствовал раньше
Example1: ye te ghānaviññeyyā gandhā aghāyitā aghāyitapubbā, na ca ghāyasi, na ca te hoti ghāyeyyan’ti? atthi te tattha chando vā rāgo vā pemaṃ vā”ti?

meaning_1: mahout; elephant driver; lit. holding a hooked pole
Example1: idaṃ pure cittam’acāri cārikaṃ, yen’icchakaṃ yatthakāmaṃ yathāsukhaṃ, tad’ajj’ahaṃ niggahessāmi yoniso, hatthi-ppabhinnaṃ viya aṅkusaggaho.

meaning_1: hooked pole; hook for controlling and driving an elephant; a goad
ru_meaning: крюк; крюк для управления слоном; стрекало
Example1: idaṃ pure cittam’acāri cārikaṃ, yen’icchakaṃ yatthakāmaṃ yathāsukhaṃ, tad’ajj’ahaṃ niggahessāmi yoniso, hatthi-ppabhinnaṃ viya aṅkusa-ggaho.

meaning_1: spot; blemish; stain
Commentary: (ANa) aṅgaṇan'ti tatthajātak'āṅgakāḷatilak'ādiṃ
Example1: sace tattha passati rajaṃ vā aṅgaṇaṃ vā, tass'eva rajassa vā aṅgaṇassa vā pahānāya vāyamati.

meaning_1: courtyard
Example1: ayaṃ pañho nāma cetiy'aṅgaṇe pucchitena na kathetabbo, tathā bhikkhācāramagge gāmaṃ piṇḍāya caraṇakāle.

meaning_1: even a limb; just limb; (as his) very limb
ru_meaning: даже конечность; просто конечность; именно (как его) конечность
Example1: aṭṭhahi, bhikkhave, aṅgehi samannāgato rañño bhaddo ass'ājānīyo rāj'āraho hoti rājabhoggo, rañño aṅgan't'eva saṅkhaṃ gacchati.

meaning_1: part of the body; some or other limb; major and minor limbs
ru_meaning: часть тела; та или иная конечность; основные и второстепенные конечности
Notes: aṅga are the major limbs, trunk, head, arms and legs. paccaṅga are minor limbs such as forehead, nose, chin, fingers, ears etc.
Example1: suparimaṭṭhe phalake vā bhittiyā vā dussapaṭṭe vā itthirūpaṃ vā purisarūpaṃ vā abhinimmineyya sabb’aṅgapaccaṅgiṃ;
Example2: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, sace so puriso taṃ ādittaṃ tiṇ’ukkaṃ na khippam’eva paṭinissajjeyya tassa sā ādittā tiṇ'ukkā hatthaṃ vā daheyya bāhuṃ vā daheyya aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgapaccaṅgaṃ daheyya

meaning_1: limb by limb; all the limbs; lit. limb and limb
ru_meaning: конечность за конечностью; все конечности; досл. конечность и конечность
Example1: yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ vāyo vāyogataṃ upādinnaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, uddhaṅ'gamā vātā, adhogamā vātā, kucchisayā vātā, koṭṭh'āsayā vātā, aṅgam'aṅga-anusārino vātā, assāso passāso

meaning_1: coursing through all the limbs
Example1: yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ vāyo vāyogataṃ upādinnaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, uddhaṅ'gamā vātā, adhogamā vātā, kucchisayā vātā, koṭṭh'āsayā vātā, aṅgam'aṅg'ānusārino vātā, assāso passāso

meaning_1: accumulation of parts; collection of components
Example1:
yathā hi aṅgasambhārā,
hoti saddo ratho iti,
evaṃ khandhesu santesu,
hoti satto'ti sammuti.

meaning_1: a constituent part of the body; a limb; member
Example1: “ubhato-daṇḍakena ce’pi kakacena corā ocarakā aṅgam’aṅgāni okanteyyuṃ, tatrā’pi yo mano padūseyya, na me so tena sāsana-karo.
Example2: yo pana bhikkhu, otiṇṇo vipariṇatena cittena, mātugāmena saddhiṃ kāya-saṃsaggaṃ samāpajjeyya, hatthaggāhaṃ vā veṇiggāhaṃ vā aññatarassa vā aññatarassa vā aṅgassa parāmasanaṃ, saṅghādiseso.

meaning_1: factor; component; element; quality; aspect
Example1:
yathā hi aṅga-sambhārā, hoti saddo ratho iti.
evaṃ khandhesu santesu, hoti satto’ti sammuti
Example2: handa mayaṃ satta-sambojjh’aṅga-pāṭhaṃ bhaṇāmase

meaning_1: vow; practice; means
Example1: sambahulā bhikkhū santhatāni ujjhitvā āraññik’aṅgaṃ piṇḍapātik’aṅgaṃ paṃsukūlik’aṅgaṃ samādiyiṃsu

meaning_1: Bengalis; people of Bengal
Example1: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā aṅgesu viharati āpaṇaṃ nāma aṅgānaṃ nigamo.

meaning_1: burning embers; charcoal
Example1: tam’enaṃ dve balavanto purisā nānābāhāsu gahetvā taṃ aṅgāra-kāsuṃ upakaḍḍheyyuṃ. atha kho tassa purisassa ārakā'v'assa cetanā ārakā patthanā ārakā paṇidhi.

meaning_1: pit of burning coals
Example1: tam’enaṃ dve balavanto purisā nānābāhāsu gahetvā taṃ aṅgārakāsuṃ upakaḍḍheyyuṃ. atha kho tassa purisassa ārakā'v'assa cetanā ārakā patthanā ārakā paṇidhi.
Example2: “aṅgārakās'ūpamā kāmā mahāpariḷāh'aṭṭhenā”ti passanto vikkhambhanato kāme parivajjeti

meaning_1: like a pit of burning coals; similar to a charcoal pit
ru_meaning: как яма с горящими углями; похожий на угольную яму
Commentary:
(MNa) aṅgārakās'ūpamā mah'ābhitāpan'aṭṭhena.
(ANa) aṅgārakās'ūpamā'ti santāpan'aṭṭhena aṅgārakāsuyā upamitā ime kāmā'ti.
Example1: aṭṭhikaṅkal'ūpamā ... maṃsapes'ūpamā ... tiṇ'ukk'ūpamā ... aṅgārakās'ūpamā ... supinak'ūpamā ... yācitak'ūpamā ... rukkhaphal'ūpamā ... asisūn'ūpamā ... sattisūl'ūpamā ... sappasir'ūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bahupāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo'ti.

meaning_1: consisting of x parts; composed of x factors
ru_meaning: состоящий из (стольки-то) частей; содержащий из (стольки-то) элементов
Example1: paṭhamaṃ pan'āvuso, jhānaṃ kati-aṅgikan'ti? paṭhamaṃ kho, āvuso, jhānaṃ pañc'aṅgikaṃ.
Example2: ayam’eva ariyo aṭṭh’aṅgiko maggo seyyath’īdaṃ sammādiṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākammanto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.

meaning_1: big toe; thumb
ru_meaning: большой палец ноги; большой палец руки
Example1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, sunakkhatta, api nu so puriso amussa āsīvisassa ghoravisassa hatthaṃ vā aṅguṭṭhaṃ vā dajjā yaṃ jaññā

meaning_1: thumb-print; impression of the thumb
ru_meaning: отпечаток большого пальца; след от большого пальца
Example1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, palagaṇḍassa vā palagaṇḍ'antevāsissa vā vāsijaṭe dissant'eva aṅgulipadāni dissati aṅguṭṭhapadaṃ.

meaning_1: inch; finger breadth
Example1: navaṃ pana bhikkhunā mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā kārayamānena aṭṭh’aṅgulapādakaṃ kāretabbaṃ sugat’aṅgulena, aññatra heṭṭhimāya aṭaniyā.

meaning_1: tickling; lit. poking with fingers
Commentary:
(VIN 2.1.52) aṅgulipatodako nāma aṅguliyā'pi tudanti, upasampanno upasampannaṃ has'ādhippāyo kāyena kāyaṃ āmasati, āpatti pācittiyassa.
(VINa) aṅgulipatodakenā'ti aṅgulīhi upakacchak'ādighaṭṭanaṃ vuccati.
Example1: aṅgulipatodake, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: fingerprint; impression of the finger
Example1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, palagaṇḍassa vā palagaṇḍ'antevāsissa vā vāsijaṭe dissant'eva aṅgulipadāni dissati aṅguṭṭhapadaṃ.

meaning_1: joint of the finger; finger knuckle
Example1: hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo, yaṃ mahāsamudde aṅgulipabba-temanamattam'pi udakaṃ na hoti.

meaning_1: enough to wet the finger knuckle; lit. finger knuckle wetting measure
Example1: hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo, yaṃ mahāsamudde aṅgulipabbatemanamattam'pi udakaṃ na hoti.

meaning_1: personal name of an arahant monk; lit. garland of fingers
ru_meaning: имя монаха архата; досл. гирлянда из пальцев
Example3:
coro ahaṃ pure āsiṃ, aṅgulimālo'ti vissuto.
vuyhamāno mah'oghena, buddhaṃ saraṇam'āgamaṃ.

meaning_1: finger
Example1: tesaṃ rasapathaviṃ aṅguliyā sāyataṃ acchādesi, taṇhā ca tesaṃ okkami.
Example2: ukkhitta-khaggam-atihattha-sudāruṇan’taṃ, dhāvan’ti-yojana-path’aṅguli-mālavantaṃ. iddhī’bhisaṅkhata-mano jitavā mun’indo.

meaning_1: sightless; visionless; lit. eyeless
Example1: evam'eva kho, māgaṇḍiya, aññatitthiyā paribbājakā andhā acakkhukā ajānantā ārogyaṃ, apassantā nibbānaṃ, atha ca pan'imaṃ gāthaṃ bhāsanti

meaning_1: bad looking; not good for the eyes; lit. not for the eye
ru_meaning: плохо выглядящий; не радующий глаз; досл. не для глаза
Commentary: (ANa) acakkhussan'ti na cakkhūnaṃ hitaṃ, cakkhuṃ visuddhaṃ na karoti.
Example1: pañc'ime, bhikkhave, ādīnavā dantakaṭṭhassa akhādane. katame pañca? acakkhussaṃ, mukhaṃ duggandhaṃ hoti, rasaharaṇiyo na visujjhanti, pittaṃ semhaṃ bhattaṃ pariyonandhati, bhattam'assa nacchādeti.

meaning_1: steady; steadfast; not shaking
Example1:
anuddhato acapalo, nipako saṃvut’indriyo,
sobhati paṃsukūlena, sīho’va girigabbhare.

meaning_1: having not lived; having not led one's life; lit. having not walked
ru_meaning: не прожив; не проведя свою жизнь; досл. не пройдя
Example1:
acaritvā brahmacariyaṃ, aladdhā yobbane dhanaṃ,
jiṇṇakoñcā'va jhāyanti, khīṇamacche'va pallale.

meaning_1: not later
Example1: saññā nu kho, bhante, paṭhamaṃ uppajjati, pacchā ñāṇaṃ, udāhu ñāṇaṃ paṭhamaṃ uppajjati, pacchā saññā, udāhu saññā ca ñāṇañ'ca apubbaṃ acarimaṃ uppajjantī'ti?

meaning_1: lived; wandered around
Example1:
sokapparidevamaccharaṃ, na jahanti giddhā mamāyite,
tasmā munayo pariggahaṃ, hitvā acariṃsu khemadassino.

meaning_1: unshakeable; immobile; stationary; stable
Example1: seyyathā’pi rañño paccantime nagare esikā hoti gambhīranemā sunikhātā acalā asampavedhī abbhantarānaṃ guttiyā bāhirānaṃ paṭighātāya. evam’evaṃ kho ariyasāvako saddho hoti, saddahati tathāgatassa bodhiṃ

meaning_1: walked around; wandered around; roamed
Example1: idaṃ pure cittam’acāri cārikaṃ, yen’icchakaṃ yatthakāmaṃ yathāsukhaṃ, tad’ajj’ahaṃ niggahessāmi yoniso, hatthi-ppabhinnaṃ viya aṅkusaggaho.

meaning_1: thought (about); pondered (over)
Example2:
bahū devā manussā ca, maṅgalāni acintayuṃ.
ākaṅkhamānā sotthānaṃ, brūhi maṅgalam’uttamaṃ

meaning_1: (of time) not long; soon; recent
Example1: atha kho acira-pakkantassa bhagavato bāhiyaṃ dārucīriyaṃ gāvī taruṇavacchā adhipatitvā jīvitā voropesi.

meaning_1: recently departed; soon left
Example1: atha kho acirapakkantassa bhagavato bāhiyaṃ dārucīriyaṃ gāvī taruṇavacchā adhipatitvā jīvitā voropesi.
Example2: atha kho āyasmā channo acirapakkantesu tesu āyasmantesu satthaṃ āharesi.

meaning_1: recently ordained
Example1: ahaṃ kho, āvuso, navo acirapabbajito adhun'āgato imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ. na t'āhaṃ sakkomi vitthārena ācikkhituṃ.

meaning_1: soon; before long; lit. not long
Example2:
aciraṃ vat’ayaṃ kāyo, paṭhaviṃ adhisessati.
chuddho apeta-viññāṇo, niratthaṃ’va kaliṅgaraṃ.

meaning_1: not long after one ordained; shortly after ordination
Example1: acir'ūpasampanno kho pan'āyasmā māgaṇḍiyo eko vūpakaṭṭho appamatto ātāpī pahit'atto viharanto nacirass'eva, yass'atthāya kulaputtā samma'd'eva agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajanti

meaning_1: unconscious; inanimate; senseless; mindless
ru_meaning: не наделенный сознанием; неодушевленный; без сознания
Example1:
āyu usmā ca viññāṇaṃ, yadā kāyaṃ jahant’imaṃ,
apaviddho tadā seti, parabhattaṃ acetanaṃ.
Example2: tiṭṭhantu tāva manussabhūtā, acetanānaṃ rukkhānam’pi sāmaggiṃ laddhuṃ vaṭṭati.

meaning_1: not thinking; not having mental activity
ru_meaning: не думающий; не имеющий умственной активности
Example1: tassa acetayato anabhisaṅkharoto tā c'eva saññā nirujjhanti, aññā ca oḷārikā saññā na uppajjanti. so nirodhaṃ phusati. evaṃ kho, poṭṭhapāda, anupubb'ābhisaññānirodha-sampajāna-samāpatti hoti.

meaning_1: not thinking; not having mental activity
ru_meaning: не думающий; не имеющий умственной активности
Example1: so tato amutra tato amutra anupubbena saññ'aggaṃ phusati. tassa saññ'agge ṭhitassa evaṃ hoti, cetayamānassa me pāpiyo, acetayamānassa me seyyo.

meaning_1: naked ascetic; lit. unclothed
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.41) acelako nāma yo koci paribbājakasamāpanno naggo.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu acelakassa vā paribbājakassa vā paribbājikāya vā sahatthā khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā dadeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: (prefix)
Example1:
sodha sibbinim’acca-gā’ti
icc’evam accanta-namassanīyaṃ
Example2:
yo-accanta-suddhabbara-ñāṇa-locano
so vo mam’accayena satthā

meaning_1: had overcome; had surpassed; had got past
Example1: accayo maṃ, bhante, accagamā yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, yo'haṃ bhagavantaṃ āvusovādena samudācaritabbaṃ amaññissaṃ.

meaning_1: had overcome; had surpassed; had got past
Example1: “yo ubho’nte viditvāna, majjhe mantā na lippati. taṃ brūmi mahāpuriso’ti, so’dha sibbinim’accagā”ti.
Example2:
yo'maṃ palipathaṃ duggaṃ, saṃsāraṃ moham'accagā,
tiṇṇo pāragato jhāyī, anejo akathaṃkathī,
anupādāya nibbuto, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

meaning_1: crossed beyond; transcended; overcome; escaped
ru_meaning: перешагнул за пределы; превзошел; преодолел; спасся
Example1:
yo imaṃ samuddaṃ sagāhaṃ sarakkhasaṃ,
saūmiṃ sāvaṭṭaṃ sabhayaṃ duttaraṃ accatari.

meaning_1: extreme bad behaviour; extreme immorality
Example1:
yassa accantadussīlyaṃ, māluvā sālam'iv'otthataṃ,
karoti so tath'attānaṃ, yathā naṃ icchatī diso.

meaning_1: completely finished; absolutely done
Commentary: (ANa) accantaniṭṭho'ti khayavayasaṅkhātaṃ antaṃ atītā'ti accantā, accantā niṭṭhā assā'ti accantaniṭṭho, ek'antaniṭṭho satataniṭṭho'ti attho.
Example1: kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, bhikkhu saṃkhittena taṇhāsaṅkhayavimutto hoti accantaniṭṭho accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānan'ti?

meaning_1: completely concluded; absolutely finished
Commentary: (ANa) accantaṃ pariyosānam'assā'ti purimanayen'eva accantapariyosāno.
Example1: kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, bhikkhu saṃkhittena taṇhāsaṅkhayavimutto hoti accantaniṭṭho accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānan'ti?

meaning_1: completed the holy life; finished the spiritual journey; (or) completely celibate; absolutely chaste
ru_meaning: завершил святую жизнь; закончил духовное путешествие; (или) полностью целомудренный; абсолютно непорочный
Commentary: (ANa) accantabrahmacārī'ti accantaṃ brahmacārī, niccabrahmacārī'ti attho.
Example1: kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, bhikkhu saṃkhittena taṇhāsaṅkhayavimutto hoti accantaniṭṭho accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānan'ti?

meaning_1: completely safe; absolutely free from bondage
ru_meaning: в полной безопасности; абсолютно свободный от зависимости
Commentary: (ANa) accantayogakkhemī'ti accantaṃ yogakkhemī, niccayogakkhemī'ti attho.
Example1: kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, bhikkhu saṃkhittena taṇhāsaṅkhayavimutto hoti accantaniṭṭho accantayogakkhemī accantabrahmacārī accantapariyosāno seṭṭho devamanussānan'ti?

meaning_1: complete; absolute; ultimate; lit. up to the end
Example1: “vuttam’idaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā sakkapañhe — ‘ye te samaṇabrāhmaṇā taṇhāsaṅkhayavimuttā, te accanta-niṭṭhā accanta-yogakkhemino accanta-brahmacārino accanta-pariyosānā seṭṭhā devamanussānan’ti.
Example2: buddho susuddho karuṇā-mah’aṇṇavo, yo-accanta-suddhabbara-ñāṇa-locano, lokassa pāp’ūpakilesa-ghātako

meaning_1: extreme; severe; lit. beyond the limit
Example1:
yassa accanta-dussīlyaṃ, māluvā sālam'iv'otthataṃ,
karoti so tath'attānaṃ, yathā naṃ icchatī diso.

meaning_1: goes beyond; gets past; transcends; surpasses
ru_meaning: выходит за рамки; проходит; превосходит; превышает
Example1:
sakañ'hi diṭṭhiṃ katham'accayeyya, chand'ānunīto ruciyā niviṭṭho,
sayaṃ samattāni pakubbamāno, yathā hi jāneyya tathā vadeyya.

meaning_1: confesses a fault; lit. confess a fault as a fault
ru_meaning: признает ошибку; досл. признает ошибку ошибкой
Example1: tena kho pana samayena dve bhikkhū sampayojesuṃ, tatr'eko bhikkhu accasarā, atha kho so bhikkhu tassa bhikkhuno santike accayaṃ accayato deseti, so bhikkhu nappaṭiggaṇhāti.

meaning_1: fault; offence; transgression; lit. going beyond (the norm)
ru_meaning: ошибка; нарушение; проступок; досл. выход за (рамки)
Example1: accayo maṃ, bhante, accagamā yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, yo'haṃ bhagavantaṃ āvusovādena samudācaritabbaṃ amaññissaṃ.

meaning_1: went too far; overshot the mark
Example1: accayāsi, brāhmaṇa, pañhaṃ, n'āsakkhi pañhassa pariyantaṃ gahetuṃ.

meaning_1: after the passing (of); after the lapse (of); lit. with passing (of)
Construction:
ati > aty > acc + √i > ay + *a + ena
accaya + ena
Example1: so tassā rattiyā accayena pubb’aṇhasamayaṃ nivāsetvā pattacīvaram’ādāya yena tassa gahapatissa vā gahapatiputtassa vā nivesanaṃ ten’upasaṅkamati.

meaning_1: after the death (of); after the passing away; lit. with going beyond
ru_meaning: после смерти; после ухода; досл. с уходом
Example3: yo vo, ānanda, mayā dhammo ca vinayo ca desito paññatto, so vo mam’accayena satthā.

meaning_1: is at fault; lit. fault has overcome
Example1: accayo maṃ, bhante, accagamā yathābālaṃ yathāmūḷhaṃ yathāakusalaṃ, yo'haṃ bhagavantaṃ āvusovādena samudācaritabbaṃ amaññissaṃ.

meaning_1: had given offence; had transgressed; had overstepped; lit. had gone to far
ru_meaning: обидел; нарушил; перешел границы; досл. зашел слишком далеко
Example1: tena kho pana samayena dve bhikkhū sampayojesuṃ, tatr'eko bhikkhu accasarā, atha kho so bhikkhu tassa bhikkhuno santike accayaṃ accayato deseti, so bhikkhu nappaṭiggaṇhāti.

meaning_1: placing; lit. putting on
Example2: rattiyā majjhimaṃ yāmaṃ dakkhiṇena passena sīhaseyyaṃ kappeyyāsi pāde pādaṃ accādhāya sato sampajāno uṭṭhānasaññaṃ manasikaritvā

meaning_1: too tight; too sharply tuned; overstretched
ru_meaning: слишком тугой; слишком резко настроенный; перенапряженный
Construction:
ati > aty > acc + ā + √yam + ta
ati + āyata
Commentary: (ANa) accāyatā’ti atiāyatā kharamucchanā.
Example1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, soṇa, yadā te vīṇāya tantiyo accāyatā honti, api nu te vīṇā tasmiṃ samaye saravatī vā hoti kammaññā vā'ti?

meaning_1: urgent; pressing; extraordinary
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu, santaṃ bhikkhuṃ anāpucchā, vikāle gāmaṃ paviseyya, aññatra tathārūpā accāyikā karaṇīyā, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: overly aroused; over-stimulated; too forcefully applied
ru_meaning: чрезмерно пробужденный; сверх-стимулированный; слишком сильно приложенный
Commentary: (ANa) accāraddhan'ti atigāḷhaṃ
Example1: evam'evaṃ kho, soṇa, accāraddha-vīriyaṃ uddhaccāya saṃvattati, atisithilavīriyaṃ kosajjāya saṃvattati.

meaning_1: overly aroused energy; effort too forcefully applied
ru_meaning: чрезмерно возбужденная энергия; слишком сильное приложение усилия
Commentary: (ANa) accāraddhan’ti atigāḷhaṃ.
Example1: evam'evaṃ kho, soṇa, accāraddhavīriyaṃ uddhaccāya saṃvattati, atisithilavīriyaṃ kosajjāya saṃvattati.

meaning_1: flame
Example1: seyyathā’pi, bhikkhave, aṅgāra-kāsu sādhika-porisā puṇṇā aṅgārānaṃ vīt’accikānaṃ vīta-dhūmānaṃ.

meaning_1: flame
Example1: seyyathā'pi, āvuso, telappadīpassa jhāyato acciṃ paṭicca ābhā paññāyati, ābhaṃ paṭicca acci paññāyati

meaning_1: everlasting; eternal; stable; epithet of Nibbāna; lit. not falling away; not vanishing
ru_meaning: вечный; бесконечный; постоянный; эпитет Ниббаны; досл. не исчезающий
Commentary: (NIDD2 2.8) accutan'ti niccaṃ dhuvaṃ sassataṃ avipariṇāmadhamman'ti
Example1:
jaheyya sabbasaṃyogaṃ, kareyya saraṇ’attano,
careyy’ādittasīso’va, patthayaṃ accutaṃ padan’ti.
Example2:
idha diṭṭhasutamutaviññātesu, piyarūpesu hemaka,
chandarāgavinodanaṃ, nibbānapadam'accutaṃ.

meaning_1: urgent; pressing; extraordinary
Commentary: (VIN 1.4.28) accekacīvaraṃ nāma senāya vā gantu'kāmo hoti, pavāsaṃ vā gantu'kāmo hoti, gilāno vā hoti, gabbhinī vā hoti, assaddhassa vā saddhā uppannā hoti, appasannassa vā pasādo uppanno hoti
Example1: das’āh’ānāgataṃ kattika-temāsika-puṇṇamaṃ, bhikkhuno pan'eva acceka-cīvaraṃ uppajjeyya

meaning_1: extraordinary robe; robe-cloth that has been offered urgently
ru_meaning: необычное одеяние; ткань для одежды что была предложена настойчиво
Commentary: (VIN 1.4.28) accekacīvaraṃ nāma senāya vā gantu'kāmo hoti, pavāsaṃ vā gantu'kāmo hoti, gilāno vā hoti, gabbhinī vā hoti, assaddhassa vā saddhā uppannā hoti, appasannassa vā pasādo uppanno hoti
Example1: das’āh’ānāgataṃ kattika-temāsika-puṇṇamaṃ, bhikkhuno pan'eva accekacīvaraṃ uppajjeyya

meaning_1: passes by; goes past
Commentary: (SNa) accentī'ti atikkamanti.
Example1:
accenti kālā tarayanti rattiyo,
vayoguṇā anupubbaṃ jahanti,
etaṃ bhayaṃ maraṇe pekkhamāno,
puññāni kayirātha sukh'āvahānī'ti.

meaning_1: lives; stays; remains; lit. sits
Example1:
“sabba-kāruka-sippāni, cittiṃ katvāna sikkhare.
avūpasantā ajjhattaṃ, sāmaññ’attho’ti acchati .
Example2: ye te bhikkhū tiracchānakathikā kāyadaḷhibahulā viharanti tesam’pi ekajjhaṃ sen'āsanaṃ paññapeti — “im’āyap’ime āyasmanto ratiyā acchissantī”ti.

meaning_1: snap one's fingers
Example1: seyyathā’pi, ānanda, balavā puriso appakasiren’eva accharaṃ pahareyya

meaning_1: surrounded by a retinue of celestial nymphs; accompanied by an entourage of female divinities
ru_meaning: в окружении свиты небесных нимф; в сопровождении свиты божеств женского пола
Commentary: (SNa) accharāsaṅghaparivutā'ti accharā'ti devadhītānaṃ nāmaṃ, tāsaṃ samūhena parivutā.
Example1: bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, aññatarā tāvatiṃsakāyikā devatā nandane vane accharāsaṅghaparivutā dibbehi pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappitā samaṅgībhūtā paricāriyamānā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi

meaning_1: finger tips; finger snap
Example1: seyyathā’pi, ānanda, balavā puriso appakasiren’eva accharaṃ pahareyya

meaning_1: celestial nymph; female nature divinity
Commentary: (SNa) accharāsaṅghaparivutā'ti accharā'ti devadhītānaṃ nāmaṃ, tāsaṃ samūhena parivutā.
Notes: (MW) from ap + √sṛ, going in the waters or between the waters of the clouds
Example1: bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, aññatarā tāvatiṃsakāyikā devatā nandane vane accharā-saṅghaparivutā dibbehi pañcahi kāmaguṇehi samappitā samaṅgībhūtā paricāriyamānā tāyaṃ velāyaṃ imaṃ gāthaṃ abhāsi
Example2:
accharā-gaṇasaṅghuṭṭhaṃ,
pisācagaṇasevitaṃ,
van'antaṃ mohanaṃ nāma,
kathaṃ yātrā bhavissatī'ti.

meaning_1: wonderful!; marvellous!; unbelievable!
Example1: acchariyaṃ, bhante, abbhutaṃ, bhante!

meaning_1: wonderful; marvellous; lit. like a nymph
Example1: apissu maṃ, bhikkhave, imā an-acchariyā gāthāyo paṭibhaṃsu pubbe assutapubbā

meaning_1: bright; clear; transparent
Example1: seyyathā’pi pabbatasaṅkhepe udakarahado accho vippasanno anāvilo. tattha cakkhumā puriso tīre ṭhito passeyya sippi-sambukam’pi sakkharakathalam’pi macchagumbam’pi, carantam’pi tiṭṭhantam’pi.

meaning_1: clothing; clothes; lit. covering
Example1: sa kho so, bhikkhave, bālo abyatto akusalo sūdo na c'eva lābhī hoti acchādanassa, na lābhī vetanassa, na lābhī abhihārānaṃ. taṃ kissa hetu?

meaning_1: dresses; clothes; give clothes (to)
Commentary: (VIN 1.4.8) acchādessāmī'ti dassāmi.
Example1: “iminā cīvaracetāpannena cīvaraṃ cetāpetvā itthan’nāmaṃ bhikkhuṃ cīvarena acchādessāmī”ti
Example3: ‘yaṃ kho, bhante, āyasmā veyyāvaccakaraṃ niddisi, saññatto so mayā, upasaṅkamatāyasmā kālena, cīvarena taṃ acchādessatī’ti.

meaning_1: having dressed (in); having clothed oneself (in); having put on
Example2: yan’nūn’āhaṃ kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajeyyan’ti.

meaning_1: dressed; clothed; lit. covered
Example1: ekam’ekañ'ca bhikkhuṃ paccekaṃ dussayugena acchādesi

meaning_1: pleased; gave pleasure (to the palate)
Example1: tesaṃ rasapathaviṃ aṅguliyā sāyataṃ acchādesi, taṇhā ca tesaṃ okkami.

meaning_1: unbroken; flawless; without cracks
Example1: seyyathā’pi, bhante, selo pabbato acchiddo asusiro ekagghano. atha puratthimāya ce'pi disāya āgaccheyya bhusā vātavuṭṭhi n'eva naṃ saṅkampeyya na sampakampeyya na sampavedheyya
Example2: bhikkhu yāni tāni sīlāni akhaṇḍāni acchiddāni asabalāni akammāsāni bhujissāni viññuppasatthāni aparāmaṭṭhāni samādhi-saṃvattanikāni

meaning_1: with flawless behaviour; with unbroken livelihood
ru_meaning: с безупречным поведением; честно зарабатывающий на жизнь
Example1:
yaṃ ce viññū pasaṃsanti,
anuvicca suve suve,
acchiddavuttiṃ medhāviṃ,
paññāsīlasamāhitaṃ.

meaning_1: takes back; snatches; tears away
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhussa sāmaṃ cīvaraṃ datvā, kupito anattamano, acchindeyya vā acchindāpeyya vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: stealing; robbing; depriving
Example1: mamāyite passatha phandamāne'ti mamāyitaṃ vatthuṃ accheda-saṃkino'pi phandanti, acchindante'pi phandanti, acchinne'pi phandanti

meaning_1: causes to take; makes snatch; causes to tear away
ru_meaning: заставляет взять; побуждает забрать; побуждает вырвать
Commentary: (VIN 1.4.25) acchindāpeyyā'ti aññaṃ āṇāpeti
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhussa sāmaṃ cīvaraṃ datvā, kupito anattamano, acchindeyya vā acchindāpeyya vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: cut off; broken off; removed
Example1:
niṭṭhaṅ’gato asantāsī, vītataṇho anaṅgaṇo,
acchindi bhavasallāni, antimo’yaṃ samussayo.

meaning_1: robbed; stolen; snatched; taken away
Commentary: (VIN 1.4.6) acchinnacīvaro nāma bhikkhussa cīvaraṃ acchinnaṃ hoti rājūhi vā corehi vā dhuttehi vā, yehi kehici vā acchinnaṃ hoti.
Example1: tatth’āyaṃ samayo: acchinna-cīvaro vā hoti bhikkhu naṭṭha cīvaro vā. ayaṃ tattha samayo.
Example2: mamāyitaṃ vatthuṃ accheda-saṃkino'pi phandanti, acchindante'pi phandanti, acchinne'pi phandanti

meaning_1: who's robe has been stolen
Commentary: (VIN 1.4.6) acchinnacīvaro nāma bhikkhussa cīvaraṃ acchinnaṃ hoti rājūhi vā corehi vā dhuttehi vā, yehi kehici vā acchinnaṃ hoti.
Example1: tatth’āyaṃ samayo: acchinnacīvaro vā hoti bhikkhu naṭṭha cīvaro vā. ayaṃ tattha samayo.

meaning_1: completely cut out; utterly severed; totally destroyed
ru_meaning: полностью отрезал; отделил совершенно; абсолютно уничтожил
Example1: bhikkhu sabb’āsava-saṃvara-saṃvuto viharati, acchecchi taṇhaṃ, vivattayi saṃyojanaṃ, sammā mān’ābhisamayā antam’akāsi dukkhassā’ti

meaning_1: stealing; theft; deprivation
Example1: mamāyite passatha phandamāne'ti mamāyitaṃ vatthuṃ accheda-saṃkino'pi phandanti, acchindante'pi phandanti, acchinne'pi phandanti

meaning_1: goat
Example1: aj’eḷakā ca gāvo ca, vividhā yattha haññare. na taṃ sammaggatā yaññaṃ, upayanti mah’esino.
Example2: aj’eḷaka-paṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti, kukkuṭasūkara-paṭiggahaṇā paṭivirato hoti

meaning_1: fasting; not eating; abstinence from food
ru_meaning: голодание; отказ от еды; воздержание от еды
Example1: ahañ'c'eva kho pana sabbaso ajaddhukaṃ paṭijāneyyaṃ, imā ca me devatā dibbaṃ ojaṃ lomakūpehi ajjhohāreyyuṃ, tāya c'āhaṃ yāpeyyaṃ, taṃ mam'assa musā'ti.

meaning_1: starvation; death from fasting
Notes: acc. as adv. of manner. SCPN §52
Example1: sace pan’āyaṃ kulaputto mah’āyo samāno kasiraṃ jīvikaṃ kappeti, tassa bhavanti vattāro — ajaddhumārikaṃ v'āyaṃ kulaputto marissatī'ti

meaning_1: forked; cloven; lit. goat foot
Example1: so passeyya mahantaṃ alagaddaṃ. tam'enaṃ ajapadena daṇḍena suniggahitaṃ niggaṇheyya. ajapadena daṇḍena suniggahitaṃ niggahitvā, gīvāya suggahitaṃ gaṇheyya.

meaning_1: unborn; uncreated; unproduced
ru_meaning: не рожденный; не сотворенный; не произведенный
Example1: no ce’taṃ abhavissa ajātaṃ abhūtaṃ akataṃ asaṅkhataṃ na’y’idha jātassa bhūtassa katassa saṅkhatassa nissaraṇaṃ paññāyetha.
Example2: yaṃ, bhikkhave, rūpaṃ ajātaṃ apātubhūtaṃ, bhavissatī'ti tassa saṅkhā, bhavissatī'ti tassa samaññā, bhavissatī'ti tassa paññatti

meaning_1: personal name of the king of Magadha; son of Bimbisāra; lit. unborn enemy
ru_meaning: имя царя Магадхи; сын Бимбисары; досл. не рожденный враг
Example1: tesaṃ rājā māgadho ajātasattu vedehiputto na labhati otāraṃ na labhati ārammaṇaṃ.

meaning_1: not knowing; ignorant of
Example1: jānato ahaṃ passato āsavānaṃ khayaṃ vadāmi, no ajānato no apassato. yoniso ca manasikāraṃ ayoniso ca manasikāraṃ.
Example2: “ajānam’evaṃ, āvuso, avacaṃ `jānāmi', apassaṃ `passāmi'. tucchaṃ musā vilapin”ti, aññatra adhimānā, ayam'pi pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

meaning_1: not knowing thus; not understanding like this
ru_meaning: не знающий это; не понимающий таким образом
Example1: āpanno visuddh’āpekkho evaṃ vadeyya: “ajānam’evaṃ, āvuso, avacaṃ `jānāmi', apassaṃ `passāmi'.

meaning_1: not knowing; not understanding
Construction:
na > a + jānā + nta + aṃ
na + jānanta + aṃ
Example1: so ajānaṃ vā āha, jānāmī'ti, jānaṃ vā āha, na jānāmī'ti, apassaṃ vā āha, passāmī'ti, passaṃ vā āha, na passāmī'ti.

meaning_1: having not known; having not understood
Example1: paṭipadāya na saṇṭhātī'ti paṭipattiyaṃ na tiṭṭhati, vattaṃ ajānitvā apucchitabbaṭṭhāne pucchatī'ti attho.

meaning_1: not being born; not coming into being; not arising
ru_meaning: не рождающийся; не возникающий; не появляющийся
Example1: tañ'hi'ssa, bhikkhu, n'atthi yena jāyetha, ajāyamāno kiṃ jīyissati, ajīyamāno kiṃ mīyissati, amīyamāno kiṃ kuppissati, akuppamāno kissa pihessati?

meaning_1: hide garment; cloth of animal fur (commonly worn by ascetics)
ru_meaning: накидка из шкуры; одеяние из меха животного (обычно носят аскеты)
Example1:
kiṃ te jaṭāhi dummedha, kiṃ te ajinasāṭiyā,
abbhantaraṃ te gahanaṃ, bāhiraṃ parimajjasī’ti.

meaning_1: hairy skin of an animal; animal hide; fur
ru_meaning: волосатая кожа животного; шкура животного; мех
Example1:
kiṃ te jaṭāhi dummedha, kiṃ te ajina-sāṭiyā,
abbhantaraṃ te gahanaṃ, bāhiraṃ parimajjasī’ti.

meaning_1: overpowered; defeated
Example1:
akkocchi maṃ avadhi maṃ, ajini maṃ ahāsi me.
ye ca taṃ upanayhanti, veraṃ tesaṃ na sammati.

meaning_1: not growing old; not getting old; not ageing
ru_meaning: не стареющий; не ветшающий; не дряхлеющий
Example1: tañ'hi'ssa, bhikkhu, n'atthi yena jāyetha, ajāyamāno kiṃ jīyissati, ajīyamāno kiṃ mīyissati, amīyamāno kiṃ kuppissati, akuppamāno kissa pihessati?

meaning_1: honourable; respectable; estimable; lit. not loathsome
ru_meaning: почитаемый; уважаемый; почтенный; досл. не вызывающий отвращение
Example1:
patilīno akuhako, apihālu amaccharī,
appagabbho ajeguccho, pesuṇeyye ca no yuto.

meaning_1: conquered; defeated
Example3: mā kho tumhe, āyasmanto, eso ajesi.

meaning_1: accepting goats and sheep

meaning_1: goats and sheep

meaning_1: today; now
Example1: so’haṃ ajja kathaṃ vajjaṃ, ahaṃ nicco’mhi sassato.
Example3: ajj’eva kiccam’ātappaṃ, ko jaññā maraṇaṃ suve. na hi no saṅgaran’tena, mahā-senena maccunā.

meaning_1: from today onwards; lit. this day the first
ru_meaning: с сегодняшнего дня; досл. этот день первый
Commentary: (SNPa) ajja’t’agge’ti ajjataṃ ādiṃ katvā, ajjadagge’ti vā pāṭho, da-kāro padasandhikaro, ajja aggaṃ katvā’ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Example1: upāsakaṃ maṃ bhagavā dhāretu ajja’t’agge pāṇ’upetaṃ saraṇaṃ gataṃ.
Example2: “ajja’t’agge te, āvuso, samaṇ'uddesa na c'eva so bhagavā satthā apadisitabbo

meaning_1: modern; related to today
Notes: ajjatanāṃ is nt acc sg, with metrically lengthened ā
Example1:
porāṇam'etaṃ atula, n'etaṃ ajjatanām'iva,
nindanti tuṇhim'āsīnaṃ, nindanti bahubhāṇinaṃ,
mitabhāṇim'pi nindanti, n'atthi loke anindito.

meaning_1: the present time; this day
Example1: ajja’t’agge’ti ajjataṃ ādiṃ katvā, ajja’d’agge’ti vā pāṭho, da-kāro padasandhikaro, ajja aggaṃ katvā’ti vuttaṃ hoti.

meaning_1: from today onwards; lit. this day the first
ru_meaning: с сегодняшнего дня; досл. этот день первый
Example1: ajja’t’agge’ti ajjataṃ ādiṃ katvā, ajja’d’agge’ti vā pāṭho, da-kāro padasandhikaro, ajja aggaṃ katvā’ti vuttaṃ hoti.

meaning_1: this night; this moonlit night; this bright night
ru_meaning: этой ночью; этой лунной ночью; этой яркой ночью
Example1: sace te, kassapa, agaru, viharemu ajjuṇho aggisālamhī’ti

meaning_1: this very day; just today; right now
ru_meaning: в этот же день; именно сегодня; сейчас
Example1: ajj'eva, bhikkhave, rājā pasenadi kosalo imaṃ rattiṃ dukkhaṃ seti parājito'ti.
Example2:
ajj’eva kiccam’ātappaṃ,
ko jaññā maraṇaṃ suve.
na hi no saṅgaran’tena,
mahā-senena maccunā.

meaning_1: (prefix)
Example1:
ajjhatta’bahiddhā vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati
anuddhato viharati ajjhattaṃ vūpasantacitto
Example2:
bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjha-bhāsi
yad-ajjha-gā sakya-munī samāhito

meaning_1: got; obtained; achieved; experienced
Example1:
na taṃ yāce yassa piyaṃ jigiṃse, desso hoti atiyācanāya,
nāgo maṇiṃ yācito brāhmaṇena, adassanaṃ'y'eva tad'ajjhagamā’ti.

meaning_1: obtained; was experienced; attained; got
Example1:
gahakāraka diṭṭho’si, puna gehaṃ na kāhasi,
sabbā te phāsukā bhaggā, gahakūṭaṃ visaṅkhataṃ,
visaṅkhāragataṃ cittaṃ, taṇhānaṃ khayam’ajjhagā.
Example2:
khayaṃ virāgaṃ amataṃ paṇītaṃ,
yad'ajjhagā sakya-munī samāhito.
na tena dhammena sam’atthi kiñci,

meaning_1: inner; internal; personal; in oneself
Construction:
adhi > adhy > ajjh + atta + a
adhi + atta
Example1:
idaṃ vadāmī'ti na tassa hoti, dhammesu niccheyya samuggahītaṃ,
passañ'ca diṭṭhīsu anuggahāya, ajjhatta-santiṃ pacinaṃ adassaṃ.
Example2: vitakka-vicārānaṃ vūpasamā ajjhattaṃ sampasādanaṃ cetaso ekodibhāvaṃ avitakkaṃ avicāraṃ samādhijaṃ pītisukhaṃ dutiyaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.

meaning_1: internally and externally
Example1: iti ajjhattaṃ vā kāye kāy’ānupassī viharati, bahiddhā vā kāye kāy’ānupassī viharati, ajjhatta’bahiddhā vā kāye kāyānupassī viharati;

meaning_1: with inner joy; happy within; finding delight inside
ru_meaning: с внутренней радостью; счастливый внутри; находящий радость внутри
Commentary: (DHPa) ajjhattarato'ti gocar'ajjhattasaṅkhātāya kammaṭṭhānabhāvanāya rato.
Example1:
hattha-saṃyato pāda-saṃyato, vācā-saṃyato saṃyat'uttamo,
ajjhattarato samāhito, eko santusito tam'āhu bhikkhuṃ.

meaning_1: internally; inwardly; personally; within himself
Example2: so iminā ariyena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato ajjhattaṃ anavajjasukhaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti
Example3: uddhaccakukkuccaṃ pahāya anuddhato viharati ajjhattaṃ vūpasantacitto, uddhaccakukkuccā cittaṃ parisodheti

meaning_1: internal; personal; in oneself
Example1: ‘cakkh’āyatanaṃ sot’āyatanaṃ ghān’āyatanaṃ jivh’āyatanaṃ kāy’āyatanaṃ man’āyatanaṃ — cha ajjhattikāni āyatanāni veditabbānī’ti
Example2: yaṃ vā pan'aññam'pia kiñci ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ kakkhaḷaṃ kharigataṃ upādinnaṃ, ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā pathavīdhātu

meaning_1: fell on; attacked; pounced on; swooped upon
Construction: adhi > adhy > ajjh + ā + pa + √ap + ta
Example1: bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, sakuṇagghi lāpaṃ sakuṇaṃ sahasā ajjhappattā aggahesi.

meaning_1: addressed; spoke (to)
Example2: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam’antaṃ aṭṭhāsi. ekam’antaṃ ṭhitā kho sā devatā bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi

meaning_1: arrived (at); reached; come to; become; entered
Example2: ‘vevaṇṇiy’amhi ajjhūpagato’ti, pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ.
English chant 2: Ten Subjects for Frequent Recollection by One Who Has Gone Forth

meaning_1: within the monastery; inside the monastery grounds
Construction:
adhi > adhy > ajjh + ā + √ram > rām + *a
adhi + ārāma
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.84) ajjhārāmo nāma parikkhittassa ārāmassa anto ārāmo, aparikkhittassa upacāro.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu ratanaṃ vā ratanasammataṃ vā, aññatra ajjhārāmā vā ajjhāvasathā vā, uggaṇheyya vā uggaṇhāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.
Example2: tathārūpesu sen'āsanesu viharanto pubbe appaṭisaṃviditaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā ajjhārāme sahatthā paṭiggahetvā

meaning_1: which overwhelms; which takes over; lit. growing up over
ru_meaning: овладевающий; подавляющий; досл. растущий вверх вокруг
Example1: kāmacchando, bhikkhave, āvaraṇo nīvaraṇo cetaso ajjhāruho paññāya dubbalīkaraṇo. byāpādo, bhikkhave, āvaraṇo nīvaraṇo cetaso ajjhāruho paññāya dubbalīkaraṇo.

meaning_1: envoy; representative; associate; member of the retinue
Example1: ajjhāvar’āmhā nandassa, bhoto santikam'āgatā

meaning_1: who lives in a home; who is domestically settled
Construction: adhi > adhy > ajjh + ā + vasa + tar
Commentary: (MNa) agāraṃ ajjhāvasatā agāramajjhe vasantena
Example1: sambādho ghar'āvāso rajāpatho, abbhokāso pabbajjā. na'y'idaṃ sukaraṃ agāraṃ ajjhāvasatā ek'antaparipuṇṇaṃ ek'antaparisuddhaṃ saṅkhalikhitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ.

meaning_1: lives in; inhabits; stays in; is settled in (a home)
Example1: idha ariyasāvako vigata-mala-maccherena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati muttacāgo payatapāṇi vossaggarato yācayogo dānasaṃvibhāgarato. ayaṃ vuccati cāgasampadā.

meaning_1: within a dwelling; inside a house
Construction:
adhi > adhy > ajjh + ā + √vas + a + tha
adhi + āvasatha
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.84) ajjhāvasatho nāma parikkhittassa āvasathassa anto āvasatho, aparikkhittassa upacāro.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu ratanaṃ vā ratanasammataṃ vā, aññatra ajjhārāmā vā ajjhāvasathā vā, uggaṇheyya vā uggaṇhāpeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: living (in); inhabiting; staying (in); settling (in)
Example2: na’y’idaṃ sukaraṃ agāraṃ ajjhāvasatā ek’anta-paripuṇṇaṃ ek’anta-parisuddhaṃ saṅkhalikhitaṃ brahmacariyaṃ carituṃ.

meaning_1: arrived (at); reached; come to; become; entered
Example1: ‘vevaṇṇiy’amhi ajjhupagato’ti, pabbajitena abhiṇhaṃ paccavekkhitabbaṃ.

meaning_1: looks on doing nothing; disregards; is indifferent to
ru_meaning: смотрит ничего не делая; не обращает внимания; равнодушен (к)
Construction: adhi > adhy > ajjh + upa + ikkha + ti
Example1: ukkāmukhe pakkhipitvā kālena kālaṃ abhidhamati, kālena kālaṃ udakena paripphoseti, kālena kālaṃ ajjhupekkhati.

meaning_1: equanimous observer (of); who looks on indifferently (at)
ru_meaning: который невозмутимо смотрит (на); кто спокойно наблюдает (за)
Example2: so tathāsamāhitaṃ cittaṃ sādhukaṃ ajjhupekkhitā hoti
Example3: so yaṃ taṃ abhijjhādomanassānaṃ pahānaṃ taṃ paññāya disvā sādhukaṃ ajjhupekkhitā hoti.

meaning_1: requests; invites; asks
Example1: saṅghagato kho pana anānākathiko hoti atiracchānakathiko. sāmaṃ vā dhammaṃ bhāsati, paraṃ vā ajjhesati, ariyaṃ vā tuṇhībhāvaṃ n'ātimaññati.

meaning_1: deeply down
Example1:
abhivaditabbaṃ ajjho-sitabbaṃ
ekaṃ ālopaṃ saṅkhāditvā ajjho-harāmi
tañ’ca ajjho-sa tiṭṭhati.

meaning_1: open air; outside
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu saṅghikaṃ mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā bhisiṃ vā kocchaṃ vā ajjhokāse santharitvā vā santharāpetvā vā taṃ pakkamanto n'eva uddhareyya na uddharāpeyya anāpucchā vā gaccheyya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: having plunged (into); having gone deeply (into)
Construction: adhi > adhy > ajjh + ava + gāhe + tvā
Example1: mahāvanaṃ ajjhogāhetvā beluvalaṭṭhikāya mūle divāvihāraṃ nisīdi

meaning_1: plunged (into); went deeply (into); immersed (in)
Construction: adhi > adhy > ajjh + ava + √gāh + ta > gāḍha > gāḷha
Example1: mohanaṃ vuccati kāmaguṇā. ettha hi devamanussā muyhanti, tesu ajjhogāḷho hutvā. etena bahiddhā-bandhanaṃ vuttaṃ.

meaning_1: blindly absorbed; obsessed; consumed; lit. completely gone down into
ru_meaning: вслепую поглощенный; одержимый; досл. полностью погруженный (в)
Commentary:
(DNa) ajjhopannā'ti adhiopannā ogāḷhā, idaṃ sāran'ti pariniṭṭhānappattā hutvā.
(MNa) ajjhopannā'ti taṇhāya ajjhogāḷhā.
Example1: tesaṃ gihī pasann'ākāraṃ karonti. te taṃ lābhaṃ gadhitā mucchitā ajjhopannā anādīnavadassāvino anissaraṇapaññā paribhuñjanti.

meaning_1: clinging; attaching; fixating; holding tightly
Example1:
rūpaṃ disvā sati muṭṭhā, piyaṃ nimittaṃ manasi karoto.
sāratta-citto vedeti, tañ’ca ajjhosa tiṭṭhati.

meaning_1: fixation (to); clinging (to); attachment (to)
Example1: yo imesu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu chando ālayo anunayo ajjhosānaṃ so dukkhasamudayo.

meaning_1: clinging; attaching; fixating; holding tightly
Example1: santi, bhikkhave, cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā, iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kām’ūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā. tañ’ce bhikkhu abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati

meaning_1: remains clinging; persists attaching; lit. stands fixating
ru_meaning: продолжает цепляться; остается привязанным; досл. стоит укрепляясь
Example1: santi, bhikkhave, cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā, iṭṭhā kantā manāpā piyarūpā kām’ūpasaṃhitā rajanīyā. tañ’ce bhikkhu abhinandati abhivadati ajjhosāya tiṭṭhati

meaning_1: fixed on; clung to; attached to
Example1: taṃ kissa hetu? dīgharattañ’h’etaṃ, bhikkhave, assutavato puthujjanassa ajjhositaṃ mamāyitaṃ parāmaṭṭhaṃ — ‘etaṃ mama, eso’ham’asmi, eso me attā’ti.

meaning_1: can be clung to; can be attached to; can be stuck (in)
ru_meaning: к которому можно привязаться; можно цепляться; можно погрязнуть (в)
Example1: ettha ce n’atthi abhinanditabbaṃ abhivaditabbaṃ ajjhositabbaṃ. es’ev’anto rāg’ānusayānaṃ

meaning_1: swallows; eats; takes food
Example1: ‘aho vat’āhaṃ tad'antaraṃ jīveyyaṃ yad'antaraṃ ekaṃ ālopaṃ saṅkhāditvā ajjhoharāmi, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā’ti.
Example2: te taṃ sarasiṃ ogāhetvā soṇḍāya bhisamuḷālaṃ abbuhetvā suvikkhālitaṃ vikkhāletvā akaddamaṃ saṅkhāditvā ajjhoharanti.

meaning_1: swallowed; devoured; ate
Example1: tam'enaṃ biḷāro gahetvā sahasā asaṅkhāditvā ajjhohari. tassa so mudumūsi antam'pi khādi, antaguṇam'pi khādi.

meaning_1: instils; suffuses; lit. causes to take (as a food)
ru_meaning: вливает; наполняет; досл. побуждает принять (как пищу)
Construction: adhi > adhy > ajjh + ava + hāre + ti
Example1: ahañ'c'eva kho pana sabbaso ajaddhukaṃ paṭijāneyyaṃ, imā ca me devatā dibbaṃ ojaṃ lomakūpehi ajjhohāreyyuṃ, tāya c'āhaṃ yāpeyyaṃ, taṃ mam'assa musā'ti.

meaning_1: not meditating; not contemplating
Example1:
n’atthi jhānaṃ apaññassa, paññā n’atthi a’jhāyato,
yamhi jhānañ’ca paññā ca, sa ve nibbāna-santike.

meaning_1: without knowledge; without understanding; without insight
ru_meaning: без знания; без понимания; без прозрения
Example1:
na diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena, sīlabbatenā'pi na suddhim'āha,
adiṭṭhiyā assutiyā añāṇā, asīlatā abbatā no'pi tena,
ete ca nissajja anuggahāya, santo anissāya bhavaṃ na jappe.

meaning_1: turns; cuts (on a lathe); lit. drags along
ru_meaning: вращает; режет (на токарном станке); досл. тянет
Example1: seyyathā’pi dakkho bhamakāro vā bhamakār’antevāsī vā dīghaṃ vā añchanto ‘dīghaṃ añchāmī’ti pajānāti, rassaṃ vā añchanto ‘rassaṃ añchāmī’ti pajānāti

meaning_1: turning; cutting (on a lathe); lit. dragging along
ru_meaning: вращающий; режущий (на токарном станке); досл. тянущий
Example1: seyyathā’pi dakkho bhamakāro vā bhamakār’antevāsī vā dīghaṃ vā añchanto ‘dīghaṃ añchāmī’ti pajānāti, rassaṃ vā añchanto ‘rassaṃ añchāmī’ti pajānāti

meaning_1: smeared with collyrium
ru_meaning: измазанный сурьмой; смазанный черным красящим веществом
Example2:
aṭṭhapadakatā kesā, nettā añjanamakkhitā.
alaṃ bālassa mohāya, no ca pāragavesino.

meaning_1: black-coloured; pitch-black
Example1: uddh'aggalomo kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo, uddh'aggāni lomāni jātāni nīlāni añjanavaṇṇāni kuṇḍal'āvaṭṭāni dakkhiṇ'āvaṭṭakajātāni

meaning_1: collyrium; black pigment; pitch-black colour; lit. smearing
ru_meaning: примочка для глаз; черное красящее вещество; черный как смоль цвет; досл. мазок
Example1: uddh'aggalomo kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo, uddh'aggāni lomāni jātāni nīlāni añjana-vaṇṇāni kuṇḍal'āvaṭṭāni dakkhiṇ'āvaṭṭakajātāni
Example2:
aṭṭha-pada-katā kesā, nettā añjana-makkhitā.
alaṃ bālassa mohāya, no ca pāragavesino.

meaning_1: eye ointment; lit. smearing
Commentary: (DNa) añjanan'ti dve vā tīṇi vā paṭalāni nīharaṇasamatthaṃ khār'añjanaṃ.
Example1: tassa so bhisakko sallakatto bhesajjaṃ kareyya, uddhaṃvirecanaṃ adhovirecanaṃ añjanaṃ paccañjanaṃ natthukammaṃ. so taṃ bhesajjaṃ āgamma cakkhūni uppādeyya, cakkhūni visodheyya.

meaning_1: box for ointment; unguent pot
ru_meaning: коробка для мази; горшок с мазью
Example2:
añjanī’va navā cittā, pūtikāyo alaṅkato.
alaṃ bālassa mohāya, no ca pāragavesino.

meaning_1: palms placed together (as a token of respect)
Example1: evaṃ vutte, brahmāyu brāhmaṇo uṭṭh'āyāsanā ek'aṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā, yena bhagavā ten'añjaliṃ paṇāmetvā tikkhattuṃ udānaṃ udāneti
Example2: yad'idaṃ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjali-karaṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa

meaning_1: worthy of being honoured; lit. should make anjali to
ru_meaning: достойный уважения; досл. следует сложить вместе ладони в жесте почтения
Example2: yad'idaṃ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa

meaning_1: one or other; all kinds
Example2: aññatar’aññatarena byasanena samannāgatassa, aññatar’aññatarena dukkha-dhammena phuṭṭhassa; soko, socanā, socitattaṃ, antosoko antoparisoko

meaning_1: any one (of); one or another
