Example1: yesaṃ bhikkhu aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā āpajjitvā na labhati bhikkhūhi saddhiṃ saṃvāsaṃ. yathā pure tathā pacchā, pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.
Example2: 'yadā'yaṃ kummo kacchapo soṇḍipañcamānaṃ aṅgānaṃ aññataraṃ vā aññataraṃ vā aṅgaṃ abhininnāmessati, tatth'eva naṃ gahetvā uddālitvā khādissāmī'ti.

meaning_1: a certain; a
Example1: tassa aññatarena gāḷhena rog’ātaṅkena phuṭṭhassa evaṃ hoti — ‘piyā vata maṃ kāmā jahissanti, piye c’āhaṃ kāme jahissāmī’ti.
Example2: atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkanta-vaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten’upasaṅkami

meaning_1: one (of); either one (of)
Example1: idha ekacco aññataraṃ devanikāyaṃ paṇidhāya brahmacariyaṃ carati — ‘imin’āhaṃ sīlena vā vatena vā tapena vā brahmacariyena vā devo vā bhavissāmi dev’aññataro vā’ti. ayaṃ vuccati amanussaggāho.
Example2: ye hi keci samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā anekavihitaṃ pubbenivāsaṃ anussaramānā anussaranti sabb’ete pañc’upādānakkhandhe anussaranti etesaṃ vā aññataraṃ.
Example3: niṭṭhite ca pubbakicce: sace so divaso cātuddasī-paṇṇarasī-sāmaggīnam'aññataro, yath'ājja uposatho paṇṇaraso.

meaning_1: who belongs to another sect; who follows another religion; lit. another fording place
ru_meaning: кто принадлежит к другой секте; кто следует другой религии; досл. другая переправа
Example1: atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etad’ahosi, atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carituṃ, yaṃ nūna mayaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten’upasaṅkameyyāmā’ti

meaning_1: who belonged to another sect before; who previously followed another religion; lit. another fording place before
ru_meaning: кто раньше принадлежал к другой секте; кто ранее исповедовал другую религию; досл. другое место брода до этого
Example1: yo kho, sabhiya, aññatitthiyapubbo imasmiṃ dhammavinaye ākaṅkhati pabbajjaṃ, ākaṅkhati upasampadaṃ, so cattāro māse parivasati.

meaning_1: from another
Example1:
na brāhmaṇo aññato suddhim'āha, diṭṭhe sute sīlavate mute vā,
puññe ca pāpe ca anūpalitto, attañjaho na'y'idha pakubbamāno.
Example2:
ajjhattam'ev'upasame, na aññato bhikkhu santim'eseyya,
ajjhattaṃ upasantassa, n'atthi attāṃ kuto nirattāṃ vā.

meaning_1: except at the right time; other than at the correct occasion
ru_meaning: кроме как в нужное время; кроме верных обстоятельств
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.23) aññatra samayā'ti ṭhapetvā samayaṃ.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhun’ūpassayaṃ upasaṅkamitvā bhikkhuniyo ovadeyya, aññatra samayā, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: apart (from); aside (from); other (than); except (for)
Commentary: (VIN 1.1.4) aññatra adhimānā'ti ṭhapetvā adhimānaṃ.
Example1: ‘na kho ahaṃ tassa sukhassa bhāyāmi, yaṃ taṃ sukhaṃ aññatr’eva kāmehi aññatra akusalehi dhammehī’ti.
Example2: “sañcetanikā sukka-vissaṭṭhi aññatra supin’antā saṅghādiseso”ti.
Example3: yo pana bhikkhu mātugāmassa uttarichappañcavācāhi dhammaṃ deseyya, aññatra viññunā purisaviggahena, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: without; nothing to do (with); completely separate (from); lit. just apart (from)
ru_meaning: без; не имеющий ничего общего (с); полностью отдельный (от); досл. именно кроме
Example1: yāh'ayaṃ, māgaṇḍiya, rati, aññatr'eva kāmehi aññatra akusalehi dhammehi, api dibbaṃ sukhaṃ samadhigayha tiṭṭhati, tāya ratiyā ramamāno hīnassa na pihemi, na tattha abhiramāmi.

meaning_1: change; alteration; lit. otherwise state
Example1: rañño'pi kho, bhikkhave, pasenadissa kosalassa atth'eva aññathattaṃ atthi vipariṇāmo. evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako tasmim'pi nibbindati.

meaning_1: change of mind; change of opinion; lit. otherwise state
ru_meaning: перемена в уме; изменение мнения; досл. иное состояние
Example1: atha khv’etaṃ, moghapurisa, appasannānañ’c’eva appasādāya, pasannānañ’ca ekaccānaṃ aññathattāyā”ti.
Example2: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, gahapati, alaṃ nu kho tassa purisassa aññathattāyā”ti?

meaning_1: differently; otherwise; lit. in another way
Example1:
yena yena hi maññanti, tato taṃ hoti aññathā,
etādiso vinābhāvo, passa lokassa pariyāyaṃ.
Example2:
aññathā lokanāthamhi, tiṭṭhante puris'uttame.
iriyaṃ āsi bhikkhūnaṃ, aññathā dāni dissati.

meaning_1: change; alteration; lit. being otherwise
Example1: alaṃ, ānanda, mā soci mā paridevi, nanu etaṃ, ānanda, mayā paṭikacc’eva akkhātaṃ – sabbeh’eva piyehi manāpehi nānābhāvo vinābhāvo aññathābhāvo
Example2: tassa ‘ahaṃ rūpaṃ, mama rūpan’ti pariyuṭṭhaṭṭhāyino taṃ rūpaṃ vipariṇamati aññathā hoti. tassa rūpavipariṇām’aññathābhāvā uppajjanti soka-parideva-dukkha-domanass’upāyāsā.

meaning_1: different existence; being elsewhere; another state of existence; lit. being otherwise
ru_meaning: другое существование; бытие в другом месте; другое состояние существования; досл. другое бытие
Example1:
jātimaraṇasaṃsāraṃ,
ye vajanti punappunaṃ,
itthabhāv'aññathābhāvaṃ,
avijjāy'eva sā gati.

meaning_1: changing; altering; lit. becoming otherwise
Example1: cakkhu aniccaṃ vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi. rūpā aniccā vipariṇāmino aññathābhāvino. itth’etaṃ dvayaṃ calañ’c’eva byathañ’ca aniccaṃ vipariṇāmi aññathābhāvi.

meaning_1: one thing ... another; in one way ... in another way
ru_meaning: одно ... другое; одним способом ... другим способом
Commentary: (SNa) aññathā santan'ti aññen'ākārena bhūtaṃ.
Example1:
aññathā santam'attānaṃ,
aññathā yo pavedaye,
nikacca kitavass'eva,
bhuttaṃ theyyena tassa taṃ.

meaning_1: alters; changes; becomes different
Example1: tassa ‘ahaṃ rūpaṃ, mama rūpan’ti pariyuṭṭhaṭṭhāyino taṃ rūpaṃ vipariṇamati aññathā hoti. tassa rūpavipariṇām’aññathābhāvā uppajjanti soka-parideva-dukkha-domanass’upāyāsā.

meaning_1: most certainly; indeed; only; lit. other it may be
ru_meaning: наверняка; определенно; только; досл. по другому может быть
Example1: tatra bhikkhu viveka-ninnena cittena viveka-poṇena viveka-pabbhārena viveka-ṭṭhena nekkhamm’ābhiratena añña'd'atthu uyyojanika-paṭisaṃyuttaṃ-y’eva kathaṃ kattā hoti

meaning_1: on the contrary; however; but; lit. different it may be
ru_meaning: с другой стороны; однако; напротив; но; досл. по другому может быть
Example1: ‘kiṃ nu kho ahaṃ añña'd'atthu bhaya-paṭikaṅkhī viharāmi? yaṃnūn’āhaṃ yathābhūtaṃ yathābhūtassa me taṃ bhayabheravaṃ āgacchati, tathābhūtaṃ tathābhūtova taṃ bhayabheravaṃ paṭivineyyan’ti
Example3: atha kho āyasmā raṭṭhapālo sakapitu nivesane n’eva dānaṃ alattha na paccakkhānaṃ, añña'd'atthu akkosam’eva alattha

meaning_1: (vinaya) belonging to another class; connected with another category (of offences)
ru_meaning: (виная) принадлежащий к другому классу; связанный с другой категорией (нарушений)
Commentary: (VIN 1.2.9) kathaṃ āpatt'ādhikaraṇaṃ āpatt'ādhikaraṇassa tabbhāgiyaṃ? methunadhammapārājik'āpatti methunadhammapārājik'āpattiyā tabbhāgiyā.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuṃ, duṭṭho doso appatīto, aññabhāgiyassa adhikaraṇassa kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāya pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃseyya

meaning_1: and if really belonging to another class; just if connected with another category
ru_meaning: и если действительно принадлежащий к другому классу; именно если связанный с другой категорией
Example1: aññabhāgiyañ’c'eva taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ hoti koci deso lesamatto upādinno bhikkhu ca dosaṃ patiṭṭhāti, saṅghādiseso.

meaning_1: mutual; one another; one to another
Example1:
“pariccajitvā saddhammaṃ, aññam’aññehi bhaṇḍare.
diṭṭhigatāni anventā, idaṃ seyyo’ti maññare.
Example2: hetu-paccayo, ārammaṇa-paccayo, adhipati-paccayo, anantara-paccayo, samanantara-paccayo, sahajāta-paccayo, aññam’añña-paccayo,

meaning_1: one to another
Example1: pañc'imāni, bho gotama, indriyāni nānāvisayāni nānāgocarāni, na aññam'aññassa gocaravisayaṃ paccanubhonti.
Example2:
na paro paraṃ nikubbetha, n’ātimaññetha katthaci naṃ kañci
byārosanā, paṭigha-saññā, n’āññam’aññassa dukkham’iccheyya.

meaning_1: admonishing to one another; speaking to each other
ru_meaning: наставление друг с друга; разговор друг с другом
Example1: āyasmā'pi bhikkhū vadetu sahadhammena bhikkhū'pi āyasmantaṃ vakkhanti sahadhammena, evaṃ saṃvaddhā hi tassa bhagavato parisā, yad'idaṃ aññam’añña’vacanena aññam’aññaṃ’vuṭṭhāpanenā”ti.

meaning_1: helping to rehabilitate each other; mutual support
ru_meaning: помощь реабилитировать друг друга; взаимная поддержка
Example1: āyasmā'pi bhikkhū vadetu sahadhammena bhikkhū'pi āyasmantaṃ vakkhanti sahadhammena, evaṃ saṃvaddhā hi tassa bhagavato parisā, yad'idaṃ aññam’añña-vacanena aññam’añña’vuṭṭhāpanenā”ti.

meaning_1: emancipation by another person; being freed by someone else
ru_meaning: избавление другим человеком; освобождение кем-то другим
Example1:
icchānidānā bhavasātabaddhā, te duppamuñcā na hi aññamokkhā,
pacchā pure vā'pi apekkhamānā, im'eva kāme purime'va jappaṃ.

meaning_1: dodging; changing topic; evasive speech; lit. talking different
ru_meaning: увиливание; изменение темы; уклончивая речь; досл. говорящий другое
Commentary: (VINa) ettha aññaṃ vadatī'ti aññavādakaṃ, aññen'aññaṃ paṭicaraṇass'etaṃ nāmaṃ.
Example1: aññavādake vihesake, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: one thing … another
Example1: vuccati cittaṃ iti’pi, mano iti’pi, viññāṇaṃ iti’pi, taṃ rattiyā ca divasassa ca aññadeva uppajjati aññaṃ nirujjhati.
Example2:
aññā hi lābh'ūpanisā, aññā nibbānagāminī,
evam'etaṃ abhiññāya, bhikkhu buddhassa sāvako,
sakkāraṃ n'ābhinandeyya, vivekam'anubrūhaye.

meaning_1: another; other; different
Example1: ambho purisa, na tvaṃ addasa manussesu itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā ābādhikaṃ dukkhitaṃ bāḷhagilānaṃ, sake muttakarīse palipannaṃ semānaṃ, aññehi vuṭṭhāpiyamānaṃ, aññehi saṃvesiyamānan’ti?
Example2: “nikkhipitvā garuṃ bhāraṃ, aññaṃ bhāraṃ anādiya. samūlaṃ taṇham’abbuyha, nicchāto parinibbuto”ti.

meaning_1: something more; something further; something else
ru_meaning: что-то большее; что-то дальше; что-то еще
Example1:
yaṃ taṃ apucchimha akittayī no,
aññaṃ taṃ pucchāma tad'iṅgha brūhi,
ettāvat'aggaṃ nu vadanti h'eke,
yakkhassa suddhiṃ idha paṇḍitāse,
udāhu aññam'pi vadanti etto.

meaning_1: ignorance (of); lack of understanding (of); not knowing (about)
Example2: dukkhe aññāṇaṃ, dukkhasamudaye aññāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhe aññāṇaṃ, dukkhanirodhagāminiyā paṭipadāya aññāṇaṃ.

meaning_1: ignorance (of); lack of understanding (of); not knowing (about)
Example1: na ca tassa bhikkhuno aññāṇakena mutti atthi, yañ’ca tattha āpattiṃ āpanno tañ’ca yathādhammo kāretabbo, uttari c'assa moho āropetabbo

meaning_1: unrelated; not blood-related; lit. unknown
ru_meaning: не родственный; не связанный кровью; досл. не знакомый
Commentary: (VIN 1.4.4) aññātikā nāma mātito vā pitito vā yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā asambaddhā.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu aññātakaṃ gahapatiṃ vā gahapatāniṃ vā cīvaraṃ viññāpeyya, aññatra samayā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ. tatth’āyaṃ samayo: acchinnacīvaro vā hoti bhikkhu naṭṭha cīvaro vā. ayaṃ tattha samayo.

meaning_1: for the sake of understanding; for the purpose of knowledge
Commentary: (ANa) aññāt'atthan'ti jānan'atthaṃ.
Example1:
aññāt'atthaṃ pasād'atthaṃ, sataṃ ve hoti mantanā,
evaṃ kho ariyā mantenti, esā ariyāna mantanā,
etad'aññāya medhāvī, na samusseyya mantaye'ti.

meaning_1: should be understood (by); to be known (by)
ru_meaning: следует быть понят (кем-то); должен быть известен (кому-то)
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.71) aññātabban'ti jānitabbaṃ.
Example1: sikkhamānena, bhikkhave, bhikkhunā aññātabbaṃ, paripucchitabbaṃ, paripañhitabbaṃ. ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.

meaning_1: who understands; who comprehends
Example1: saṃkhittena'pi kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, dhammaṃ deseyyaṃ, vitthārena'pi kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, dhammaṃ deseyyaṃ, saṃkhittavitthārena'pi kho ahaṃ, sāriputta, dhammaṃ deseyyaṃ, aññātāro ca dullabhā'ti.
Example2:
uṭṭhehi vīra vijitasaṅgāma,
satthavāha aṇaṇa vicara loke,
desassu bhagavā dhammaṃ,
aññātāro bhavissantī'ti.

meaning_1: (in debate) assertion about what is known
ru_meaning: (в дискуссии) утверждение о том что известно
Commentary: (ANa) aññātavāde saṇṭhātī'ti imaṃ pañhaṃ pucchitvā, suṭṭhu te pañho pucchito, pucchantena nāma evaṃ pucchitabban'ti vutte sampaṭicchati, vimatiṃ na uppādeti. pañhaṃ kathetvā'pi, suṭṭhu te pañho kathito, kathentena nāma evaṃ kathetabban'ti vutte sampaṭicchati, vimatiṃ na uppādeti.
Example1: sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno ṭhān'āṭhāne na saṇṭhāti parikappe na saṇṭhāti aññātavāde na saṇṭhāti paṭipadāya na saṇṭhāti

meaning_1: not known; unknown; not recognised
Example1: seyyathā’pi dovāriko hoti paṇḍito byatto medhāvī aññātānaṃ nivāretā ñātānaṃ pavesetā, evam’evaṃ kho ariyasāvako satimā hoti paramena satinepakkena samannāgato cirakatam’pi cirabhāsitam’pi saritā anussaritā.

meaning_1: known; understood
Example1: sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno ṭhān'āṭhāne na saṇṭhāti parikappe na saṇṭhāti aññāta-vāde na saṇṭhāti paṭipadāya na saṇṭhāti

meaning_1: the faculty of (having) complete insight
Example1: tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, indriyāni. katamāni tīṇi? anaññātaññassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ'indriyaṃ, aññātāv'indriyaṃ
Example2: saddh’indriyaṃ, viriy’indriyaṃ, sat’indriyaṃ, samādh’indriyaṃ, paññ’indriyaṃ, anaññātaññassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ’indriyaṃ, aññātāv’indriyaṃ.

meaning_1: who is enlightened; who has final knowledge; who possesses perfect knowledge; lit. who has understood
ru_meaning: просветленный; обладающий высшим знанием; абсолютным пониманием; досл. тот кто понял
Example1: tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, indriyāni. katamāni tīṇi? anaññātaññassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ'indriyaṃ, aññātāv'indriyaṃ
Example2: saddh’indriyaṃ, viriy’indriyaṃ, sat’indriyaṃ, samādh’indriyaṃ, paññ’indriyaṃ, anaññātaññassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ’indriyaṃ, aññātāv’indriyaṃ.

meaning_1: unrelated; not blood-related
Commentary: (VIN 1.4.4) aññātikā nāma mātito vā pitito vā yāva sattamā pitāmahayugā asambaddhā.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu aññātikāya bhikkhuniyā purāṇacīvaraṃ dhovāpeyya vā rajāpeyya vā ākoṭāpeyya vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: to know; to understand
Example1: dūrato'pi kho mayaṃ, bhante, āgaccheyyāma āyasmato sāriputtassa santike etassa bhāsitassa attham'aññātuṃ

meaning_1: breakthrough to spiritual insight; penetration to final knowledge
ru_meaning: прорыв к духовному прозрению; проникновение в окончательное знание
Example1: iti kho, bhikkhave, yāvatā saññāsamāpatti tāvatā aññāpaṭivedho.

meaning_1: understanding; comprehending; knowing
Example1:
etañ'hi tumhe paṭipannā, dukkhass'antaṃ karissatha,
akkhāto vo mayā maggo, aññāya sallakantanaṃ.
Example2:
sace c'assa kathākāmo, kālam'aññāya paṇḍito,
dhammaṭṭhapaṭisaṃyuttā, yā ariyacaritā kathā.

meaning_1: by gnosis; with spiritual insight; by enlightenment
Example1:
yass'ālayā na vijjanti, aññāya akathaṃkathī,
amat'ogadham'anuppattaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

meaning_1: peace of gnosis; calm of enlightenment
Example1:
ye ca phassaṃ pariññāya,
aññāy'upasame ratā,
te ve phass'ābhisamayā,
nicchātā parinibbutā'ti.

meaning_1: attainment of final knowledge; accomplishment in spiritual insight
ru_meaning: достижение окончательного знания; совершенство в духовном прозрении
Example1: kathañ’ca, bhikkhave, anupubbasikkhā anupubbakiriyā anupubbapaṭipadā aññ’ārādhanā hoti?

meaning_1: knew; understood
Example1: ‘upaṭṭhaheyyaṃ taṃ, bhante’ti, tadā’pi so vadhako’va. vadhakañ’ca pana santaṃ na aññāsi — ‘vadhako me’ti.

meaning_1: spiritual insight; enlightenment; lit. understanding
Example1: iti kho, bhikkhave, yāvatā saññā-samāpatti tāvatā aññā-paṭivedho
Example2: saddh’indriyaṃ, viriy’indriyaṃ, sat’indriyaṃ, samādh’indriyaṃ, paññ’indriyaṃ, anaññātaññassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ’indriyaṃ, aññātāv’indriyaṃ.

meaning_1: to understanding; for comprehension
Commentary: (MNa) na aññā'ti jānan'atthāya cittaṃ na upaṭṭhapenti.
Example1: tassa sāvakā na sussūsanti, na sotaṃ odahanti, na aññā cittaṃ upaṭṭhapenti, vokkamma ca satthusāsanā vattanti.

meaning_1: the faculty of knowing; the power of insight
Example1: tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, indriyāni. katamāni tīṇi? anaññātaññassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ'indriyaṃ, aññātāv'indriyaṃ
Example2: saddh’indriyaṃ, viriy’indriyaṃ, sat’indriyaṃ, samādh’indriyaṃ, paññ’indriyaṃ, anaññātaññassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ’indriyaṃ, aññātāv’indriyaṃ.

meaning_1: others; other people; the rest
Example1: tañ’ce bhikkhuṃ aññe bhikkhū jāneyyuṃ: nisinnapubbaṃ iminā bhikkhunā dvattikkhattuṃ pātimokkhe uddissamāne, ko pana vādo bhiyyo'ti
Example2:
“rājā ca aññe ca bahū manussā, avītataṇhā maraṇaṃ upenti.
ūnā’va hutvāna jahanti dehaṃ, kāmehi lokamhi na h’atthi titti.

meaning_1: one (thing) with another
Example1: sac’āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno aññen’aññaṃ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeti, kopañ’ca dosañ’ca appaccayañ’ca pātukaroti, evaṃ sant’āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.

meaning_1: dodges one question with another; evades one question with another; lit. walking back one thing with another
ru_meaning: уклоняется от одного вопроса другим; досл. ходит назад одной вещью с другой
Commentary: (VINa) īdisaṃ tayā kiñci diṭṭhan'ti puṭṭho, na suṇāmī'ti sotam'upanento vā, sotadvāre pucchantānaṃ cakkhuṃ upanento vā, aññen'aññaṃ paṭicaratī'ti veditabbo.
Example1: sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno aññen'aññaṃ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeti, kopañ'ca dosañ'ca appaccayañ'ca pātukaroti

meaning_1: by one other; by just one more
Example1: siyā aññena'pi pariyāyena sammā dvayat'ānupassanā'ti, iti ce, bhikkhave, pucchitāro assu, siyā'ti'ssu vacanīyā.

meaning_1: one (thing) with another
Example1: so bhikkhu bhikkhūhi āpattiyā codiyamāno aññen'āññaṃ paṭicarati, bahiddhā kathaṃ apanāmeti

meaning_1: even others; even other people
Example1:
hananti bhogā dummedhaṃ, no ca pāragavesino,
bhogataṇhāya dummedho, hanti aññ'eva attanaṃ.

meaning_1: looking for faults (to attack) in one another
ru_meaning: ищущий недостатки друг друга (для того чтобы атаковать)
Commentary: (ANa) añño'ññavivar'esino'ti aññam'aññassa chiddaṃ aparādhaṃ gavesamānā.
Example1:
ye viruddhā sallapanti, viniviṭṭhā samussitā,
anariyaguṇam'āsajja, añño'ññavivar'esino.

meaning_1: one another; mutual
Example1:
ye viruddhā sallapanti, viniviṭṭhā samussitā,
anariyaguṇam'āsajja, añño'ñña-vivar'esino.
Example2:
dubbhāsitaṃ vikkhalitaṃ, sampamohaṃ parājayaṃ,
añño'ññass'ābhinandanti, tadariyo katha-n'ācare.

meaning_1: frame of a bed
Example1: navaṃ pana bhikkhunā mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā kārayamānena aṭṭh’aṅgulapādakaṃ kāretabbaṃ sugat’aṅgulena, aññatra heṭṭhimāya aṭaniyā.

meaning_1: unrest in the wilderness; disturbance in the countryside; (comm) invasion of forest thieves
ru_meaning: волнения в дикой местности; беспорядки в сельской местности; (комм) нашествие лесных воров
Commentary: (ANa) aṭavisaṅkopo'ti aṭaviyā saṅkopo. aṭavī'ti c'ettha aṭavivāsino corā veditabbā. yadā hi te aṭavito janapadaṃ otaritvā gāmanigamarājadhāniyo paharitvā vilumpanti, tadā aṭavisaṅkopo nāma hoti, taṃ sandhāy'etaṃ vuttaṃ.
Example1: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, hoti so samayo yaṃ bhayaṃ hoti aṭavisaṅkopo, cakkasamāruḷhā jānapadā pariyāyanti.

meaning_1: wilderness; forest; countryside
Example1: puna caparaṃ, bhikkhave, hoti so samayo yaṃ bhayaṃ hoti aṭavi-saṅkopo, cakkasamāruḷhā jānapadā pariyāyanti.

meaning_1: afflicted (with); suffering (with); hurt (by)
Example1: tañ'ca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, kulaputtā upenti atthavasikā, atthavasaṃ paṭicca; n'eva rāj'ābhinītā, na cor'ābhinītā, na iṇ'aṭṭā, na bhay'aṭṭā, na ājīvikāpakatā;

meaning_1: is troubled (by); is repelled (by); is perturbed (by)
Commentary: (MNa) aṭṭiyeyyā'ti aṭṭo dukkhito bhaveyya.
Example1: seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko ahikuṇapena vā kukkurakuṇapena vā manussakuṇapena vā kaṇṭhe āsattena aṭṭiyeyya harāyeyya jiguccheyya.

meaning_1: is troubled (by); is repelled (by); is perturbed (by)
Example1: pathaviyaṃ sucim’pi vā asucim’pi vā gūtha-gatam’pi vā mutta-gatam’pi vā kheḷa-gatam’pi vā pubba-gatam’pi vā lohita-gatam’pi nikkhipanti, na ca tena pathavī aṭṭīyati vā harāyati vā jigucchati vā
Example2: idh’ānanda, bhikkhu sabbasaṅkhāresu aṭṭīyati harāyati jigucchati. ayaṃ vuccat’ānanda, sabbasaṅkhāresu anicchāsaññā.

meaning_1: is troubled by, ashamed of and disgusted with
Example1: evam’evaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante, iminā pūtikāyena aṭṭīyāmi harāyāmi jigucchāmi.
Example2: idh’ānanda, bhikkhu sabbasaṅkhāresu aṭṭīyati harāyati jigucchati. ayaṃ vuccat’ānanda, sabbasaṅkhāresu anicchāsaññā.

meaning_1: being troubled (by); being repelled (by); being perturbed (by)
Example1: santi kho tassa bhagavato sāvakā kāyena ca jīvitena ca aṭṭīyamānā harāyamānā jigucchamānā satthahārakaṃ pariyesanti, taṃ me idaṃ apariyiṭṭhaññ’eva satthahārakaṃ laddhan’ti.

meaning_1: should be troubled (by); should be worried (about); lit. to be troubled (by)
ru_meaning: должен быть обеспокоен; следует возмущаться (о); досл. может быть обеспокоенным
Example1: evarūpaṃ pana te, rāhula, manokammaṃ aṭṭīyitabbaṃ harāyitabbaṃ jigucchitabbaṃ, aṭṭīyitvā harāyitvā jigucchitvā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjitabbaṃ.

meaning_1: should be troubled, ashamed and disgusted; should be distressed disturbed and repulsed
ru_meaning: следует беспокоиться, стыдиться и испытывать отвращение
Example1: evarūpaṃ pana te, rāhula, manokammaṃ aṭṭīyitabbaṃ harāyitabbaṃ jigucchitabbaṃ, aṭṭīyitvā harāyitvā jigucchitvā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjitabbaṃ.

meaning_1: having been troubled (by); having been perturbed (by)
Example1: evarūpaṃ pana te, rāhula, manokammaṃ aṭṭīyitabbaṃ harāyitabbaṃ jigucchitabbaṃ, aṭṭīyitvā harāyitvā jigucchitvā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjitabbaṃ.

meaning_1: having been troubled (by), ashamed (of) and disgusted (with); having been distressed disturbed and repulsed
ru_meaning: обеспокоившись, постыдившись и испытав отвращение (к); возмутившись, встревожившись и отвергнув
Example1: evarūpaṃ pana te, rāhula, manokammaṃ aṭṭīyitabbaṃ harāyitabbaṃ jigucchitabbaṃ, aṭṭīyitvā harāyitvā jigucchitvā āyatiṃ saṃvaraṃ āpajjitabbaṃ.

meaning_1: commentary; exegesis; lit. talk about meaning
ru_meaning: комментарий; толкование; досл. беседа о значении
Example1: sukhaṃ {so sukhaṃ (sī. syā. kaṃ. pī.) ma. ni. 3.364 aṭṭhakathā-ṭīkā oloketabbā} ce vedanaṃ vedayati, visaṃyutto naṃ vedayati.

meaning_1: belonging to the Aṭṭhakavagga; from fourth chapter of the Sutta Nipāta; lit. consisting of groups of eight
ru_meaning: принадлежащий Аттхакавагге; из четвертой глава Сутта Нипаты; досл. состоит из групп по восемь
Example1: ekam'antaṃ nisinno kho hāliddikāni gahapati āyasmantaṃ mahākaccānaṃ etad'avoca, vuttam'idaṃ, bhante, bhagavatā aṭṭhakavaggiye māgaṇḍiyapañhe

meaning_1: poem with eight stanzas; lit. with eight
ru_meaning: стихотворение из восьми строф; досл. с восемью
Example1: suddh'aṭṭhaka-suttaṃ catutthaṃ niṭṭhitaṃ.

meaning_1: with 8 parts; 8 limbed; eight-fold; having eight constituents
ru_meaning: имеющий восемь частей; восьми ступенчатый; с восемью элементами
Example2: ayam’eva ariyo aṭṭh’aṅgiko maggo seyyath’īdaṃ sammā-diṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākammanto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.

meaning_1: with legs measuring eight inches
Example1: navaṃ pana bhikkhunā mañcaṃ vā pīṭhaṃ vā kārayamānena aṭṭh’aṅgulapādakaṃ kāretabbaṃ sugat’aṅgulena, aññatra heṭṭhimāya aṭaniyā.

meaning_1: thirty-eight (38)
Example1: idāni kho pana dve-sahassa-pañca-sata-aṭṭhatiṃsati saṃvaccharāni c’eva, navamāsāni ca, catuvīsati-divasāni atikkantāni.

meaning_1: arranged in eight way, plaited eightfold
ru_meaning: разделен на восемь частей, сплетен восьмеркой
Example2:
aṭṭhapadakatā kesā, nettā añjana-makkhitā.
alaṃ bālassa mohāya, no ca pāragavesino.

meaning_1: in eight way, eightfold
Example2:
aṭṭhapada-katā kesā, nettā añjana-makkhitā.
alaṃ bālassa mohāya, no ca pāragavesino.

meaning_1: eighth (8th)
Example1: sahadhammika-vaggo aṭṭhamo.
Example2:
ye ariya-saccāni vibhāvayanti, gambhīra-paññena sudesitāni.
kiñ’c’āpi te honti bhusaṃ pamattā, na te bhavaṃ aṭṭhamam’ādiyanti.

meaning_1: one hundred and eight (108)
Example1: aṭṭhārasā’pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena; chattiṃsā’pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena; aṭṭhasatam’pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena.
Example2: katamañ'ca, bhikkhave, aṭṭhasataṃ vedanā? atītā chattiṃsa vedanā, anāgatā chattiṃsa vedanā, paccuppannā chattiṃsa vedanā — imā vuccanti, bhikkhave, aṭṭhasataṃ vedanā.

meaning_1: twenty eight (28)
Example1: idāni kho pana dve-sahassa-pañca-sata-tesaṭṭhi saṃvaccharāni c’eva, navamāsāni ca, aṭṭhavīsati-divasāni atikkantāni.

meaning_1: they stood
Example1: atha kho sambahulā sat'ullapakāyikā devatāyo abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu.
Example2: atha kho sambahulā ujjhānasaññikā devatāyo abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkamiṃsu, upasaṅkamitvā vehāsaṃ aṭṭhaṃsu.

meaning_1: eight (8)
Example2: yad'idaṃ cattāri purisayugāni aṭṭha purisapuggalā esa bhagavato sāvakasaṅgho, āhuneyyo pāhuneyyo dakkhiṇeyyo añjalikaraṇīyo anuttaraṃ puññakkhettaṃ lokassa
Example3: ayam’eva ariyo aṭṭh’aṅgiko maggo seyyath’īdaṃ sammā-diṭṭhi sammāsaṅkappo sammāvācā sammākammanto sammāājīvo sammāvāyāmo sammāsati sammāsamādhi.

meaning_1: abbreviation of aṭṭhakathā (commentary)
Example1: tesaṃ sudaṃ āyasmā mahāmoggallāno cetasā cittaṃ samannesati {samanvesati (syā. aṭṭha.)} vippamuttaṃ nirupadhiṃ.

meaning_1: eighteen (18)
Example1: aṭṭhārasā’pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena; chattiṃsā’pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena; aṭṭhasatam’pi mayā vedanā vuttā pariyāyena.
Example2: aṭṭhārasa dhātuyo: cakkhu-dhātu rūpa-dhātu cakkhu-viññāṇa-dhātu, sota-dhātu sadda-dhātu sota-viññāṇa-dhātu,

meaning_1: stood; stayed; remained
Example2: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam’antaṃ aṭṭhāsi. ekam’antaṃ ṭhitā kho sā devatā bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi
Example3: tatra'pi evaṃ aṭṭhāsiṃ evaṃ nisīdiṃ evaṃ abhāsiṃ evaṃ tuṇhī ahosiṃ

meaning_1: remained; persisted; continued; lit. stood
Example1: “mā, āyasmā, samaggassa saṅghassa bhedāya parakkami bhedanasaṃvattanikaṃ vā adhikaraṇaṃ samādāya paggayha aṭṭhāsi.

meaning_1: bone
Example1: puna caparaṃ bhikkhu seyyathā’pi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ aṭṭhika-saṅkhalikaṃ sa’maṃsa-lohitaṃ nhāru-sambandhaṃ

meaning_1: skeleton; bones; lit. chain of bones
Example1: tam’enaṃ dakkho goghātako vā goghātak’antevāsī vā aṭṭhikaṅkalaṃ sunikkantaṃ nikkantaṃ nimmaṃsaṃ lohitamakkhitaṃ upacchubheyya.
Example2: “aṭṭhikaṅkal'ūpamā kāmā appassād'aṭṭhenā”ti passanto vikkhambhanato kāme parivajjeti

meaning_1: like a skeleton; similar to a skeleton; lit. like a chain of bones
ru_meaning: как скелет; похож на скелет; досл. как цепь костей
Commentary: (MNa) aṭṭhikaṅkalūpamā appassād'aṭṭhena.
Example1: app'assādā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo. aṭṭhikaṅkal'ūpamā kāmā vuttā bhagavatā bahudukkhā bah'upāyāsā, ādīnavo ettha bhiyyo.

meaning_1: skeleton; bones; lit. chain of bones
Example1: puna caparaṃ bhikkhu seyyathā’pi passeyya sarīraṃ sivathikāya chaḍḍitaṃ aṭṭhikasaṅkhalikaṃ sa’maṃsa-lohitaṃ nhāru-sambandhaṃ

meaning_1: made of bone
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.86) aṭṭhi nāma yaṃ kiñci aṭṭhi.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu aṭṭhimayaṃ vā dantamayaṃ vā visāṇamayaṃ vā sūcigharaṃ kārāpeyya, bhedanakaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: these eight
Example1: aṭṭh'imāni, bhikkhave, abhibh'āyatanāni. katamāni aṭṭha? ajjhattaṃ rūpasaññī eko bahiddhā rūpāni passati parittāni suvaṇṇadubbaṇṇāni, tāni abhibhuyya jānāmi passāmī'ti

meaning_1: marrow of the bone
Example2: ‘atthi imasmiṃ kāye kesā lomā nakhā dantā taco maṃsaṃ nhāru aṭṭhi aṭṭhimiñjaṃ vakkaṃ hadayaṃ yakanaṃ kilomakaṃ

meaning_1: these eight
Example1: aṭṭh'ime, bhikkhave, hetū aṭṭha paccayā ādibrahmacariyikāya paññāya appaṭiladdhāya paṭilābhāya

meaning_1: wanting; needing; desiring; seeking
Example2:
sīta-vāta-parittāṇaṃ, hirikopīna-chādanaṃ.
matt’aṭṭhiyaṃ abhuñjiṃsu, santuṭṭhā itar’ītare.

meaning_1: having focused; having paid attention; lit. having made value
ru_meaning: сосредоточившись (на); обратив внимание; досл. сделав ценным
Commentary: (VINa) aṭṭhiṃ katvā'ti atthikabhāvaṃ katvā, atthiko hutvā'ti vuttaṃ hoti.
Example1: “tassa te, āvuso, alābhā, tassa te dulladdhaṃ, yaṃ tvaṃ pātimokkhe uddissamāne na sādhukaṃ aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi karosī’ti

meaning_1: a bone
Example1: kāmaṃ taco ca nahāru ca aṭṭhi ca avasissatu, sarīre upasussatu maṃsa-lohitaṃ
Example2: ‘atthi imasmiṃ kāye kesā lomā nakhā dantā taco maṃsaṃ nhāru aṭṭhi aṭṭhimiñjaṃ vakkaṃ hadayaṃ yakanaṃ kilomakaṃ pihakaṃ papphāsaṃ
Example3:
passa cittakataṃ rūpaṃ, maṇinā kuṇḍalena ca.
aṭṭhiṃ tacena onaddhaṃ, saha vatthehi sobhati.

meaning_1: meaning; sense; significance
Example1: “tassa te, āvuso, alābhā, tassa te dulladdhaṃ, yaṃ tvaṃ pātimokkhe uddissamāne na sādhukaṃ aṭṭhiṃ katvā manasi karosī’ti

meaning_1: with meaning; in the sense of; should be understood as
ru_meaning: со значением; в смысле; следует понимать как
Example1: yadi duppūraṇ'aṭṭhena yadi vā samuddan'aṭṭhena samuddo, cakkhum'eva samuddo.
Example2: “aṭṭhikaṅkal'ūpamā kāmā appassād'aṭṭhenā”ti passanto vikkhambhanato kāme parivajjeti

meaning_1: (in debate) opposing position; counter-premise; lit. non-position
ru_meaning: (в дебатах) противоположная позиция; встречный аргумент; досл. не позиция
Commentary: (ANa) ṭhān'āṭhāne na saṇṭhātī'ti kāraṇ'ākāraṇe na saṇṭhāti.
Example1: sac'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo pañhaṃ puṭṭho samāno ṭhāna-aṭhāne na saṇṭhāti parikappe na saṇṭhāti aññātavāde na saṇṭhāti paṭipadāya na saṇṭhāti, evaṃ sant'āyaṃ, bhikkhave, puggalo akaccho hoti.

meaning_1: two and a half; lit. three minus half
ru_meaning: два с половиной; досл. три минус половина
Example1: `diyaḍḍho māso seso gimhānan'ti vassānassa paṭhamo māso – icc'ete aḍḍhateyya-māsā uṇhasamayo, pariḷāhasamayo, gilānasamayo, kammasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo, vātavuṭṭhisamayo.
Example2: vassikasāṭikaṃ pana bhikkhunā kārayamānena pamāṇikā kāretabbā. tatr'idaṃ pamāṇaṃ: dīghaso cha vidatthiyo sugatavidatthiyā, tiriyaṃ aḍḍhateyyā.

meaning_1: two and a half months
Example1: `diyaḍḍho māso seso gimhānan'ti vassānassa paṭhamo māso – icc'ete aḍḍhateyyamāsā uṇhasamayo, pariḷāhasamayo, gilānasamayo, kammasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo, vātavuṭṭhisamayo.

meaning_1: half a man's height; half a fathom deep
ru_meaning: в половину роста человека; пол сажени глубиной
Example1: hoti kho so, āvuso, samayo yaṃ mahāsamudde aḍḍhaporisam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, kaṭimattam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, jāṇukamattam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti, gopphakamattam'pi udakaṃ saṇṭhāti.

meaning_1: half a month; fortnight; 14 or 15 days
Example1: “māso seso gimhānan”ti bhikkhunā vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyesitabbaṃ, `addhamāso seso gimhānan'ti katvā nivāsetabbaṃ.

meaning_1: half
Example1: ‘aho vat’āhaṃ tad'antaraṃ jīveyyaṃ yad'antaraṃ up’aḍḍha-piṇḍapātaṃ bhuñjāmi, bhagavato sāsanaṃ manasi kareyyaṃ, bahu vata me kataṃ assā’ti.

meaning_1: wealthy; rich; loaded; (comm) with power
ru_meaning: состоятельный; богатый; при деньгах; (комм) с властью
Commentary: (SNa) aḍḍhā'ti issarā
Example1: seyyathā’pi, āvuso yamaka, gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā aḍḍho mahaddhano mahābhogo; so ca ārakkha-sampanno.

meaning_1: subtle; tiny; minute; atomic
Example2:
ye keci pāṇa-bhūt’atthi, tasā vā thāvarā vā anavasesā,
dīghā vā ye mahantā vā, majjhimā rassak’āṇuka-thūlā.

meaning_1: tiniest; smallest; lit. atom sized
ru_meaning: очень маленький; крошечный; досл. размером с  мельчайшую частицу
Example1:
yāva hi vanatho na chijjati, aṇumatto'pi narassa nārisu,
paṭibaddhamano'va tāva so, vaccho khīrapako'va mātari.
Example2: ‘ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, sīlavā hohi, pātimokkha-saṃvara-saṃvuto viharāhi ācāra-gocara-sampanno aṇumattesu vajjesu bhaya-dassāvī, samādāya sikkhassu sikkhāpadesū’ti

meaning_1: a very small; subtle; trivial
Example2: passatha no tumhe taṃ vacanapathaṃ, aṇuṃ vā thūlaṃ vā, yaṃ tumhe n’ādhivāseyyāthā”ti?
Example3: ‘ehi tvaṃ, bhikkhu, sīlavā hohi, pātimokkha-saṃvara-saṃvuto viharāhi ācāra-gocara-sampanno aṇu-mattesu vajjesu bhaya-dassāvī, samādāya sikkhassu sikkhāpadesū’ti

meaning_1: subtle; fine
Example1:
sabbhi’r’eva samāsetha, paṇḍiteh’atthadassibhi,
atthaṃ mahantaṃ gambhīraṃ, duddasaṃ nipuṇaṃ aṇuṃ,
dhīrā samadhigacchanti, appamattā vicakkhaṇā’ti.
Example2: passatha no tumhe, bhikkhave, taṃ vacanapathaṃ, aṇuṃ vā thūlaṃ vā, yaṃ tumhe n’ādhivāseyyāthā”ti?

meaning_1: egg
Example1:
kikī’va aṇḍaṃ, camarī’va vāladhiṃ. piyaṃ’va puttaṃ,
nayanaṃ’va ekakaṃ. tath’eva sīlaṃ, anurakkhamānā.
Example2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kukkuṭiyā aṇḍāni aṭṭha vā dasa vā dvādasa vā.

meaning_1: (of speech) harsh; angry; fierce; wrathful
Example1: pharusavāco hoti. yā sā vācā aṇḍakā kakkasā parakaṭukā par'ābhisajjanī kodhasāmantā asamādhisaṃvattanikā, tathārūpiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti

meaning_1: eggshell
Example1: kiñ'c'āpi tassā kukkuṭiyā evaṃ icchā uppajjeyya, aho, vata me kukkuṭapotakā pādanakhasikhāya vā mukhatuṇḍakena vā aṇḍakosaṃ padāletvā sotthinā abhinibbhijjeyyun'ti

meaning_1: weak; fragile; lit. become like an egg
ru_meaning: слабый; хрупкий; досл. ставший как яйцо
Commentary: (SNa) aṇḍabhūto'ti aṇḍaṃ viya bhūto dubbalo. yathā kukkuṭaṇḍaṃ vā mayūraṇḍaṃ vā geṇḍukaṃ viya gahetvā khipantena vā paharantena vā na sakkā kīḷituṃ, tāva'd'eva bhijjati, evamayam'pi kāyo kaṇṭakepi khāṇukepi pakkhalitassa bhijjatīti aṇḍaṃ viya bhūto'ti aṇḍabhūto.
Example1: evam'etaṃ, gahapati, evam'etaṃ, gahapati! āturo h'āyaṃ, gahapati, kāyo aṇḍabhūto pariyonaddho.

meaning_1: sea; ocean; body of water
Example1: seyyathā’pi, bhikkhave, puriso addhānamaggappaṭipanno. so passeyya mahantaṃ udaka-aṇṇavaṃ, orimaṃ tīraṃ sāsaṅkaṃ sappaṭibhayaṃ, pārimaṃ tīraṃ khemaṃ appaṭibhayaṃ.
Example2: buddho susuddho karuṇā-mah’aṇṇavo, yo’ccanta-suddhabbara-ñāṇa-locano, lokassa pāp’ūpakilesa-ghātako

meaning_1: day; part of the day; time of the day
Example1: tam’enaṃ pubb’aṇhasamayaṃ satti-satena haneyyuṃ. atha rājā majjh’anhikasamayaṃ evaṃ vadeyya — ‘ambho, kathaṃ so puriso’ti?

meaning_1: beyond logic; outside the realm of conjecture; beyond the realm of thought
ru_meaning: за пределами логики; вне сферы предположений; за пределами воображения
Example1: tassa nissaraṇaṃ santaṃ, atakk’āvacaraṃ dhuvaṃ. ajātaṃ asamuppannaṃ, asokaṃ virajaṃ padaṃ. nirodho dukkhadhammānaṃ, saṅkhār’ūpasamo sukho’ti.

meaning_1: untrue; false
Example1: tatra, bhikkhave, yaṃ jaññā rahovādaṃ abhūtaṃ atacchaṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ sasakkaṃ taṃ rahovādaṃ na bhāseyya.

meaning_1: untruth; not fact
Example1: taṃ me taṇhāsallaṃ pahīnaṃ, apanīto avijjāvisadoso, sammā nibbānādhimuttohamasmī’ti. evaṃmānī assa atathaṃ samānaṃ.

meaning_1: energetic; effortful; active; alert; lit. not lazy
ru_meaning: энергичный; усердный; активный; в состоянии готовности; досл. не ленивый
Example1:
ek'āsanaṃ ekaseyyaṃ, eko caram'atandito,
eko damayam'attānaṃ, van'ante ramito siyā.
Example2: evaṃ vihārim’ātāpiṃ, ahorattam’atanditaṃ. taṃ ve bhadd’eka-ratto’ti, santo ācikkhate muni.

meaning_1: not lazy; without sloth
Example2: etā pi buddha-jaya-maṅgala-aṭṭha-gāthā, yo vācano dina-dine sarate’m’atandī, hitvān’aneka-vividhāni c’upaddavāni, mokkhaṃ sukhaṃ adhigameyya naro sapañño

meaning_1: not identified (with); lit. not made of that (in)
ru_meaning: не отождествленный (с); досл. не произведенный из этого (в)
Commentary: (ANa) atammayo’ti tammayā vuccanti taṇhādiṭṭhiyo, tāhi rahito.
Example1: sabbaloke ca atammayo bhavissāmi, ahaṅ'kārā ca me uparujjhissanti, mamaṅ'kārā ca me uparujjhissanti,
Example2:
pasayha māraṃ abhibhuyya antakaṃ, yo ca phusī jātikkhayaṃ padhānavā,
so tādiso lokavidū sumedho, sabbesu dhammesu atammayo munī'ti.

meaning_1: principle of non-identification (with); lit. state of not being made of that
ru_meaning: принцип не отождествления (с); досл. состояние не быть сделанным из этого
Commentary: (MNa) atammayatā'ti tammayatā vuccati taṇhā, nittaṇhā'ti attho.
Example1: atammayataṃ, bhikkhave, nissāya atammayataṃ āgamma y’āyaṃ upekkhā ekattā ekattasitā taṃ pajahatha, taṃ samatikkamatha.

meaning_1: not hurrying; slowly
Example1: tatra, bhikkhave, ataramānassa bhāsato kāyo'pi na kilamati, cittam'pi na upahaññati, saro'pi na upahaññati, kaṇṭho'pi na āturīyati, visaṭṭham'pi hoti viññeyyaṃ ataramānassa bhāsitaṃ.

meaning_1: being not in a hurry; not making haste
Example1: rahovādaṃ na bhāseyya, sammukhā na khīṇaṃ bhaṇe. ataramāno’va bhāseyya, no taramāno.

meaning_1: crossed (over); made it across
Example1: yo taṃ rūpamayaṃ vegaṃ sahati, ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, atari cakkhusamuddaṃ saūmiṃ sāvaṭṭaṃ sagāhaṃ sarakkhasaṃ.
Example2:
taṃ brūmi upasanto'ti, kāmesu anapekkhinaṃ,
ganthā tassa na vijjanti, atarī so visattikaṃ.

meaning_1: without refuge; defenseless; without protection
Example1: bhayato upasaggato calato pabhaṅguto adhuvato atāṇato aleṇato asaraṇato rittato tucchato suññato anattato ādīnavato

meaning_1: crossed (over); made it across
Notes: with metrically lengthened ā ; or because sk is atāri
Example1: “saṅkhāya lokasmiṃ paro’parāni, yass’iñjitaṃ n’atthi kuhiñci loke. santo vidhūmo anīgho nirāso, atāri so jātijaran’ti brūmī”ti

meaning_1: beyond; over; past; very
Commentary:
atisīta - too cold
atisitvā - having bypassed, having overlooked
atīta - past, gone past
Notes:
atimānī – one who is proud, conceited
accaya - the death; lit. going beyond
Example1:
ati-sītan’ti, ati-uṇhan’ti, ati-sāyan’ti, ati-pāto’ti, ati-chāto’smī’ti, ati-dhāto’smī’ti
aṭṭīyati harāyati jigucchati attānaṃ’y’eva ati-sitvā
atī’tam’p’āhaṃ addhānaṃ evam’eva rūpena khajjiṃ
Example2:
suvaco c’assa mudu, an’ati’mānī
so vo mam’acc-ayena satthā

meaning_1: too hot
Example1: ādīnavā ālasy'ānuyoge. atisītan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atiuṇhan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atisāyan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atipāto'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atichāto'smī'ti kammaṃ na karoti

meaning_1: surpassing normal human ability; lit. surpassed human
ru_meaning: превосходящий нормальные человеческие способности; досл. превзошедший человека
Example1: so dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate, yathākamm’ūpage satte pajānāti
Example2: dibbāya sotadhātuyā visuddhāya atikkantamānusikāya ubho sadde suṇeyyaṃ, dibbe ca mānuse ca ye dūre santike cā’ti

meaning_1: gone beyond; surpassed
Example1: so dibbena cakkhunā visuddhena atikkanta-mānusakena satte passati cavamāne upapajjamāne hīne paṇīte suvaṇṇe dubbaṇṇe, sugate duggate, yathākamm’ūpage satte pajānāti

meaning_1: gone past; passed by
Example1: utu’kkhānaṃ: hemant’ādīnaṃ tiṇṇaṃ utūnaṃ, ettakaṃ atikkantaṃ, ettakaṃ avasiṭṭhan'ti. evaṃ utu-ācikkhanaṃ kataṃ kiṃ?
Example2: iminā pakkhena: eko uposatho sampatto, eko uposathā atikkantā, cha uposathā avasiṭṭhā.

meaning_1: surpassing; transcending; going beyond; overcoming; lit. going past (of)
ru_meaning: превозмогание; переступание; выход за пределы; преодоление; досл. проход мимо
Example2: dukkhaṃ dukkhasamuppādaṃ, dukkhassa ca atikkamaṃ, ariyañ’c’aṭṭh’aṅgikaṃ maggaṃ, dukkh’ūpasama-gāminaṃ.
English chant 2: Going to True and False Refuges

meaning_1: transcends; overcomes; goes beyond; crosses over
Example1:
kodhaṃ jahe vippajaheyya mānaṃ, saṃyojanaṃ sabbam'atikkameyya,
taṃ nāmarūpasmim'asajjamānaṃ, akiñcanaṃ n'ānupatanti dukkhā.

meaning_1: could be overcome; could be surpassed; (comm) could be hurt or struck; lit. to be gone beyond
ru_meaning: можно побороть; можно превзойти; (комм) можно ранить или ударить; досл. за пределы которого можно выйти
Commentary: (SNa) atikkamitabban'ti viheṭhetabbaṃ ghaṭṭetabbaṃ.
Example1: yo evarūpaṃ purisanāgaṃ purisasīhaṃ purisaājānīyaṃ purisanisabhaṃ purisadhorayhaṃ purisadantaṃ atikkamitabbaṃ maññeyya kim'aññatra adassanā'ti.

meaning_1: having overstepped; having gone beyond; having crossed over
Example1: n’āhaṃ taṃ pamāṇaṃ atikkamitvā rajjan’ādivasena uppajjituṃ dassāmī’ti evam’ettha attho daṭṭhabbo.

meaning_1: surpassing; overcoming; going beyond
ru_meaning: превосходя; преодолевая; выходя за; проходя за
Example1: ubhatobhāgavimutto - idha ekacco puggalo ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā te kāyena phusitvā viharati paññāya cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇā honti.

meaning_1: missing; going past
Example1: seyyathā’pi puriso sār’atthiko sāragavesī sārapariyesanaṃ caramāno mahato rukkhassa tiṭṭhato sāravato atikkamm’eva mūlaṃ, atikkamma khandhaṃ, sākhāpalāse sāraṃ pariyesitabbaṃ maññeyya

meaning_1: exceeding; going over; lit. causing to go beyond
ru_meaning: превышающий; входящий за пределы; досл. приводящий к выходу за рамки
Example1: niṭṭhita-cīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kaṭhine das’āha-paramaṃ atireka-cīvaraṃ dhāretabbaṃ. taṃ atikkāmayato, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: exceeds; goes over; lit. causes to go beyond
ru_meaning: превосходит; превышает; досл. побуждает выйти за рамки
Example1: sārambhe ce bhikkhu vatthusmiṃ aparikkamane saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kāreyya bhikkhū vā anabhineyya vatthu-desanāya pamāṇaṃ vā atikkāmeyya, saṅghādiseso.
Example2: yo pana bhikkhu rañño, khattiyassa muddh’ābhisittassa, anikkhantarājake aniggataratanake, pubbe appaṭisaṃvidito, indakhīlaṃ atikkāmeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: spent; shot (from a bow); lit. over-exhausted
ru_meaning: потраченный; который выпустили (из лука); досл. пере-израсходованный
Example1:
acaritvā brahmacariyaṃ, aladdhā yobbane dhanaṃ,
senti cāpa-atikhīṇā'va, purāṇāni anutthunaṃ.

meaning_1: overcome; surmounted; crossed; gone past
Example1:
pañca chinde pañca jahe, pañca c'uttari bhāvaye,
pañca saṅga-atigo bhikkhu, oghatiṇṇo'ti vuccati.

meaning_1: too long; so long; for such a long time
ru_meaning: слишком долго; так долго; в течение длительного времени
Example1: api ca kho me aticiraṃ anuvitakkayato anuvicārayato kāyo kilameyya. kāye kilante cittaṃ ūhaññeyya. ūhate citte ārā cittaṃ samādhimhā’ti.

meaning_1: beyond; longer; more than usual; exceeding
ru_meaning: вовне; дольше; более чем обычно; превышая
Example1:
appaṃ vata jīvitaṃ idaṃ, oraṃ vassasatā'pi miyyati,
yo ce'pi aticca jīvati, atha kho so jarasāpi miyyati.

meaning_1: not satisfied; discontent
Example1:
pupphāni h'eva pacinantaṃ, byāsattamanasaṃ naraṃ,
atittaññ'eva kāmesu, antako kurute vasaṃ.

meaning_1: who uses too many requisites; who indulges oneself too much
ru_meaning: злоупотребляющий необходимыми вещами; слишком потакающий себе
Commentary: (DHPa) dhonā vuccati cattāro paccaye, idam'atthaṃ ete'ti paccavekkhitvā paribhuñjanapaññā, taṃ atikkamitvā caranto atidhonacārī nāma
Example1:
ayasā’va malaṃ samuṭṭhitaṃ, tat’uṭṭhāya tam’eva khādati.
evaṃ atidhonacārinaṃ, sāni kammāni nayanti duggatiṃ.

meaning_1: (of time) passes; spends
Example1: so tāya dhamma-pariyattiyā divasaṃ atināmeti, riñcati paṭisallānaṃ, n’ānuyuñjati ajjhattaṃ cetosamathaṃ. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhu, bhikkhu pariyatti-bahulo, no dhammavihārī

meaning_1: slaying; killing; lit. causing to fall
ru_meaning: убийство; лишение жизни; досл. вызов падения
Example2: pāṇ’ātipātā veramaṇī, adinn’ādānā veramaṇī, kāmesu-micchācārā veramaṇī, ayaṃ vuccati bhikkhave sammā-kammanto.

meaning_1: shoots past; flies past; lit. causes to fly past
ru_meaning: стреляет (в сторону); выпускает (по); досл. побуждает перелететь
Commentary: (SNa) atipāteyyā'ti atikkameyya. yāvatā so tālacchāyaṃ atikkameyya, tāvatā kālena ekacakkavāḷaṃ atikkamāmī'ti attano javasampattiṃ dasseti.
Example1: tassa mayhaṃ, bhante, evarūpo javo ahosi, seyyathā'pi nāma daḷhadhammo dhanuggaho sikkhito katahattho kat'ūpāsano lahukena asanena appakasirena tiriyaṃ tālacchāyaṃ atipāteyya.

meaning_1: destroys; kills; lit. causes to fall
Example1:
yo pāṇam’atipāteti, musā-vādañ’ca bhāsati.
loke adinnam’ādiyati, paradārañ’ca gacchati.

meaning_1: too early
Example1: ādīnavā ālasy'ānuyoge. atisītan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atiuṇhan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atisāyan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atipāto'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atichāto'smī'ti kammaṃ na karoti

meaning_1: too early in the morning; so early
Example1: satthā madhurassaraṃ nicchāretvā, kiṃ nu kho, mahārāja, atippag’eva āgatosī’ti āha

meaning_1: too early (to); very early
Example1: atha kho tesaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ etad’ahosi, atippago kho tāva sāvatthiyaṃ piṇḍāya carituṃ, yaṃ nūna mayaṃ yena aññatitthiyānaṃ paribbājakānaṃ ārāmo ten’upasaṅkameyyāmā’ti

meaning_1: despises; scorns; looks down (on); has contempt (for); is condescending (to)
ru_meaning: презирает; ни во что не ставит; смотрит вниз (на); относится снисходительно (к)
Example1:
kalyāṇaṃ vata bho sakkhi, attānaṃ atimaññasi,
yo santaṃ attani pāpaṃ, attānaṃ parigūhasi.

meaning_1: maddened; highly deluded
ru_meaning: сведенный с ума; введенный в заблуждение
Example2: nāḷāgiriṃ gaja-varaṃ atimatta-bhūtaṃ, dāv’aggi-cakkam’asanī’va, sudāruṇan’taṃ, mett’ambu-seka-vidhinā jitavā mun’indo.

meaning_1: arrogance; pride; haughtiness; self-importance
ru_meaning: высокомерие; гордость; надменность; чувство собственной значимости
Notes: also a hint of √mā to measure
Example1:
sātiyesu anassāvī, atimāne ca no yuto,
saṇho ca paṭibhānavā, na saddho na virajjati.

meaning_1: proud; conceited; arrogant
Example1: atimānissa purisapuggalassa anatimāno hoti parinibbānāya. dubbacassa purisapuggalassa sovacassatā hoti parinibbānāya.
Example2:
karaṇīyam’attha-kusalena, yaṃ taṃ santaṃ padaṃ abhisamecca:
sakko ujū ca suhujū ca, suvaco c’assa mudu, an-atimānī.

meaning_1: asking too much; over-begging; lit. state of over begging
ru_meaning: просить большая просьба; излишнее выпрашивание; досл. состояние чрезмерного выпрашивания
Example1:
na taṃ yāce yassa piyaṃ jigīse, desso hoti atiyācanāya,
nāgo maṇiṃ yācito brāhmaṇena, adassanaṃ'y'eva tad'ajjhagamā’ti.

meaning_1: who does not talk about vulgar topics; lit. not animal talker
ru_meaning: кто не говорит на пошлые темы; досл. не ведущий животный разговор
Example1: saṅghagato kho pana anānākathiko hoti atiracchānakathiko. sāmaṃ vā dhammaṃ bhāsati, paraṃ vā ajjhesati, ariyaṃ vā tuṇhībhāvaṃ n'ātimaññati.

meaning_1: surplus robe; excess robe-cloth; extra robe
ru_meaning: излишнее одеяние; избыточная ткань для одежды; дополнительное одеяние
Commentary: (VIN 1.4.1) atirekacīvaraṃ nāma anadhiṭṭhitaṃ avikappitaṃ.
Example1: niṭṭhita-cīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kaṭhine das’āha-paramaṃ atirekacīvaraṃ dhāretabbaṃ. taṃ atikkāmayato, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: extra bowl
Commentary: (VIN 1.4.21) atirekapatto nāma anadhiṭṭhito avikappito.
Example1: das’āhaparamaṃ atirekapatto dhāretabbo. taṃ atikkāmayato, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: more (than); superior; higher
Example2: mār’ātirekam’abhiyujjhita-sabba-rattiṃ, ghoram’pan’āḷavakam’akkhama-thaddha-yakkhaṃ, khantī-sudanta-vidhinā jitavā mun’indo.
Example3: yāvatikā ca bhikkhū kammappattā saṅgh'uposath'ārahā cattāro vā tato vā atirekā pakatattā pārājikaṃ anāpannā saṅghena vā anukkhittā.

meaning_1: surplus; excess; leftover; extra; more than
ru_meaning: излишний; избыточный; оставшийся; дополнительный; больший чем
Example1: niṭṭhita-cīvarasmiṃ bhikkhunā ubbhatasmiṃ kaṭhine das’āha-paramaṃ atireka-cīvaraṃ dhāretabbaṃ. taṃ atikkāmayato, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.
Example2: das’āhaparamaṃ atireka-patto dhāretabbo. taṃ atikkāmayato, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: outshines; dazzles; illuminates; lit. very shines
ru_meaning: затмевает; ослепляет; озаряет; досл. светит слишком
Example1:
evaṃ saṅkārabhūtesu, andhabhūte puthujjane,
atirocati paññāya, sammāsambuddhasāvako.

meaning_1: too late (in the day); late at night
ru_meaning: слишком поздно (в течение дня); поздно ночью
Example1: ādīnavā ālasy'ānuyoge. atisītan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atiuṇhan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atisāyan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atipāto'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atichāto'smī'ti kammaṃ na karoti

meaning_1: overestimated; overstepped; exceeded; gone too far
Example1:
atisāra-diṭṭhiyā'va so samatto, mānena matto paripuṇṇamānī,
sayam'eva sāmaṃ manas'ābhisitto, diṭṭhī hi sā tassa tathā samattā.

meaning_1: overstepping; overshooting; overturning; denial
Notes: atisāra is the equivalent noun of the verb atidhāvati
Example1: janapadaniruttiṃ n’ābhiniveseyya, samaññaṃ n’ātidhāveyyā’ti, iti kho pan’etaṃ vuttaṃ. kiñ’c’etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ? kathañ’ca, bhikkhave, janapadaniruttiyā ca abhiniveso hoti samaññāya ca atisāro?

meaning_1: having passed over; having overlooked
Example1: assutavā kho puthujjano attanā jarā-dhammo samāno jaraṃ anatīto paraṃ jiṇṇaṃ disvā aṭṭīyati harāyati jigucchati attānaṃ’y’eva {na} atisitvā, aham’pi kho’mhi jarā-dhammo jaraṃ anatīto
Example2: evaṃ-sampadam’idaṃ āyasmantānaṃ satthari sammukhībhūte, taṃ bhagavantaṃ atisitvā, amhe etam’atthaṃ paṭipucchitabbaṃ maññatha.

meaning_1: too loose; too slack; too flat
ru_meaning: слишком свободный; плохо натянутый; слишком вялый
Commentary: (ANa) atisithilāti mandamucchanā.
Example1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, soṇa, yadā te vīṇāya tantiyo atisithilā honti, api nu te vīṇā tasmiṃ samaye saravatī vā hoti kammaññā vā'ti?

meaning_1: slack energy; too lax effort; half-hearted exertion
ru_meaning: слабая энергия; слишком расслабленное усердие; вялое усилие
Commentary: (ANa) atilīnan’ti atisithilaṃ.
Example1: evam'evaṃ kho, soṇa, accāraddhavīriyaṃ uddhaccāya saṃvattati, atisithilavīriyaṃ kosajjāya saṃvattati.

meaning_1: too cold
Example1: ādīnavā ālasy'ānuyoge. atisītan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atiuṇhan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atisāyan'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atipāto'ti kammaṃ na karoti, atichāto'smī'ti kammaṃ na karoti

meaning_1: goes beyond; escapes; transcends; overcomes
Example1: yā evarūpā upekkhā, dhammaṃ sā ativattati. tasmā sā upekkhā nekkhammasitā'ti vuccati. imā cha nekkhammasitā upekkhā. chattiṃsa sattapadā veditabbā'ti, iti yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ idam'etaṃ paṭicca vuttaṃ.

meaning_1: dependent (upon); under the control (of)
Example1:
mam’eva kata maññantu, gihī-pabbajitā ubho,
mam’ev’ātivasā assu, kicc'ākiccesu kismici.
iti bālassa saṅkappo, icchā māno ca vaḍḍhati.

meaning_1: abuse; blame; verbal assault
Example1:
ahaṃ nāgo'va saṅgāme, cāpato patitaṃ saraṃ,
ativākyaṃ titikkhissaṃ, dussīlo hi bahujjano.

meaning_1: thoroughly penetrating; completely seeing through
Example1: chandajāto ussahati, ussāhetvā tuleti, tulayitvā padahati, pahit’atto samāno kāyena c’eva parama-saccaṃ sacchikaroti, paññāya ca naṃ ativijjha passati.

meaning_1: too much; very; extremely; exceedingly; lit. like too much
Example2: sabbo panāyaṃ piṇḍapāto a’jigucchanīyo, imaṃ pūti-kāyaṃ patvā ativiya jigucchanīyo jāyati

meaning_1: excessively; too long; too much; lit. over the limit
ru_meaning: чрезмерно; слишком много; слишком долго; досл. больше предела
Example1: ‘asatī kir’āyaṃ, bho, vīṇā nāma, yath’evaṃ yaṃ kiñci vīṇā nāma ettha ca pan’āyaṃ jano ativelaṃ pamatto palaḷito’ti.
Example2: “idha, bhante, aññataro navo bhikkhu ativelaṃ kulāni upasaṅkamati.

meaning_1: in the past; previously
Example1: ‘ahosiṃ nu kho ahaṃ atītam’addhānaṃ? na nu kho ahosiṃ atītam’addhānaṃ? kiṃ nu kho ahosiṃ atītam’addhānaṃ?

meaning_1: regret about the past; bemoaning the past
Example1:
anāgatappajappāya,
atītass'ānusocanā,
etena bālā sussanti,
naḷo'va harito luto'ti.

meaning_1: in the past; previously; lit. past time
ru_meaning: в прошлом; ранее; досл. прошедшее время
Example1: atītaṃ vā, bhikkhave, addhānaṃ ārabbha kathaṃ katheyya, evaṃ ahosi atītam'addhānan'ti.

meaning_1: past; gone past
Example1: pubbe vā paṭiladdha-pubbaṃ atītaṃ niruddhaṃ vipariṇataṃ samanussarato uppajjati somanassaṃ. yaṃ evarūpaṃ somanassaṃ idaṃ vuccati gehasitaṃ somanassaṃ.
Example2:
ye ca atītā sambuddhā, ye ca buddhā anāgatā.
yo c’eta’r’ahi sambuddho, bahunnaṃ soka-nāsano.

meaning_1: past
Example1: evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etad’avoca, atītaṃ kho, āvuso, eko anto, anāgataṃ dutiyo anto, paccuppannaṃ majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī.
Example2:
atītaṃ n'ānvāgameyya,
nappaṭikaṅkhe anāgataṃ,
yad'atītam'pahīnan'taṃ,
appattañ'ca anāgataṃ.

meaning_1: transgressed; overstepped; lit. gone past
Example1:
ekaṃ dhammaṃ atītassa, musāvādissa jantuno,
vitiṇṇaparalokassa, n'atthi pāpaṃ akāriyaṃ.

meaning_1: past, future and present
Example1: yaṃ papañceti tatonidānaṃ purisaṃ papañcasaññāsaṅkhā samudācaranti atītān’āgatapaccuppannesu cakkhuviññeyyesu rūpesu
Example2: 'tasmā’t’iha, bhikkhave, yaṃ kiñci rūpaṃ atīt’ānāgatapaccuppannaṃ ajjhattaṃ vā bahiddhā vā oḷārikaṃ vā sukhumaṃ vā hīnaṃ vā paṇītaṃ vā yaṃ dūre santike vā
English chant 2: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self

meaning_1: in the past and in the future
Example1: “iminā tvaṃ dhammena diṭṭhena viditena akālikena pattena pariyogāḷhena atīt’ānāgate nayaṃ nehi

meaning_1: very; exceedingly; extremely
Example1:
purato pacchato vā’pi, aparo ce na vijjati,
atīva phāsu bhavati, ekassa vasato vane.

meaning_1: personal name; lit. immeasurable; uncountable
Example1:
porāṇam'etaṃ atula, n'etaṃ ajjatanām'iva,
nindanti tuṇhim'āsīnaṃ, nindanti bahubhāṇinaṃ,
mitabhāṇim'pi nindanti, n'atthi loke anindito.

meaning_1: from here; from this; because of this
Commentary: (SNa) ato'ti ato nibbānato.
Example1:
yattha āpo ca pathavī,
tejo vāyo na gādhati,
ato sarā nivattanti,
ettha vaṭṭaṃ na vattati

meaning_1: ministering to oneself with sex; attending to one's sexual pleasure; taking care of one's sexual needs
ru_meaning: прислуживание личным сексуальным удовольствиям; забота о личных сексуальных потребностях
Commentary: (VINa) attakāmapāricariyāyā'ti methunadhammasaṅkhātena kāmena pāricariyā kāmapāricariyā. attano atthāya kāmapāricariyā attakāmapāricariyā
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu, otiṇṇo vipariṇatena cittena, mātugāmassa santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāseyya

meaning_1: who wants self-liberation; desiring one's own good; lit. wanting for self
ru_meaning: желающий освобождения для себя; стремящийся к собственному благу; досл. желающий для себя
Example2:
tasmā hi attakāmena, mahattam’abhikaṅkhatā.
saddhammo garu-kātabbo, saraṃ buddhāna sāsanan”ti.

meaning_1: one's own lust; sense-pleasures for oneself
ru_meaning: собственное вожделение; чувственное удовольствие для себя
Commentary: (VIN 1.2.4) attakāman'ti attano kāmaṃ attano hetuṃ attano adhippāyaṃ attano pāricariyaṃ.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu, otiṇṇo vipariṇatena cittena, mātugāmassa santike attakāma-pāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāseyya

meaning_1: self-mortification; self-torture; lit. self tiring
Example2: yo c’āyaṃ attakilamath’ānuyogo dukkho anariyo anatthasañhito.
English chant 2: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

meaning_1: practice of self-mortification
Example2: yo c’āyaṃ attakilamath’ānuyogo dukkho anariyo anatthasañhito.
English chant 2: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

meaning_1: who criticises oneself; who blames oneself
ru_meaning: тот кто себя критикует; кто осуждает себя
Example1:
ubhosu antesu vineyya chandaṃ, phassaṃ pariññāya anānugiddho,
yad'attagarahī tad'akubbamāno, na lippatī diṭṭhasutesu dhīro.

meaning_1: self-restrained; self-guarded
Commentary: (DHPa) so'ti so tvaṃ, bhikkhu, evaṃ sante attanā'va guttatāya attagutto.
Example1:
attanā coday'attānaṃ, paṭimaṃsetha attanā,
so attagutto satimā, sukhaṃ bhikkhu vihāhisi.

meaning_1: self-destruction; self-annihilation
Example1:
yo sāsanaṃ arahataṃ, ariyānaṃ dhammajīvinaṃ,
paṭikkosati dummedho, diṭṭhiṃ nissāya pāpikaṃ,
phalāni kaṭṭhakass'eva, attaghātāya phallati.

meaning_1: self-created; self-originated; lit. born from oneself
ru_meaning: само-созданный; возникший из-за себя; досл. рожденный из себя
Example1:
attanā hi kataṃ pāpaṃ, attajaṃ attasambhavaṃ,
abhimatthati dummedhaṃ, vajiraṃ'v'asmamayaṃ maṇiṃ.

Grammar: adv, masc abl sg, atta group
meaning_1: as oneself; as self
Example1: na rūpaṃ attato samanupassati, na rūpavantaṃ vā attānaṃ; na attani vā rūpaṃ, na rūpasmiṃ vā attānaṃ. ‘ahaṃ rūpaṃ, mama rūpan’ti na pariyuṭṭhaṭṭhāyī hoti.

meaning_1: personal benefit; personal profit
Example1: uppannassa ca kāmarāgassa nissaraṇaṃ yathābhūtaṃ nappajānāti, att’attham’pi tasmiṃ samaye yathābhūtaṃ na jānāti na passati, par’attham’pi tasmiṃ samaye yathābhūtaṃ na jānāti na passati
Example2: evaṃ hi vo bhikkhave sikkhitabbaṃ. att’atthaṃ vā hi bhikkhave sampassamānena alam’eva appamādena sampādetuṃ

meaning_1: armed; violent; fighting; lit. taken stick
ru_meaning: вооруженный; жестокий; дерущийся; досл. взятая палка
Example1:
aviruddhaṃ viruddhesu, attadaṇḍesu nibbutaṃ,
sādānesu anādānaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

meaning_1: one's own welfare; personal benefit; personal profit
Example1:
atta’d’atthaṃ par’atthena, bahunā’pi na hāpaye,
atta’d’attham’abhiññāya, sadattha-pasuto siyā.

meaning_1: self controlled; self restrained
Commentary: (ANa) attadantan'ti attanāyeva dantaṃ, na aññehi damathaṃ upanītaṃ.
Example1:
varam’assatarā dantā, ājānīyā ca sindhavā,
kuñjarā ca mahānāgā, attadanto tato varaṃ.
Example2:
attā have jitaṃ seyyo, yā c'āyaṃ itarā pajā.
attadantassa posassa, niccaṃ saññatacārino.

meaning_1: self-reliant; independent; oneself as foundation; lit. own island; (or) own lamp
ru_meaning: самодостаточный; независимый; опирающийся на себя; досл. свой остров; (или) свой светильник
Example2: “attadīpā, bhikkhave, viharatha attasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā, dhammadīpā dhammasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā.

meaning_1: self; himself; herself; itself; yourself; oneself (object)
Example1:
hananti bhogā dummedhaṃ, no ca pāragavesino,
bhogataṇhāya dummedho, hanti aññ'eva attanaṃ.

meaning_1: with oneself; by self
Example1:
caranti bālā dummedhā, amitten'eva attanā,
karontā pāpakaṃ kammaṃ, yaṃ hoti kaṭukapphalaṃ.
Example2: adinn’ādānaṃ pahāya adinn’ādānā paṭivirato hoti dinn’ādāyī dinnapāṭikaṅkhī, athenena sucibhūtena attanā viharati.

meaning_1: just by oneself for oneself; by oneself to oneself
ru_meaning: лишь сам для себя; сам себе
Example1: taṃ kut’ettha labbhā, yaṃ me paro anabhiratiṃ vinodetvā abhiratiṃ uppādeyya. yaṃnūn’āhaṃ attanā’va attano anabhiratiṃ vinodetvā abhiratiṃ uppādeyyan”ti.
Example2: kiñ’c’āpi te evaṃ vadeyyuṃ — ‘piyo no attā’ti, atha kho tesaṃ appiyo attā. taṃ kissa hetu? yañ’hi appiyo appiyassa kareyya, taṃ te attanā’va attano karonti; tasmā tesaṃ appiyo attā.

meaning_1: by oneself about oneself; lit. just by oneself self
ru_meaning: собой о себе; сам себя; досл. только собой себя
Example1: ‘atthi me attā’ti vā assa saccato thetato diṭṭhi uppajjati; ‘n'atthi me attā’ti vā assa saccato thetato diṭṭhi uppajjati; ‘attanā'va attānaṃ sañjānāmī’ti vā assa saccato thetato diṭṭhi uppajjati
Example2: so ākaṅkhamāno attanā’va attānaṃ byākareyya - khīṇanirayo’mhi khīṇatiracchānayoni khīṇa-pettivisayo khīṇ’āpāya-duggati-vinipāto sot’āpanno’ham’asmi avinipātadhammo niyato sambodhi-parāyaṇo’ti

meaning_1: one's own; belonging to oneself
Example1: api nu tumhākaṃ evam’assa — ‘amhe jano harati vā ḍahati vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karotī’ti? “no hetaṃ, bhante”. “taṃ kissa hetu”? “na hi no etaṃ, bhante, attā vā attaniyaṃ vā”ti.
Example2: “yasmā ca kho, ānanda, suññaṃ attena vā attaniyena vā tasmā suñño loko’ti vuccati.

meaning_1: in oneself; for oneself
Example1:
pakappitā saṅkhatā yassa dhammā, purakkhatā santi avīvadātā,
yad'attani passati ānisaṃsaṃ, taṃ nissito kuppapaṭicca santiṃ.
Example2: bhikkhu yathā iṇaṃ yathā rogaṃ yathā bandhan’āgāraṃ yathā dāsabyaṃ yathā kantār’addhānamaggaṃ, ime pañca nīvaraṇe appahīne attani samanupassati

meaning_1: when self; when oneself
Example1: attani vā, bhikkhave, sati attaniyaṃ me'ti assā'ti? evaṃ, bhante. attaniye vā, bhikkhave, sati attā me'ti assā'ti? evaṃ, bhante.

meaning_1: in oneself; for oneself
Example1:
yad'attanī passati ānisaṃsaṃ, diṭṭhe sute sīlavate mute vā,
tad'eva so tattha samuggahāya, nihīnato passati sabbamaññaṃ.

meaning_1: dogma about the self; belief in an (enduring) soul; concept of self
ru_meaning: убеждение о самости; вера в (вечную) душу; концепция 'я'
Commentary: (KNa) attānudiṭṭhiṃ ūhaccā’ti sakkāyadiṭṭhiṃ uddharitvā.
Example1:
suññato lokaṃ avekkhassu, mogharāja sadā sato,
att'ānudiṭṭhiṃ ūhacca, evaṃ maccutaro siyā,
evaṃ lokaṃ avekkhantaṃ, maccurājā na passatī'ti.

meaning_1: for oneself; for one's own sake; for one's own benefit
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu evarūpāni paṇītabhojanāni, agilāno, attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.
Example2: na sūpaṃ vā odanaṃ vā agilānā attano atthāya viññāpetvā bhuñjissāmī'ti sikkhā karaṇīyā.

meaning_1: for self; to oneself
Example1:
sukarāni asādhūni, attano ahitāni ca,
yaṃ ve hitañ’ca sādhuñ’ca, taṃ ve paramadukkaraṃ.
Example2: yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ saṅghikaṃ lābhaṃ pariṇataṃ attano pariṇāmeyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: of self; of oneself
Example1:
anupubbena medhāvī, thokaṃ thokaṃ khaṇe khaṇe.
kammāro rajatass’eva, niddhame malam’attano.
Example2:
pamādo rajo pamādo, pamād’ānupatito rajo,
appamādena vijjāya, abbahe sallam’attano’ti.

meaning_1: harm for oneself; self-affliction
Example1: so ca kho attabyābādhāya’pi saṃvattati, para-byābādhāya’pi saṃvattati, ubhaya-byābādhāya’pi saṃvattati, paññā-nirodhiko vighāta-pakkhiko anibbāna-saṃvattaniko

meaning_1: personal existence; individual being; lit. self existence
Example1: yaṃ kho kāmayamāno tajjaṃ tajjaṃ attabhāvaṃ abhinibbatteti puññabhāgiyaṃ vā apuññabhāgiyaṃ vā, ayaṃ vuccati kāmānaṃ vipāko.

meaning_1: incarnation; existence; personal existence; lit. obtaining self becoming
ru_meaning: воплощение; жизнь; личное существование; досл. обретение личного становления
Example1: ettako’pi kho, bhikkhu, attabhāvapaṭilābho n’atthi nicco dhuvo sassato avipariṇāmadhammo sassatisamaṃ tath’eva ṭhassati.
Example2: idha, thera, yaṃ atītaṃ taṃ pahīnaṃ, yaṃ anāgataṃ taṃ paṭinissaṭṭhaṃ, paccuppannesu ca attabhāvapaṭilābhesu chandarāgo suppaṭivinīto.

meaning_1: pleased; happy; delighted; satisfied; lit. own mind
ru_meaning: довольный; счастливый; удовлетворенный; досл. свой ум
Example1: te tāvataken'eva attamanā assu — ‘alam'ettāvatā, katam'ettāvatā, anuppatto no sāmaññ'attho, n'atthi no kiñci uttarikaraṇīyan’ti.
Example2: idam’avoca bhagavā. attamanā pañcavaggiyā bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṃ abhinanduṃ.
English chant 2: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self
Example3:
sace labhetha nipakaṃ sahāyaṃ, saddhiṃcaraṃ sādhuvihāridhīraṃ,
abhibhuyya sabbāni parissayāni, careyya ten'attamano satīmā.

meaning_1: pleasure; delight; joyful mentality; lit. own mind state
ru_meaning: довольство; наслаждение; восторг; досл. состояние своего ума
Example1: evam’eva kho cetaso bhikkhu dabbajātiko, yato yato imassa dhammapariyāyassa paññāya atthaṃ upaparikkheyya, labheth’eva attamanataṃ, labheth’eva cetaso pasādaṃ.

meaning_1: words of satisfaction; expression of happiness; exclamation of delight
ru_meaning: слова удовлетворения; выражение счастья; восклицание восторга
Example1: so taṃ paṭiggaṇheyya, paṭiggahetvā pārupeyya, pārupetvā attamano attamanavācaṃ nicchāreyya, chekaṃ vata, bho, odātaṃ vatthaṃ abhirūpaṃ nimmalaṃ sucī'ti!

meaning_1: like (for) oneself; equal to oneself
Commentary: (SNa) yasmā pana attapemena samaṃ pemaṃ nāma n'atthi. mātāpit'ādayo hi chaḍḍetvā'pi puttadhīt'ādayo ca aposetvā'pi sattā attānam'eva posenti.
Example1:
n'atthi attasamaṃ pemaṃ,
n'atthi dhaññasamaṃ dhanaṃ,
n'atthi paññāsamā ābhā,
vuṭṭhi ve paramā sarā'ti.

meaning_1: self-generated; produced by oneself
Example1:
attanā hi kataṃ pāpaṃ, attajaṃ attasambhavaṃ,
abhimatthati dummedhaṃ, vajiraṃ'v'asmamayaṃ maṇiṃ.

meaning_1: depending on oneself; one's own refuge; with oneself as a refuge
ru_meaning: зависящий от себя; сам себе прибежище
Example2: “attadīpā, bhikkhave, viharatha attasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā, dhammadīpā dhammasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā.

meaning_1: theory; doctrine of self; self concept; sense of being
ru_meaning: теория; учение о самости; идея о 'я'; само отождествление
Example2: kām’upādānaṃ, diṭṭh’upādānaṃ, sīlabbat’upādānaṃ, attavād’upādānaṃ. idaṃ vuccati taṇhā-paccayā upādānaṃ.

meaning_1: grasping of theory of self; clinging to a self-concept; attachment to sense of being
ru_meaning: привязанность к теории самости; цепляние к идеи о 'я'; цепляние к само отождествлению
Example2: kām’upādānaṃ, diṭṭh’upādānaṃ, sīlabbat’upādānaṃ, attavād’upādānaṃ. idaṃ vuccati taṇhā-paccayā upādānaṃ.

meaning_1: for one's own sake
Example1:
na attahetu na parassa hetu, na puttam'icche na dhanaṃ na raṭṭhaṃ,
na iccheyya adhammena samiddhim'attano, sa sīlavā paññavā dhammiko siyā.
Example2: iti attahetu vā parahetu vā āmisakiñcikkhahetu vā sampajānamusā bhāsitā hoti. ayaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, puggalo gūthabhāṇī.

meaning_1: accepting and rejecting; picking up and throwing down; acquiring and discarding
ru_meaning: принятие и отвержение; собирание и отбрасывание; приобретение и оставление
Commentary: (NIDD1) attā'ti attānudiṭṭhi n'atthi. nirattā'ti ucchedadiṭṭhi n'atthi. attā'ti gahitaṃ n'atthi. nirattā'ti muñcitabbaṃ n'atthi.
Example1:
upayo hi dhammesu upeti vādaṃ, anūpayaṃ kena kathaṃ vadeyya,
attaṃ nirattaṃ na hi tassa atthi, adhosi so diṭṭhim'idh'eva sabbanti.
Example2:
na tassa puttā pasavo, khettaṃ vatthuñ'ca vijjati,
attaṃ vā'pi nirattaṃ vā, na tasmiṃ upalabbhati.

meaning_1: self; oneself
Example1: saṅkhārā ca h’idaṃ attā abhavissaṃsu, na’y’idaṃ saṅkhārā ābādhāya saṃvatteyyuṃ, labbhetha ca saṅkhāresu — ‘evaṃ me saṅkhārā hontu, evaṃ me saṅkhārā mā ahesuṃ
Example2:
patirūpa-desa-vāso ca, pubbe ca katapuññatā.
atta-sammā-paṇidhi ca, etaṃ maṅgalam’uttamaṃ.

meaning_1: taking up; accepting; seizing; grasping
Commentary: (NIDD1) attā'ti att’ānudiṭṭhi n'atthi ... attā'ti gahitaṃ n’atthi.
Example1:
upayo hi dhammesu upeti vādaṃ, anūpayaṃ kena kathaṃ vadeyya,
attaṃ nirattaṃ na hi tassa atthi, adhosi so diṭṭhim'idh'eva sabbanti.
Example2:
aviruddhaṃ viruddhesu, atta-daṇḍesu nibbutaṃ,
sādānesu anādānaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

meaning_1: taken up; accepted; seized; grasped
Example1: aviruddhaṃ viruddhesu, atta-daṇḍesu nibbutaṃ, sādānesu anādānaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.
Example2: atta-daṇḍā bhayaṃ jātaṃ, janaṃ passatha medhagaṃ, saṃvegaṃ kittayissāmi, yathā saṃvijitaṃ mayā.

meaning_1: the fact of taking oneself as an authority; putting oneself in charge
ru_meaning: принятия себя как авторитета; возложение на себя ответственности
Commentary: (ANa) attānaṃ jeṭṭhakaṃ katvā nibbattitaṃ guṇajātaṃ att'ādhipateyyaṃ.
Example1: tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, ādhipateyyāni. katamāni tīṇi? att'ādhipateyyaṃ, lok'ādhipateyyaṃ, dhamm'ādhipateyyaṃ.

meaning_1: having oneself as an authority; with oneself in charge
ru_meaning: сам себе авторитет; ответственный перед собой
Commentary: (ANa) attādhipateyyako'ti attajeṭṭhako.
Example1:
passanti devā ca tathāgatā ca, lokasmiṃ bālaṃ visamaṃ carantaṃ,
tasmā hi att'ādhipateyyako ca, lok'ādhipo ca nipako ca jhāyī,
dhamm'ādhipo ca anudhammacārī, na hīyati saccaparakkamo muni.

meaning_1: belonging to oneself; depending on one's own will
Example1: so aparena samayena tamhā dāsabyā mucceyya att'ādhīno apar'ādhīno

meaning_1: self; himself; herself; itself; oneself (object)
Example1: na rūpaṃ attato samanupassati, na rūpavantaṃ vā attānaṃ; na attani vā rūpaṃ, na rūpasmiṃ vā attānaṃ. ‘ahaṃ rūpaṃ, mama rūpan’ti na pariyuṭṭhaṭṭhāyī hoti.
Example2: ahaṃ sukhito homi niddukkho homi avero homi abyāpajjho homi anīgho homi sukhī attānaṃ pariharāmi

meaning_1: only oneself; just himself
Example1: assutavā kho puthujjano attanā jarā-dhammo samāno jaraṃ anatīto paraṃ jiṇṇaṃ disvā aṭṭīyati harāyati jigucchati attānaṃ’y’eva {na} atisitvā, aham’pi kho’mhi jarā-dhammo jaraṃ anatīto
Example2: so attānaṃ'y'eva adhipatiṃ karitvā akusalaṃ pajahati, kusalaṃ bhāveti, sāvajjaṃ pajahati, anavajjaṃ bhāveti, suddhaṃ attānaṃ pariharati. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, att'ādhipateyyaṃ.

meaning_1: makes oneself unadmonishable; lit. makes oneself not to be spoken to
ru_meaning: делает себя не наставляемым; досл. делает себя тем с кем не возможно говорить
Example1: bhikkhu pan'eva dubbacajātiko hoti, uddesa-pariyāpannesu sikkhāpadesu bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno attānaṃ avacanīyaṃ karoti

meaning_1: praises oneself (because of); exalts oneself (due to)
Example1: n'ev'attān'ukkaṃsissāma na paraṃ vambhissāmā'ti

meaning_1: sense of self; concept of identity; speculation about self; view that the self exists; lit. following view of self
ru_meaning: ощущения себя; само отождествление; идея о 'я'; предположение о самости; идея что самость существует
Example1:
suññato lokaṃ avekkhassu,
mogharāja sadā sato,
att'ānudiṭṭhiṃ ūhacca,
evaṃ maccutaro siyā

meaning_1: devoted to one's own welfare; practising for one's own development; engaging in meditation
ru_meaning: посвятивший себя собственному благополучию; практикующий для собственного развития; занимающийся медитацией
Commentary: (DHPa) pihet'attānuyoginan'ti tāya paṭipattiyā sāsanato cuto gihibhāvaṃ patvā pacchā ye attānuyogaṃ anuyuttā sīlādīni sampādetvā devamanussānaṃ santikā sakkāraṃ labhanti, tesaṃ piheti, aho vat'āham'pi evarūpo assan'ti icchatī'ti attho.
Example1:
ayoge yuñjam'attānaṃ, yogasmiñ'ca ayojayaṃ,
atthaṃ hitvā piyaggāhī, pihet'att'ānuyoginaṃ.

meaning_1: self and no-self; personal or impersonal
ru_meaning: я и не-я; личный или безличный
Commentary: (NIDD1) attā'ti attānudiṭṭhi n'atthi. nirattā'ti ucchedadiṭṭhi n'atthi. attā'ti gahitaṃ n'atthi. nirattā'ti muñcitabbaṃ n'atthi.
Example1:
upayo hi dhammesu upeti vādaṃ, anūpayaṃ kena kathaṃ vadeyya,
attā nirattā na hi tassa atthi, adhosi so diṭṭhim'idh'eva sabbanti.
Example2:
na tassa puttā pasavo, khettaṃ vatthuñ'ca vijjati,
attā vā'pi nirattā vā, na tasmiṃ upalabbhati.

meaning_1: intended for oneself; designated for oneself; lit. pointing out oneself
ru_meaning: предназначенный для себя; определенный себе; досл. указывающий на себя
Commentary:
(VIN 1.2.6) attuddesan'ti attano atthāya.
(VINa) attuddesan'ti, mayhaṃ esā'ti evaṃ attā uddeso assā'ti att'uddesā, taṃ att'uddesaṃ.
Example1: saññācikāya pana bhikkhunā kuṭiṃ kārayamānena, assāmikaṃ att’uddesaṃ, pamāṇikā kāretabbā. tatr'idaṃ pamāṇaṃ: dīghaso dvādasa vidatthiyo sugatavidatthiyā, tiriyaṃ satt'antarā.

meaning_1: pertaining to oneself; concerning oneself; referring to oneself
ru_meaning: свойственный себе; относящийся к себе; приписанный себе
Commentary: (VIN 1.1.4) att'upanāyikan'ti te vā kusale dhamme attani upaneti attānaṃ vā tesu kusalesu dhammesu upaneti.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu, anabhijānaṃ, uttarimanussadhammaṃ att’ūpanāyikaṃ alam’ariyañāṇadassanaṃ samudācareyya: “iti jānāmi, iti passāmī”ti,

meaning_1: well-wishing; benevolent; lit. desiring benefit
ru_meaning: желающий благо; доброжелательный; досл. желающий пользы
Example1: ye vā pan’assa te honti atthakāmā hitakāmā phāsukakāmā yogakkhemakāmā mātā vā pitā vā bhātā vā bhaginī vā mittā vā amaccā vā ñātisālohitā vā

meaning_1: disappearing; vanishing; settling down; subsiding; lit. going home
Example1: ariyasāvako paññavā hoti uday’atthagāminiyā paññāya samannāgato ariyāya nibbedhikāya sammā dukkhakkhaya-gāminiyā.

meaning_1: (of sun) set; lit. gone home
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.22) atthaṅ'gate sūriye'ti oggate sūriye
Example1: sammato'pi ce bhikkhu atthaṅ'gate suriye bhikkhuniyo ovadeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: disappeared; gone; vanished; lit. gone home
ru_meaning: исчезнувший; ушедший; пропавший; досл. ушедший восвояси
Example1: rūpaṃ kho, āvuso, aniccaṃ. yad'aniccaṃ taṃ dukkhaṃ; yaṃ dukkhaṃ taṃ niruddhaṃ tad'atthaṅ'gataṃ.

meaning_1: after sunset; lit. when the sun has set
ru_meaning: после захода солнца; досл. когда солнце село
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.22) atthaṅ'gate sūriye'ti oggate sūriye
Example1: sammato'pi ce bhikkhu atthaṅ'gate suriye bhikkhuniyo ovadeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: disappearance; vanishing; settling down; subsiding; lit. going home
ru_meaning: исчезновение; пропадание; оседание; затихание; досл. уход восвояси
Example1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu udayabbay’ānupassī viharati — ‘iti rūpaṃ, iti rūpassa samudayo, iti rūpassa atthaṅ’gamo
Example2: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā, pubb’eva somanassa-domanassānaṃ atthaṅ’gamā, adukkham’asukhaṃ upekkhā-sati-pārisuddhiṃ catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.

meaning_1: acting in the interest (of)
Example1:
taṃ ce hi n'āddakkhuṃ tathāvimuttaṃ,
devā manussā idha vā huraṃ vā,
nar'uttamaṃ atthacaraṃ narānaṃ,
ye taṃ namassanti pasaṃsiyā te'ti.

meaning_1: thoughts intent on the goal; thinking of the meaning
ru_meaning: мысленно направленный к цели; думающий о смысле
Example2:
nīcā niviṭṭhā subharā, mudū atthaddha-mānasā.
abyāsekā amukharā, atthacintā vas’ānugā.

meaning_1: who sees the goal; sees the truth
ru_meaning: видящий смысл; видящий цель; кто видит истину
Example1:
pāpaṃ sahāyaṃ parivajjayetha, an-atthadassiṃ visame niviṭṭhaṃ.
sayaṃ na seve pasutaṃ pamattaṃ, eko care khagga-visāṇa-kappo.
Example2:
sabbhi’r’eva samāsetha, paṇḍiteh’atthadassibhi,
atthaṃ mahantaṃ gambhīraṃ, duddasaṃ nipuṇaṃ aṇuṃ,
dhīrā samadhigacchanti, appamattā vicakkhaṇā’ti.

meaning_1: not proud; not arrogant; lit. not stiff
ru_meaning: не гордый; не высокомерный; досл. не застывший
Example2:
nīcā niviṭṭhā subharā, mudū atthaddha-mānasā.
abyāsekā amukharā, attha-cintā vas’ānugā.

meaning_1: not stubborn at heart; without being stubborn
ru_meaning: не упрямый в душе; без упрямства
Example2:
nīcā niviṭṭhā subharā, mudū atthaddhamānasā.
abyāsekā amukharā, attha-cintā vas’ānugā.

meaning_1: flexibility; non-stubbornness; easygoingness; lit. non-stiffness
Example1: māyāvissa purisapuggalassa amāyā hoti parinibbānāya. thaddhassa purisapuggalassa atthaddhiyaṃ hoti parinibbānāya.

meaning_1: beneficial saying; profitable verse
Example1:
sahassam'api ce vācā, anatthapada-saṃhitā,
ekaṃ atthapadaṃ seyyo, yaṃ sutvā upasammati.

meaning_1: to learn the meaning (of); to understand the meaning (of)
Example1: dūrato'pi kho mayaṃ, bhante, āgaccheyyāma āyasmato sāriputtassa santike etassa bhāsitassa attham'aññātuṃ

meaning_1: profitable; meaningful; beneficial; lit. connected with good
Example1: yañ’ca kho jaññā rahovādaṃ bhūtaṃ tacchaṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ tatra kālaññū assa tassa rahovādassa vacanāya.
Example2: samphappalāpaṃ pahāya samphappalāpā paṭivirato hoti kālavādī bhūtavādī atthavādī dhammavādī vinayavādī, nidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā kālena sāpadesaṃ pariyantavatiṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ

meaning_1: to convey a meaning; to make a point; lit. for the communication of a meaning
ru_meaning: чтобы донести смысл; чтобы научить; досл. для передачи смысла
Example1: upamā kho my’āyaṃ, bhikkhave, katā atthassa viññāpanāya.

meaning_1: full of meaning; significant; relevant; lit. having meaning quality
ru_meaning: полный смысла; значительный; уместный; досл. имеющий качество значимости
Commentary:
(SNa) atthavatī'ti, atthavatiyo.
(SNt) atthavatiyo'ti lokiya-lok'uttar'āttha-saṅgahitā lokiya-kusala-lok'uttaramagga-saṅgaṇhanato.
Example1:
idh'āgamā vijjupabhāsavaṇṇā,
kokanadā pajjunnassa dhītā,
buddhañ'ca dhammañ'ca namassamānā,
gāthā'c'imā atthavatī abhāsi.

meaning_1: benefit; advantage
Example1:
etam'atthavasaṃ ñatvā, paṇḍito sīlasaṃvuto,
nibbānagamanaṃ maggaṃ, khippam'eva visodhaye.

meaning_1: sensible; rational; lit. intent on benefit
ru_meaning: благоразумный; рациональный; досл. стремящийся к благу
Example1: tañ'ca kho etaṃ, bhikkhave, kulaputtā upenti atthavasikā, atthavasaṃ paṭicca; n'eva rāj'ābhinītā, na cor'ābhinītā, na iṇ'aṭṭā, na bhay'aṭṭā, na ājīvikāpakatā;

meaning_1: who speaks what is beneficial; who says what is meaningful
ru_meaning: кто говорит благо; кто говорит полное смысла
Example3: samphappalāpaṃ pahāya samphappalāpā paṭivirato hoti kālavādī bhūtavādī atthavādī dhammavādī vinayavādī, nidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā kālena sāpadesaṃ pariyantavatiṃ atthasaṃhitaṃ

meaning_1: for the purpose of; for the sake of
Example1: atha kho idaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṃ vussati saṃvar’atthaṃ pahān’atthaṃ virāg’atthaṃ nirodh’atthan”ti.
Example2: paṭisaṅkhā yoniso sen'āsanaṃ paṭisevāmi yāva’d’eva sītassa paṭighātāya uṇhassa paṭighātāya ḍaṃsa-makasa-vāt’ātapa-siriṃsapa-samphassānaṃ paṭighātāya yāva’d’eva utuparissaya-vinodanaṃ paṭisallān’ārām’atthaṃ

meaning_1: achieves one's purpose; attains one's goal; fulfils one's need; lit. experiences the benefit
ru_meaning: достигает своей цели; реализует свое намерение; удовлетворяет свою потребность; досл. ощущает пользу
Example1: “yaṃ kho tumhe, āyasmanto, bhikkhuṃ uddissa cīvaracetāpannaṃ pahiṇittha na taṃ tassa bhikkhuno kiñci atthaṃ anubhoti: yuñjant'āyasmanto sakaṃ, mā vo sakaṃ vinassā”ti.
Example2: yassa kassaci piḷandhanavikatiyā ākaṅkhati, yadi muddikāya yadi kuṇḍalāya yadi gīveyyakāya yadi suvaṇṇamālāya, tañ'c'assa atthaṃ anubhoti.

meaning_1: disappears; dissolves; vanishes; lit. goes home
ru_meaning: исчезает; растворяется; пропадает; досл. уходит восвояси
Example1:
sadā jāgaramānānaṃ, ahoratt'ānusikkhinaṃ,
nibbānaṃ adhimuttānaṃ, atthaṃ gacchanti āsavā.

meaning_1: meaning; significance
Example1: imassa nu kho, bhante, bhagavatā saṃkhittena bhāsitassa kathaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo’ti?
Example2: so dhammaṃ deseti ādikalyāṇaṃ majjhekalyāṇaṃ pariyosānakalyāṇaṃ s’ātthaṃ sabyañjanaṃ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ pakāseti.
Example3: sādhu vat'āyasmantaṃ'y'eva sāriputtaṃ paṭibhātu etassa bhāsitassa attho'ti.

meaning_1: benefit; profit; good; welfare; goal
Example2:
karaṇīyam’attha-kusalena, yaṃ taṃ santaṃ padaṃ abhisamecca:
sakko ujū ca suhujū ca, suvaco c’assa mudu, anatimānī.
Example3: ubhay’atthaṃ vā hi bhikkhave sampassamānena alam’eva appamādena sampādetun'ti

meaning_1: use; function; purpose
Example1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, rāhula, kim’atthiyo ādāso”ti? “paccavekkhaṇ’attho, bhante”ti.

meaning_1: matter; affair; case
Example1: evaṃ imassa bhoto purisapuggalassa ubhay’attha kaliggaho
Example2:
na tena hoti dhammaṭṭho, yen'atthaṃ sāhasā naye,
yo ca atthaṃ anatthañ'ca, ubho niccheyya paṇḍito.

meaning_1: need (for); want (for)
Example1: “attho me, āvuso, cīvarenā”ti. dvattikkhattuṃ codayamāno sārayamāno taṃ cīvaraṃ abhinipphādeyya, icc'etaṃ kusalaṃ.
Example3:
atthamhi jātamhi sukhā sahāyā, tuṭṭhī sukhā yā itarītarena,
puññaṃ sukhaṃ jīvitasaṅkhayamhi, sabbassa dukkhassa sukhaṃ pahānaṃ.

meaning_1: needing; wanting
Example1:
taṃ vo vadāmi bhaddaṃ vo, yāvant'ettha samāgatā,
taṇhāya mūlaṃ khaṇatha, usīr'attho'va bīraṇaṃ,
mā vo naḷaṃ'va soto'va, māro bhañji punappunaṃ.

meaning_1: home; rest; shelter
Example1:
sadā jāgaramānānaṃ, ahoratt'ānusikkhinaṃ,
nibbānaṃ adhimuttānaṃ, atthaṃ gacchanti āsavā.
Example2: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā, pubb’eva somanassa-domanassānaṃ atthaṅ’gamā, adukkham’asukhaṃ upekkhā-sati-pārisuddhiṃ catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.

meaning_1: you (all) must be; may you (all) be
ru_meaning: вы должны быть; да будете вы
Example3: etāni, bhikkhave, rukkhamūlāni, etāni suññāgārāni. jhāyatha, bhikkhave, mā pamād’attha, mā pacchā vippaṭisārino ahuvattha. ayaṃ vo amhākaṃ anusāsanī’ti.

meaning_1: for the good; the benefit and the happiness (of)
Example2: yatha'y'idaṃ brahmacariyaṃ addhaniyaṃ assa ciraṭṭhitikaṃ, tadassa bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lok’ānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ

meaning_1: for the purpose (of); for the sake (of); for the benefit (of)
Example1: “yassa khv’āhaṃ atthāya cittaṃ paṇidahiṃ so me attho abhinipphanno. handa dāni paṭisaṃharāmi”
Example2: bhikkhugaṇanā nāma imasmiṃ uposath'agge uposath'atthāya sannipatitā bhikkhū ettakā'ti, bhikkhūnaṃ gaṇanā.

meaning_1: fortunate (for); beneficial (for); useful (for); lit. for the benefit (of)
ru_meaning: благоприятный (для); благотворный (для); полезный (для); досл. для блага
Example2: yatha'y'idaṃ brahmacariyaṃ addhaniyaṃ assa ciraṭṭhitikaṃ, tadassa bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lok’ānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ

meaning_1: there is, friend; there is, brother
Example1: kahaṃ pana, bhikkhu, eta'r'ahi so bhagavā viharati arahaṃ sammāsambuddho'ti. atth'āvuso, uttaresu janapadesu sāvatthi nāma nagaraṃ.

meaning_1: wanting; needing; desiring; seeking
Example1: ārocayāmi vo, bhikkhave, paṭivedayāmi vo, bhikkhave — ‘mā vo sāmaññ’atthikānaṃ sataṃ sāmaññ’attho parihāyi, sati uttariṃ karaṇīye’.
Example2:
yāya devā manussā ca, sitā tiṭṭhanti atthikā,
tarath’etaṃ visattikaṃ, khaṇo vo mā upaccagā,
khaṇ’ātītā hi socanti, nirayamhi samappitā.

meaning_1: existence; idea of existence; fact of being present; lit. is state
ru_meaning: существование; идея существования; факт присутствия; досл. состояние быть
Example1: idāni pana sūriy’ālokassa atthitāya padīpakiccaṃ idha natthi.
Example2: tattha purimesu catūsu kiccesu idāni suriy'ālokassa atthitāya n'atthi, aparāni tīṇi bhikkhūnaṃ vattaṃ jānantehi bhikkhūhi katāni pariniṭṭhitāni honti.

meaning_1: existence; the fact of being present
Example1: rūparāgappaṭisaṃvedī’ti kilesassa atthibhāven’eva pana rūparāgaṃ paṭisaṃviditaṃ karoti nāma

meaning_1: for purpose (of); for use (of)
Example1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi, rāhula, kim'atthiyo ādāso'ti? paccavekkhaṇattho, bhante'ti.

meaning_1: there is
Example2:
yaṃ kiñci vittaṃ idha vā huraṃ vā,
saggesu vā yaṃ ratanaṃ paṇītaṃ.
na no samaṃ atthi tathāgatena,
Example3: ‘atthi kāyo’ti vā pana’ssa sati paccupaṭṭhitā hoti.

meaning_1: there are; they are
Example1:
ye diṭṭhim'uggayha vivādayanti, idam'eva saccan'ti ca vādayanti,
