te tvaṃ vadassū na hi te'dha atthi, vādamhi jāte paṭisenikattā.
Example3:
ye keci pāṇabhūtā-atthi, tasā vā thāvarā vā anavasesā,
dīghā vā y'eva mahantā vā, majjhimā rassakā aṇukathūlā.

meaning_1: seeker; who wants; who needs; who desires
ru_meaning: ищущий; кто хочет; у кого есть надобность; кто желает
Example1:
evaṃ abhikkanta-dassāviṃ, atthi pañhena āgamaṃ,
kathaṃ lokaṃ avekkhantaṃ, maccurājā na passati.

meaning_1: may it be! may there be!
ru_meaning: да будет это! этому следует быть
Example1: atha kho āyasmā raṭṭhapālo sakapitu nivesane n’eva dānaṃ alattha na paccakkhānaṃ, añña'd'atthu akkosam’eva alattha

meaning_1: there is even
Example1: rañño'pi kho, bhikkhave, pasenadissa kosalassa atth'eva aññathattaṃ atthi vipariṇāmo. evaṃ passaṃ, bhikkhave, sutavā ariyasāvako tasmim'pi nibbindati.

meaning_1: not proud; not arrogant; lit. not stiff
ru_meaning: не гордый; не высокомерный; досл. не застывший
Example1: arahante sītībhūte, katakicce anāsave nihacca mānaṃ athaddho, te namasse anuttare”ti.

meaning_1: then his; as his
Example1:
yadā dvayesu dhammesu, pāragū hoti brāhmaṇo,
ath'assa sabbe saṃyogā, atthaṃ gacchanti jānato.

meaning_1: then; and then; after that
Example1: dandho, ānanda, udaka-phusitānaṃ nipāto, atha kho naṃ khippam’eva parikkhayaṃ pariyādānaṃ gaccheyya;
Example2: atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkanta-vaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten’upasaṅkami
Example3: atha kho āyasmā tisso bhagavato pitucchāputto yena bhagavā ten'upasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam'antaṃ nisīdi

meaning_1: yet; and yet; but; but still; however; even then
ru_meaning: но; и все же; однако; не смотря на это
Example1: atha kho idaṃ, bhikkhave, brahmacariyaṃ vussati saṃvar’atthaṃ pahān’atthaṃ virāg’atthaṃ nirodh’atthan”ti.
Example2: kiñ’c’āpi te evaṃ vadeyyuṃ — ‘piyo no attā’ti, atha kho tesaṃ appiyo attā. taṃ kissa hetu? yañ’hi appiyo appiyassa kareyya, taṃ te attanā’va attano karonti; tasmā tesaṃ appiyo attā.

meaning_1: and yet; but still
ru_meaning: и кроме того; но все же
Example1: kicchaṃ vat’āyaṃ loko āpanno, jāyati ca jīyati ca mīyati ca cavati ca upapajjati ca, atha ca pan’imassa dukkhassa nissaraṇaṃ nappajānāti jarāmaraṇassa

meaning_1: but if; and if; so if
ru_meaning: но если; и если; так что если
Example1:
parassa ce hi vacasā nihīno, tumo sahā hoti nihīnapañño,
atha ce sayaṃ vedagū hoti dhīro, na koci bālo samaṇesu atthi.
Example2:
akkodhano vigatakhilo'ham'asmi, anutīre mahiy'ekarattivāso,
vivaṭā kuṭi nibbuto gini, atha ce patthayasī pavassa deva.

meaning_1: or
Example1:
sabbattha ve sappurisā cajanti, na kāmakāmā lapayanti santo,
sukhena phuṭṭhā atha vā dukhena, na ucc’āvacaṃ paṇḍitā dassayanti.

meaning_1: and; then; and also
Example2: atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkanta-vaṇṇā kevalakappaṃ jetavanaṃ obhāsetvā yena bhagavā ten’upasaṅkami
Example3:
“sabbe dhammā anattā”ti, yadā paññāya passati.
atha nibbindati dukkhe, esa maggo visuddhiyā.

meaning_1: but; rather; even
Example1:
appakā te manussesu, ye janā pāragāmino,
atha-ayaṃ itarā pajā, tīram'ev'ānudhāvati.
Example2:
atha pāpāni kammāni, karaṃ bālo na bujjhati,
sehi kammehi dummedho, aggidaḍḍho'va tappati.

meaning_1: then; after that; and what is more
ru_meaning: тогда; после этого; и более того
Example1: idam'avoca bhagavā. idaṃ vatvāna sugato ath'āparaṃ etad'avoca satthā

meaning_1: and even
Example2:
sabbe saddhamma-garuno, vihariṃsu viharanti ca.
athā'pi viharissanti, esā buddhāna dhammatā.

meaning_1: but then; but now; but after
ru_meaning: но потом; но сейчас; но после
Example1:
paṇḍito'ti samaññāto, ekacariyaṃ adhiṭṭhito,
athā'pi methune yutto, mando'va parikissati.

meaning_1: but this; then this; and this
ru_meaning: но это; потом этот; и это
Example1: yadā kho, āvuso, imaṃ kāyaṃ tayo dhammā jahanti, āyu usmā ca viññāṇaṃ, ath'āyaṃ kāyo ujjhito avakkhitto seti, yathā kaṭṭhaṃ acetanan'ti.
Example2:
appakā te manussesu, ye janā pāragāmino.
ath’āyaṃ itarā pajā, tīram’ev’ānudhāvati.

meaning_1: then I
Example1: sace kho pana atthi paro loko, atthi sukatadukkaṭānaṃ kammānaṃ phalaṃ vipāko, ath'āhaṃ kāyassa bhedā paraṃ maraṇā sugatiṃ saggaṃ lokaṃ upapajjissāmī'ti
Example2: ath'āhaṃ bhikkhave sadevake loke samārake sabrahmake sassamaṇabrāhmaṇiyā pajāya sadevamanussāya
English chant 2: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

meaning_1: then here; in this regard
ru_meaning: тогда здесь; в связи с этим
Example1: tiṭṭhanti kho pana, bhikkhave, tatth’eva pañc’indriyāni. ath’ettha sutavato ariyasāvakassa avijjā pahīyati, vijjā uppajjati.

meaning_1: not stealing
Example2: adinn’ādānaṃ pahāya adinn’ādānā paṭivirato hoti dinn’ādāyī dinnapāṭikaṅkhī, athenena sucibhūtena attanā viharati.

meaning_1: and then; after that; because of
Example1:
byādhidhammā jarādhammā, atho maraṇadhammino.
yathā dhammā tathā sattā, jigucchanti puthujjanā.
Example2:
yān’īdha bhūtāni samāgatāni, bhummāni vā yāni va antalikkhe.
sabb’eva bhūtā sumanā bhavantu, atho'pi sakkacca suṇantu bhāsitaṃ.
Example3: mātari pitari c’āpi, atho jeṭṭhamhi bhātari. ācariye catutthamhi, tesu na mānaṃ kayirātha.

meaning_1: and too; and even
Example1:
vadanti ve duṭṭhamanā'pi eke, atho'pi ve saccamanā vadanti,
vādañ'ca jātaṃ muni no upeti, tasmā munī n'atthi khilo kuhiñci.
Example2:
yān'īdha bhūtāni samāgatāni, bhummāni vā yāni va antalikkhe,
sabb'eva bhūtā sumanā bhavantu, atho'pi sakkacca suṇantu bhāsitaṃ.

meaning_1: eating; feeding on
Example1: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kiṭṭhaṃ sampannaṃ. kiṭṭh'ārakkho ca pamatto, goṇo ca kiṭṭh'ādo aduṃ kiṭṭhaṃ otaritvā yāva'd'atthaṃ madaṃ āpajjeyya pamādaṃ āpajjeyya.

meaning_1: unarmed; peaceful; lit. without a stick
Example1:
yo daṇḍena adaṇḍesu, appaduṭṭhesu dussati,
dasannam'aññataraṃ ṭhānaṃ, khippam'eva nigacchati.

meaning_1: non-violently; peacefully; lit. without a stick
Example1: so imaṃ pathaviṃ sāgarapariyantaṃ adaṇḍena asatthena dhammena abhivijiya ajjhāvasati.

meaning_1: having not caused; having not allowed (to happen); lit. having not given (a chance)
ru_meaning: не вызвав; не допустив (произойти); досл. не дав (возможность)
Example1: yathā āvajjanaṃ na rajjati, na dussati, na muyhati, evaṃ rajjan’ādivasena ca uppajjituṃ adatvā āvajjanappamāṇen’eva cittaṃ ṭhapessāmī’ti ayam’ettha attho.

meaning_1: not giving; not bestowing
Example1:
‘yācako appiyo hoti, yācaṃ adadam’appiyo.
tasm’āhaṃ taṃ na yācāmi, mā me videssanā ahū’ti.

meaning_1: untamed; untrained; wild
Example1: so vata, cunda, attanā adanto avinīto aparinibbuto paraṃ damessati vinessati parinibbāpessatī’ti n’etaṃ ṭhānaṃ vijjati.

meaning_1: uncompassionate; unkind; merciless; cruel
Example1: kathañ'ca, cunda, tividhaṃ kāyena asoceyyaṃ hoti? idha, cunda, ekacco pāṇ'ātipātī hoti luddo lohitapāṇi hatapahate niviṭṭho aday'āpanno sabbapāṇabhūtesu

meaning_1: not wishing to see; wanting to not see
ru_meaning: не желающий видеть; желающий не видеть
Example1: seyyathā’pi, bhikkhave, cakkhumā puriso āpāthagatānaṃ rūpānaṃ adassanakāmo assa; so nimīleyya vā aññena vā apalokeyya.

meaning_1: out of sight (of); disappearance (of); invisibility
Example1:
pheṇ'ūpamaṃ kāyam'imaṃ viditvā, marīcidhammaṃ abhisambudhāno,
chetvāna mārassa papupphakāni, adassanaṃ maccurājassa gacche.
Example2:
na taṃ yāce yassa piyaṃ jigiṃse, desso hoti atiyācanāya,
nāgo maṇiṃ yācito brāhmaṇena, adassanaṃ'y'eva tad'ajjhagamā’ti.

meaning_1: absence (of); lit. not seeing (of)
Example1:
sāhu dassanam'ariyānaṃ, sannivāso sadā sukho,
adassanena bālānaṃ, niccam'eva sukhī siyā.
Example2:
mā piyehi samāgañchi, appiyehi kudācanaṃ,
piyānaṃ adassanaṃ dukkhaṃ, appiyānañ'ca dassanaṃ.

meaning_1: absence of seeing; not understanding
Example1: ‘hīno’ham’asmī’ti vā samanupassanti; kim’aññatra yathābhūtassa adassanā?
Example2: yo evarūpaṃ purisanāgaṃ purisasīhaṃ purisaājānīyaṃ purisanisabhaṃ purisadhorayhaṃ purisadantaṃ atikkamitabbaṃ maññeyya kim'aññatra adassanā'ti.

meaning_1: who has no regard (for); lit. who has not seeing
ru_meaning: кто не уважает; досл. кто не видел
Example1: idha, gahapati, assutavā puthujjano ariyānaṃ adassāvī ariyadhammassa akovido ariyadhamme avinīto sappurisānaṃ adassāvī sappurisadhammassa akovido sappurisadhamme avinīto

meaning_1: having not caused to give (to); having not had given (to)
ru_meaning: не побудив дать; не заставив дать
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.42) adāpetvā'ti na kiñci dāpetvā.
Example1: tassa dāpetvā vā adāpetvā vā uyyojeyya: “gacch'āvuso, na me tayā saddhiṃ kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hoti, ekakassa me kathā vā nisajjā vā phāsu hotī”ti

meaning_1: gave
Example1:
migaluddo pure āsiṃ, araññe kānane ahaṃ,
disvāna taṃ devadevaṃ, tiṇamuṭṭhiṃ adās'ahaṃ.
Example2: adāsi me akāsi me, ñātimittā sakhā ca me. petānaṃ dakkhiṇaṃ dajjā, pubbe katam’anussaraṃ.

meaning_1: not seen
ru_meaning: который не был виден; не увиденный
Example1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi ye te cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā adiṭṭhā adiṭṭhapubbā, na ca passasi, na ca te hoti passeyyan’ti? atthi te tattha chando vā rāgo vā pemaṃ vā”ti?
Example2:
diṭṭhā vā ye ca adiṭṭhā, ye сa dūre vasanti avidūre
bhūtā vā sambhav’esī vā, sabbe sattā bhavantu sukhit’attā.

meaning_1: never seen before
Example1: taṃ kiṃ maññasi ye te cakkhuviññeyyā rūpā adiṭṭhā adiṭṭhapubbā, na ca passasi, na ca te hoti passeyyan’ti? atthi te tattha chando vā rāgo vā pemaṃ vā”ti?

meaning_1: who speaks about the unseen (as); who states what one has not seen (as)
Example1: aṭṭh'ime, bhikkhave, ariyavohārā. katame aṭṭha? adiṭṭhe adiṭṭhavāditā, asute asutavāditā, amute amutavāditā, aviññāte aviññātavāditā, diṭṭhe diṭṭhavāditā, sute sutavāditā, mute mutavāditā, viññāte viññātavāditā.

meaning_1: without view; no belief
Example1:
na diṭṭhiyā na sutiyā na ñāṇena, sīlabbatenā'pi na suddhim'āha,
adiṭṭhiyā assutiyā añāṇā, asīlatā abbatā no'pi tena,
ete ca nissajja anuggahāya, santo anissāya bhavaṃ na jappe.

meaning_1: not given; not offered
Example1:
yo pāṇam’atipāteti, musā-vādañ’ca bhāsati.
loke adinnam’ādiyati, paradārañ’ca gacchati.
Example2: pāṇ’ātipātā veramaṇī, adinn’ādānā veramaṇī, kāmesu-micchācārā veramaṇī, ayaṃ vuccati bhikkhave sammā-kammanto.

meaning_1: takes something which is not given
ru_meaning: берет то что не было дано
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu gāmā vā araññā vā adinnaṃ theyyasaṅkhātaṃ ādiyeyya

meaning_1: taking something which is not given
ru_meaning: берущий то что не было дано
Example1: “coro'si, bālo'si, mūḷho'si, theno'sī”ti, tathārūpaṃ bhikkhu adinnaṃ ādiyamāno, ayam'pi pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.

meaning_1: theft; stealing; lit. taking what is not given
ru_meaning: кража; воровство; досл. взятие того что не дано
Example2: pāṇ’ātipātā veramaṇī, adinn’ādānā veramaṇī, kāmesu-micchācārā veramaṇī, ayaṃ vuccati bhikkhave sammā-kammanto.
Example3: adinn’ādānaṃ pahāya adinn’ādānā paṭivirato hoti dinn’ādāyī dinnapāṭikaṅkhī, athenena sucibhūtena attanā viharati.

meaning_1: who steals; who takes what is not offered
ru_meaning: кто ворует; кто берет то что не дано
Example1: adinnādāyissa purisapuggalassa adinnādānā veramaṇī hoti parinibbānāya. abrahmacārissa purisapuggalassa abrahmacariyā veramaṇī hoti parinibbānāya.

meaning_1: that; such; so and so
ru_meaning: тот; такой; такой то и такой то
Example1: “no h’idaṃ”. “taṃ kissa hetu”? “aduñ’hi allaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ sasnehaṃ, tañ’ca pana udake nikkhittaṃ. yāva’d’eva ca pana so puriso kilamathassa vighātassa bhāgī assā”ti.
Example2: seyyathā'pi, bhikkhave, kiṭṭhaṃ sampannaṃ. kiṭṭh'ārakkho ca pamatto, goṇo ca kiṭṭh'ādo aduṃ kiṭṭhaṃ otaritvā yāva'd'atthaṃ madaṃ āpajjeyya pamādaṃ āpajjeyya.

meaning_1: unafflicted; free from trouble; without suffering
ru_meaning: не пораженный; свободный от затруднений; без страданий
Example1: sabbe te adukkhā anupaghātā anupāyāsā apariḷāhā sammāpaṭipannā’ti — iti vadaṃ itth’eke ussādeti.
Example2: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā, pubb’eva somanassa-domanassānaṃ atthaṅ’gamā, adukkham’asukhaṃ upekkhā-sati-pārisuddhiṃ catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.

meaning_1: neutral; neither pleasant nor unpleasant; neither comfortable nor uncomfortable
Example1: sukham’pi vedayati, dukkham’pi vedayati, adukkham’asukham’pi vedayati. vedayatī’ti kho, bhikkhave, tasmā ‘vedanā’ti vuccati.
Example2: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā, pubb’eva somanassa-domanassānaṃ atthaṅ’gamā, adukkham’asukhaṃ upekkhā-sati-pārisuddhiṃ catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati.
Example3: n'eva tasmiṃ samaye dukkhaṃ vedanaṃ vedeti, na adukkham'asukhaṃ vedanaṃ vedeti

meaning_1: this is neutral; this is neither pleasant nor unpleasant
ru_meaning: это нейтрально; это ни приятно, ни неприятно
Example1: kiñ'ca vijānāti? sukhan'ti'pi vijānāti, dukkhan'ti'pi vijānāti, adukkham'asukhan'ti'pi vijānāti. vijānāti vijānātī'ti kho, āvuso, tasmā viññāṇanti vuccatī'ti.

meaning_1: neutral; lit. to be felt as neither pain nor pleasure
ru_meaning: нейтральный; досл. может быть ощутим ни как боль, ни как удовольствие
Example1: adukkham'asukhavedaniyaṃ, bhikkhu, phassaṃ paṭicca uppajjati adukkham'asukhā vedanā. so adukkham'asukhaṃ vedanaṃ vedayamāno adukkham'asukhaṃ vedanaṃ vedayāmī'ti pajānāti.

meaning_1: such indeed
Example1: “no h’idaṃ”. “taṃ kissa hetu”? “aduñ’hi allaṃ kaṭṭhaṃ sasnehaṃ, tañ’ca pana udake nikkhittaṃ. yāva’d’eva ca pana so puriso kilamathassa vighātassa bhāgī assā”ti.
Example2: no h'etaṃ, bhante. taṃ kissa hetu'? aduñ'hi, bhante, vantaṃ paṭikūlasammatan'ti.

meaning_1: loving; kind; not angry; not offended
Example1: yad'api, bhikkhave, adoso tad’api kusala-mūlaṃ; yad’api aduṭṭho abhisaṅkharoti kāyena vācāya manasā tad’api kusalaṃ
Example2:
ekam’pi ce pāṇam’aduṭṭha-citto, mettāyati kusalī tena hoti.
sabbe ca pāṇe manas’ānukampī, pahūtam’ariyo pakaroti puññaṃ.

meaning_1: with benevolent mind; lit. not angry mind
ru_meaning: с доброжелательным умом; досл. с умом без злобы
Example1:
ekam’pi ce pāṇam’aduṭṭhacitto, mettāyati kusalī tena hoti.
sabbe ca pāṇe manas’ānukampī, pahūtam’ariyo pakaroti puññaṃ.

meaning_1: taught; explained
Example2: vana-ppagumbe yathā phussit’agge, gimhāna-māse paṭhamasmiṃ gimhe. tath’ūpamaṃ dhamma-varaṃ adesayi, nibbāna-gāmiṃ paramaṃ hitāya.

meaning_1: non-hatred; kindness
Example1: yad'api, bhikkhave, adoso tad’api kusala-mūlaṃ; yad’api aduṭṭho abhisaṅkharoti kāyena vācāya manasā tad’api kusalaṃ

meaning_1: saw
Example1:
yo sukhaṃ dukkhato adda, dukkham’addakkhi sallato.
adukkham’asukhaṃ santaṃ, addakkhi naṃ aniccato.

meaning_1: they saw
Example1:
aniccaṃ aniccato dakkhuṃ, dukkham’addakkhu dukkhato.
anattani ‘anattā’ti, asubhaṃ asubhat’addasuṃ.
sammādiṭṭhi-samādānā, sabbaṃ dukkhaṃ upaccagun’ti

meaning_1: I saw
Example1: evam’eva kho ahaṃ, bhikkhave, addasaṃ akusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ ādīnavaṃ okāraṃ saṃkilesaṃ, kusalānaṃ dhammānaṃ nekkhamme ānisaṃsaṃ vodānapakkhaṃ.

meaning_1: one saw
Example1: siṅgālo'pi kho, bhikkhave, addasa kummaṃ kacchapaṃ dūrato'va gocarapasutaṃ.
Example2: atha kho so bhikkhu vihāraṃ pavisissāmī’ti kavāṭaṃ paṇāmento addasa sabbaṃ vihāraṃ ahinā puṇṇaṃ, vātapānehi bhoge nikkhante, disvāna bhīto vissaram’akāsi.

meaning_1: you saw; you have seen
Example1: ambho purisa, na tvaṃ addasa manussesu itthiṃ vā purisaṃ vā ābādhikaṃ dukkhitaṃ bāḷhagilānaṃ, sake muttakarīse palipannaṃ semānaṃ, aññehi vuṭṭhāpiyamānaṃ, aññehi saṃvesiyamānan’ti?

meaning_1: one saw
Example1: addasā kho, bhikkhave, kummo kacchapo siṅgālaṃ dūrato'va gocarapasutaṃ.

meaning_1: we saw
Example1: duddiṭṭhaṃ vata, bho bhāradvāja, addasāma, duddiṭṭhaṃ vata, bho bhāradvāja, addasāma! ye mayaṃ tassa bhoto gotamassa bhūnahuno seyyaṃ addasāmā'ti.

meaning_1: they saw
Example1:
aniccaṃ aniccato dakkhuṃ, dukkham’addakkhu dukkhato.
anattani ‘anattā’ti, asubhaṃ asubhat’addasuṃ.
sammādiṭṭhi-samādānā, sabbaṃ dukkhaṃ upaccagun’ti

meaning_1: one saw
Example1:
yo sukhaṃ dukkhato adda, dukkham’addakkhi sallato.
adukkham’asukhaṃ santaṃ, addakkhi naṃ aniccato.

meaning_1: old; lit. gone the distance
Example1: eta’r’ahi jiṇṇo vuḍḍho mah’allako addhagato vayoanuppatto āsītiko me vayo vattati. app’ekad’āhaṃ, bho raṭṭhapāla, ‘idha pādaṃ karissāmī’ti aññen’eva pādaṃ karomī"ti.

meaning_1: traveller; voyager; lit. journey goer
ru_meaning: путешественник; странник; досл. тот кто ходит в путешествие
Example1:
duppabbajjaṃ durabhiramaṃ, durāvāsā gharā dukhā,
dukkho'samāna-saṃvāso, dukkh'ānupatit'addhagū,
tasmā na c'addhagū siyā, na ca dukkh'ānupatito siyā.

meaning_1: lasting a long period; lasting; enduring; lit. fit for travelling
ru_meaning: длительный; продолжительный; долгосрочный; досл. подходит для путешествий
Example2: yatha'y'idaṃ brahmacariyaṃ addhaniyaṃ assa ciraṭṭhitikaṃ, tadassa bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lok’ānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ

meaning_1: dirty; soiled; filthy; lit. become dirty
ru_meaning: грязный; загрязненный; немытый; досл. ставший грязным
Example1: evam'etaṃ, gahapati, evam'etaṃ, gahapati! āturo h'āyaṃ, gahapati, kāyo addhabhūto pariyonaddho.

meaning_1: half a month; fortnight; 14 or 15 days
Example1: orena ce “māso seso gimhānan”ti vassikasāṭikacīvaraṃ pariyeseyya, oren'addhamāso seso gimhānan'ti katvā nivāseyya, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: soiled; dirty
Example1: evam'etaṃ, gahapati, evam'etaṃ, gahapati! āturo h'āyaṃ, gahapati, kāyo addha-bhūto pariyonaddho.

meaning_1: path; journey; distance
Example1: ettha dāni, māluṅkyaputta, kiṃ dahare bhikkhū vakkhāma yatra hi nāma tvaṃ, bhikkhu, jiṇṇo vuddho mah’allako addha-gato vayoanuppatto saṃkhittena ovādaṃ yācasī’ti.
Example2: yatha'y'idaṃ brahmacariyaṃ addha-niyaṃ assa ciraṭṭhitikaṃ, tadassa bahujanahitāya bahujanasukhāya lok’ānukampāya atthāya hitāya sukhāya devamanussānaṃ

meaning_1: half; part
Example1: sīhapubb'addha-kāyo kho pana so bhavaṃ gotamo, idam'pi tassa bhoto gotamassa mahāpurisassa mahāpurisalakkhaṇaṃ bhavati.

meaning_1: able to endure a journey; lit. patient with journey
ru_meaning: способен выдержать путешествие; досл. терпеливый к путешествию
Commentary: (ANa) addhānakkhamo hotī'ti dūraṃ addhānamaggaṃ gacchanto khamati, adhivāsetuṃ sakkoti.
Example1: addhānakkhamo hoti, padhānakkhamo hoti, app'ābādho hoti, asitaṃ pītaṃ khāyitaṃ sāyitaṃ sammā pariṇāmaṃ gacchati, caṅkam'ādhigato samādhi ciraṭṭhitiko hoti. ime kho, bhikkhave, pañca caṅkame ānisaṃsā'ti.

meaning_1: taking a journey; going travelling
Example1: gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, addhānagamana-samayo, nāv’ābhiruhanasamayo, mahāsamayo, samaṇabhattasamayo.

meaning_1: time of undertaking a journey; occasion of going on a roadtrip
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.32) addhānagamanasamayo nāma addhayojanaṃ gacchissāmī'ti bhuñjitabbaṃ, gacchantena bhuñjitabbaṃ, gatena bhuñjitabbaṃ
Example1: gilānasamayo, cīvaradānasamayo, cīvarakārasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo, nāv’ābhiruhanasamayo, mahāsamayo, samaṇabhattasamayo.
Example2: `diyaḍḍho māso seso gimhānan'ti vassānassa paṭhamo māso – icc'ete aḍḍhateyyamāsā uṇhasamayo, pariḷāhasamayo, gilānasamayo, kammasamayo, addhānagamanasamayo, vātavuṭṭhisamayo.

meaning_1: a long path; high road
Example1: seyyathā’pi, bhikkhave, puriso addhānamagga-ppaṭipanno. so passeyya mahantaṃ udaka-aṇṇavaṃ, orimaṃ tīraṃ sāsaṅkaṃ sappaṭibhayaṃ, pārimaṃ tīraṃ khemaṃ appaṭibhayaṃ.
Example2: bhikkhu yathā iṇaṃ yathā rogaṃ yathā bandhan’āgāraṃ yathā dāsabyaṃ yathā kantār’addhānamaggaṃ, ime pañca nīvaraṇe appahīne attani samanupassati

meaning_1: undertaking a long journey; travelling along the main road
ru_meaning: совершающий долгое путешествие; путешествующий по главной дороге
Example1: seyyathā’pi, bhikkhave, puriso addhānamaggappaṭipanno. so passeyya mahantaṃ udaka-aṇṇavaṃ, orimaṃ tīraṃ sāsaṅkaṃ sappaṭibhayaṃ, pārimaṃ tīraṃ khemaṃ appaṭibhayaṃ.
Example2: bhikkhuno pan'eva addhānamaggapaṭipannassa eḷakalomāni uppajjeyyuṃ

meaning_1: lives out one's lifetime; lit. causes to move through the period
ru_meaning: проживает свою жизнь; досл. побуждает пройти через период
Commentary: (SNa) addhānañ’ca āpādentī’ti paveṇiṃ paṭipādenti, dīgharattaṃ anubandhāpenti.
Example1: paṭhamena vayasā anikīḷitāvino kāmesu yāvajīvaṃ paripuṇṇaṃ parisuddhaṃ brahmacariyaṃ caranti, addhānañ’ca āpādentī”ti?

meaning_1: time; duration
Example1: atītam’p’āhaṃ addhānaṃ evam’eva rūpena khajjiṃ, seyyathā’pi eta’r’ahi paccuppannena rūpena khajjāmi.

meaning_1: (long) journey; distance
Example2: bhikkhu yathā iṇaṃ yathā rogaṃ yathā bandhan’āgāraṃ yathā dāsabyaṃ yathā kantār’addhāna-maggaṃ, ime pañca nīvaraṇe appahīne attani samanupassati

meaning_1: certainly; surely
Notes: (NIDD I) addhā'ti ekaṃsavacanaṃ nissaṃsayavacanaṃ nikkaṅkhāvacanaṃ advejjhavacanaṃ adveḷhakavacanaṃ niyogavacanaṃ apaṇṇakavacanaṃ avatthāpanavacanametaṃ
Example1:
kāmaṃ kāmayamānassa, tassa ce taṃ samijjhati,
addhā pītimano hoti, laddhā macco yad'icchati.

meaning_1: most certainly! for sure! definitely!
Example2: niṭṭham’ettha gantabbaṃ – ‘addhā, idaṃ na c’eva tassa bhagavato vacanaṃ arahato sammāsambuddhassa.
Example3: addhā imāya paṭipadāya jāti-jarā-byādhi-maraṇamhā parimuccissāmi

meaning_1: changing; unstable; impermanent
Example1: “jātaṃ bhūtaṃ samuppannaṃ, kataṃ saṅkhatam’addhuvaṃ. jarāmaraṇa-saṅghāṭaṃ, roganīḷaṃ pabhaṅguraṃ. āhāra-netti-ppabhavaṃ, n’ālaṃ tad'abhinandituṃ.
Example2: addhuvaṃ me jīvitaṃ, dhuvaṃ me maraṇaṃ, avassaṃ mayā maritabbaṃ, maraṇa-pariyosānaṃ me jīvitaṃ, jīvitaṃ me aniyataṃ ; maraṇaṃ me niyataṃ

meaning_1: non-dual; unified; single
Example1: dasa'y'imāni, bhikkhave, kasiṇ'āyatanāni. katamāni dasa? pathavīkasiṇam'eko sañjānāti uddhaṃ adho tiriyaṃ advayaṃ appamāṇaṃ.

meaning_1: lowest; vilest; meanest; worst
ru_meaning: самый низкий; самый мерзкий; самый слабый; худший
Example1:
na bhaje pāpake mitte, na bhaje purisa-adhame,
bhajetha mitte kalyāṇe, bhajetha puris'uttame.

meaning_1: who doesn't speak according to the Teaching
Commentary:
(MNa) adhammavādī'ti asabhāvaṃ vattā.
(ANa) adhammaṃ vadati, no dhamman'ti adhammavādī.
Example1: samphappalāpī hoti akālavādī abhūtavādī anatthavādī adhammavādī avinayavādī; anidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti akālena anapadesaṃ apariyantavatiṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ.

meaning_1: misconduct; unjust means; cheating
Example1:
na attahetu na parassa hetu, na puttam'icche na dhanaṃ na raṭṭhaṃ,
na iccheyya adhammena samiddhim'attano, sa sīlavā paññavā dhammiko siyā.
Example2:
evaṃ bho purisa jānāhi, pāpadhammā asaññatā,
mā taṃ lobho adhammo ca, ciraṃ dukkhāya randhayuṃ.

meaning_1: false teaching; against the teaching
Example1: kull’ūpamaṃ vo, bhikkhave, dhammaṃ desitaṃ, ājānantehi dhammā’pi vo pahātabbā pag’eva adhammā.
Example3:
na hi dhammo adhammo ca, ubho sama-vipākino.
adhammo nirayaṃ neti, dhammo pāpeti suggatiṃ.

meaning_1: related to settling of a legal issue; related to appeasement of problem
ru_meaning: связанный с решением спорного вопроса; связанный с урегулированием проблемы
Example1: ime kho pan'āyasmanto, satta adhikaraṇasamathā dhammā uddesaṃ āgacchanti.

meaning_1: for the sake of; for the purpose of; on account of; with regard to
ru_meaning: ради (чего-л.); для цели; в соответствии (с); по отношению (к)
Example1: so tesaṃ bhogānaṃ ārakkh’ādhikaraṇaṃ dukkhaṃ domanassaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, kin’ti me bhoge n’eva rājāno hareyyuṃ, na corā hareyyuṃ, na aggi daheyya, na udakaṃ vaheyya, na appiyā dāy'ādā hareyyun’ti
Example2: yatv’ādhikaraṇam’enaṃ cakkhu’ndriyaṃ asaṃvutaṃ viharantaṃ abhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā dhammā anvāssaveyyuṃ, tassa saṃvarāya paṭipajjāhi;

meaning_1: (vinaya) issue; legal process; law-suit; litigation
ru_meaning: (виная) проблема; правовой процесс; судебное дело; тяжба
Commentary: (VIN 1.2.8) adhikaraṇaṃ nāma cattāri adhikaraṇāni, vivādādhikaraṇaṃ, anuvādādhikaraṇaṃ, āpattādhikaraṇaṃ, kiccādhikaraṇaṃ.
Example1: tato aparena samayena samanuggāhīyamāno vā asamanuggāhīyamāno vā, amūlakañ’c'eva taṃ adhikaraṇaṃ hoti bhikkhu ca dosaṃ patiṭṭhāti, saṅghādiseso
Example2: yo pana bhikkhu jānaṃ yathādhammaṃ nihat’ādhikaraṇaṃ punakammāya ukkoṭeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: controversial point; reason for dispute
ru_meaning: спорный вопрос; пункт что является основой для разногласий
Example1: paṇḍito, bhikkhave, pukkusāti kulaputto paccapādi dhammass'ānudhammaṃ, na ca maṃ dhamma-adhikaraṇaṃ vihesesi.

meaning_1: cutting; piercing; chopping; lit. smashing
Example1: “asisūn'ūpamā kāmā adhikuṭṭan'aṭṭhenā”ti passanto vikkhambhanato kāme parivajjeti

meaning_1: gets to; attains; finds; acquires; obtains; lit. goes up to
ru_meaning: достигает; обретает; получает; находит; досл. доходит до
Example1: appamattako so, bhikkhave, kaṭaggaho yaṃ so akkhadhutto paṭhamen’eva kaṭaggahena mahantaṃ bhogakkhandhaṃ adhigaccheyya.
Example3: āyudo balado dhīro, vaṇṇado paṭibhānado. sukhassa dātā medhāvī, sukhaṃ so adhigacchati. āyuṃ datvā balaṃ vaṇṇaṃ, sukhañ’ca paṭibhānakaṃ, dīgh’āyu yasavā hoti, yattha yatth’ūpapajjatī’ti.

meaning_1: could get; would experience; would come across; lit. could arrive at
ru_meaning: может добраться до; мог бы прийти к обретению; может достичь
Example1: so tassa pattavaṭṭiṃ vinibbhujanto pheggum’pi n’ādhigaccheyya, kuto sāraṃ!
Example2: so tatonidānaṃ labhetha pāmojjaṃ, adhigaccheyya somanassaṃ

meaning_1: attained; obtained; understood
Example1: sa kho so ariyasāvako evaṃ avera-citto evaṃ abyāpajjha-citto evaṃ asaṃkiliṭṭha-citto evaṃ visuddhacitto. tassa diṭṭh’eva dhamme cattāro assāsā adhigatā honti.
Example2: ‘atthi nu kho me uttarimanussadhammo alam’ariya-ñāṇa-dassana-viseso adhigato, so’haṃ pacchime kāle sabrahmacārīhi puṭṭho na maṅku bhavissāmī’ti
English chant 2: Ten Subjects for Frequent Recollection by One Who Has Gone Forth

meaning_1: arrival (at); attainment (of); reaching (of)
Example1: “ek’āyano ayaṃ maggo sattānaṃ visuddhiyā, soka-paridevānaṃ samatikkamāya, dukkha-domanassānaṃ atthaṅ’gamāya, ñāyassa adhigamāya, nibbānassa sacchikiriyāya, yad'idaṃ cattāro satipaṭṭhānā.
Example2: tasmā’t’iha, bhikkhave, vīriyaṃ ārabhatha appattassa pattiyā, anadhigatassa adhigamāya, asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.

meaning_1: could get; would find; should attain
Example2: etā pi buddha-jaya-maṅgala-aṭṭha-gāthā, yo vācano dina-dine sarate’m’atandī, hitvān’aneka-vividhāni c’upaddavāni, mokkhaṃ sukhaṃ adhigameyya naro sapañño

meaning_1: owns; possess; receives; lit. totally gets
ru_meaning: владеет; обладает; получает; досл. полностью приобретает
Example1:
appamādaṃ pasaṃsanti, puññakiriyāsu paṇḍitā.
appamatto ubho atthe, adhiggaṇhāti paṇḍito.

meaning_1: what one has practised; what one has rehearsed; what one has prepared
ru_meaning: то что практиковал; то что репетировал; то что готовил
Commentary: (SNa) adhiciṇṇaṃ te viparāvattanti yaṃ tuyhaṃ dīghena kālena paricitaṃ suppaguṇaṃ, taṃ mama vādaṃ āgamma sabbaṃ khaṇena viparāvattaṃ nivattaṃ.
Example1: adhiciṇṇaṃ te viparāvattaṃ. āropito te vādo; cara vādappamokkhāya. niggahito’si; nibbeṭhehi vā sace pahosī’ti.

meaning_1: meditation; mental development; lit. higher mind
ru_meaning: медиация; развитие ума; досл. высший разум
Example1: tisso imā, bhikkhave, sikkhā yatth’etaṃ sabbaṃ samodhānaṃ gacchati. katamā tisso? adhisīlasikkhā, adhicitta-sikkhā, adhipaññāsikkhā.
Example2:
anūpavādo anūpaghāto, pātimokkhe ca saṃvaro,
mattaññutā ca bhattasmiṃ, pantañ’ca sayan’āsanaṃ,
adhicitte ca āyogo, etaṃ buddhāna sāsanaṃ.

meaning_1: engaged in meditation; devoted to mental development; cultivating the higher mind
ru_meaning: занимающийся медитацией; посвятивший себя развитию ума; взращивающий высший разум
Example1: evam'evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, santi adhicittam'anuyuttassa bhikkhuno oḷārikā upakkilesā kāyaduccaritaṃ vacīduccaritaṃ manoduccaritaṃ

meaning_1: meditation training; development of the higher mind
Example1: tisso imā, bhikkhave, sikkhā yatth’etaṃ sabbaṃ samodhānaṃ gacchati. katamā tisso? adhisīlasikkhā, adhicittasikkhā, adhipaññāsikkhā.

meaning_1: rare; unlikely; by chance; exceptional
Example1: idha, bhaddāli, ekacco bhikkhu adhicc’āpattiko hoti anāpattibahulo.

meaning_1: rarely making transgression; by chance guilty of an offence; occasionally offending
ru_meaning: редко совершающий проступок; случайно виновен в нарушении; иногда нарушающий
Example1: idha, bhaddāli, ekacco bhikkhu adhicc’āpattiko hoti anāpattibahulo.

meaning_1: stands firmly; determines; resolves; fixes attention on
ru_meaning: стоит твердо; устанавливает; намеревается; фокусирует внимание
Example1: āloka-saññaṃ manasi kareyyāsi, divāsaññaṃ adhiṭṭhaheyyāsi – yathā divā tathā rattiṃ yathā rattiṃ tathā divā. iti vivaṭena cetasā apariyonaddhena sa’p’pabhāsaṃ cittaṃ bhāveyyāsi

meaning_1: concentrating (on); focusing (on); fixing one's attention (on); establishing
Example1: tasmā’t’iha tvaṃ, soṇa, vīriyasamathaṃ adhiṭṭhahaṃ, indriyānañ'ca samataṃ paṭivijjha, tattha ca nimittaṃ gaṇhāhī'ti. evaṃ, bhante'ti
Example2: cittaṃ adhiṭṭhahanto sikkheyya, saddhāya adhimuccanto sikkheyya, vīriyaṃ paggaṇhanto sikkheyya, satiṃ upaṭṭhapento sikkheyya

meaning_1: concentrating (on); focusing (on); fixing one's attention (on); determining
Example1:
ṭhitena kāyena ṭhitena cetasā, tiṭṭhaṃ nisinno uda vā sayāno,
etaṃ satiṃ bhikkhu adhiṭṭhahāno,
adassanaṃ maccurājassa gacche'ti.

meaning_1: should be ordered; to be arranged; to be placed; should be applied; lit. to be stood on
ru_meaning: должен быть назначен; может быть организован; может быть помещен; может быть применен; досл. следует стоять (на)
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.19) pariyāyena chādentassa dve pariyāye adhiṭṭhahitvā tatiyaṃ pariyāyaṃ āṇāpetvā pakkamitabbaṃ.
Example1: appaharite ṭhitena, adhiṭṭhātabbaṃ. tato ce uttariṃ appaharite'pi ṭhito adhiṭṭhaheyya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: stands firmly; takes a stand (upon); makes up one's mind; determines
ru_meaning: твердо стоит; имеет твердое убеждение; принимает решение; определяет
Example1: so rūpaṃ upeti upādiyati adhiṭṭhāti ‘attā me’ti.

meaning_1: highest state of resolution; perfection of determination
ru_meaning: высочайшее состояние твердости намерения; совершенство решительности
Example1: aṭṭhamaṃ adhiṭṭhānapārami, navamaṃ mettā-pārami, dasamaṃ upekkhā-pāramī'ti

meaning_1: basis; foundation; standpoint
Example1: chadhāturo ayaṃ, bhikkhu, puriso chaphass'āyatano aṭṭhārasamano'pavicāro caturo-adhiṭṭhāno

meaning_1: standpoint; prejudice; bias; preconception
ru_meaning: точка зрения; предвзятое мнение; предубеждение; предрассудок
Example1: bhikkhu ye loke upādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhān’ābhinives’ānusayā, te pajahanto viharati anupādiyanto. ayaṃ vuccat’ānanda, sabbaloke anabhirata-saññā.

meaning_1: determination; decisive resolution; fixing the mind on
Example1: aṭṭhamaṃ adhiṭṭhāna-pārami, navamaṃ mettā-pārami, dasamaṃ upekkhā-pāramī'ti

meaning_1: mental standpoints attachments and underlying tendencies; prejudices adherences and dormant proclivities
ru_meaning: предвзятые мнения привязанности и скрытые склонности; предрассудки цепляния и скрытые тенденции
Example1: bhikkhu ye loke upādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhān’ābhinives’ānusayā, te pajahanto viharati anupādiyanto. ayaṃ vuccat’ānanda, sabbaloke anabhirata-saññā.

meaning_1: concentrated (on); focused (on); fixed one's attention (on); determined (to)
Example1: atha kho āyasmā soṇo aparena samayena vīriyasamathaṃ adhiṭṭhāsi, indriyānañ'ca samataṃ paṭivijjhi, tattha ca nimittaṃ aggahesi.

meaning_1: committed (to); resolved (to); determined (to); lit. stood firmly
ru_meaning: преданный; намеренный; определенный; досл. основательно стоящий
Example1:
paṇḍito'ti samaññāto, ekacariyaṃ adhiṭṭhito,
athā'pi methune yutto, mando'va parikissati.

meaning_1: could stand firmly; would determines; resolves
ru_meaning: может стоять твердо; стоило бы устанавливать; намереваться
Example2:
tiṭṭhañ’caraṃ, nisinno vā, sayāno vā, yāvat’assa vigata-middho,
etaṃ satiṃ adhiṭṭheyya, brahmam’etaṃ vihāraṃ idha’m’āhu.

meaning_1: lord; master; ruler
Example1:
passanti devā ca tathāgatā ca, lokasmiṃ bālaṃ visamaṃ carantaṃ,
tasmā hi att'ādhipateyyako ca, loka-adhipo ca nipako ca jhāyī,
dhamm'ādhipo ca anudhammacārī, na hīyati saccaparakkamo muni.
Example2: buddh’ādhipa-varo nātho, dhammo nātho var’uttamo. nātho paccekabuddho ca saṅgho nāth’ottaro mamaṃ.

meaning_1: higher insight; deep understanding; lit. higher wisdom
ru_meaning: высшая проницательность; глубокое понимание; досл. высшая мудрость
Example1: tisso imā, bhikkhave, sikkhā yatth’etaṃ sabbaṃ samodhānaṃ gacchati. katamā tisso? adhisīlasikkhā, adhicittasikkhā, adhipaññā-sikkhā.

meaning_1: higher insight training; development of deep understanding
ru_meaning: тренировка высшей проницательности; развитие глубокого понимания
Example1: tisso imā, bhikkhave, sikkhā yatth’etaṃ sabbaṃ samodhānaṃ gacchati. katamā tisso? adhisīlasikkhā, adhicittasikkhā, adhipaññāsikkhā.

meaning_1: having attacked; having charged; lit. having fallen on
Commentary: (UDa) adhipatitvā'ti abhibhavitvā madditvā.
Example1: atha kho acirapakkantassa bhagavato bāhiyaṃ dārucīriyaṃ gāvī taruṇavacchā adhipatitvā jīvitā voropesi.

meaning_1: predominant; ruling over; governing
Example2: magg’ārammaṇā dhammā. magga-hetukā dhammā. magg’ādhipatino dhammā

meaning_1: master; ruler; person in charge
Example1: so attānaṃ'y'eva adhipatiṃ karitvā akusalaṃ pajahati, kusalaṃ bhāveti, sāvajjaṃ pajahati, anavajjaṃ bhāveti, suddhaṃ attānaṃ pariharati. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, att'ādhipateyyaṃ.

meaning_1: overseen by; ruled by; dominated by
Example1: ‘chanda-mūlakā, manasikāra-sambhavā, phassa-samudayā, vedanā-samosaraṇā, samādhi-ppamukhā, sat’ādhipateyyā, paññ’uttarā, vimutti-sārā, amat’ogadhā, nibbāna-pariyosānā sabbe dhammā’ti.

meaning_1: seized (by); assailed (by); victim (of); overpowered (by)
Example1:
na santi puttā tāṇāya, na pitā n'āpi bandhavā,
antaken'ādhipannassa, n'atthi ñātīsu tāṇatā.

meaning_1: great bondage; servitude
Example1: appamattako so kaliggaho yaṃ so akkhadhutto paṭhamen’eva kaliggahena puttam’pi jīyetha, dāram’pi jīyetha, sabbaṃ sāpateyyam’pi jīyetha, uttari’pi adhibandhaṃ nigaccheyya.

meaning_1: extreme; excessive; utmost; intense
Example1: seyyathā’pi āditta-celo vā āditta-sīso vā, tass’eva celassa vā sīsassa vā nibbāpanāya adhimattaṃ chandañ’ca vāyāmañ’ca ussāhañ’ca ussoḷhiñ’ca appaṭivāniñ’ca satiñ’ca sampajaññañ’ca kareyya.
Example2: atthi dukkhaṃ adhimattaṃ, atthi parittaṃ, atthi dandha-virāgi, atthi khippa-virāgi. ayaṃ vuccati dukkhassa vemattatā.

meaning_1: overestimation of oneself; overrating oneself
ru_meaning: переоценка себя; слишком высокая оценка себя
Example1: “ajānam’evaṃ, āvuso, avacaṃ `jānāmi', apassaṃ `passāmi'. tucchaṃ musā vilapin”ti, aññatra adhimānā, ayam'pi pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.
Example2: kacci te, bhante, bhikkhū samma'd'eva aññaṃ byākaṃsu udāhu sant'etth'ekacce bhikkhū adhimānena aññaṃ byākaṃsū'ti?

meaning_1: is intent (on); is drawn (to); inclines (to); feels attached to; lit. is released towards
ru_meaning: тянется (к); побуждается (к); склоняется (к); чувствует привязанность (к); досл. освобождается по отношению (к)
Notes: or maybe because (MW) √muc: gladden , delight , yield enjoyment
Example1: idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhu cakkhunā rūpaṃ disvā piyarūpe rūpe adhimuccati, appiyarūpe rūpe byāpajjati, anupaṭṭhita-kāyassati ca viharati parittacetaso.

meaning_1: is settled (on); has made up one's mind (about); has faith (in); inclines (towards); lit. is released towards
ru_meaning: успокаивается (по отношению к); принимает решение (об); имеет веру (в); склоняется (к); досл. освобождается по отношению (к)
Commentary: (SNa) adhimuccatī'ti saddh'ādhimokkhaṃ paṭilabhati.
Example1: viññāṇaṃ aniccan'ti passati. tassa dhāt'ārammaṇam'eva cittaṃ pakkhandati pasīdati santiṭṭhati adhimuccati.

meaning_1: becoming settled (towards); making up one's mind (about); having faith (in); inclining (towards); lit. being released towards
ru_meaning: успокаивающийся (по отношению к); принявший решение (о); верящий (в); склоняющийся (к); досл. освобождающийся по отношению (к)
Notes: or maybe because (MW) √muc: gladden , delight , yield enjoyment
Example1: cittaṃ adhiṭṭhahanto sikkheyya, saddhāya adhimuccanto sikkheyya, vīriyaṃ paggaṇhanto sikkheyya, satiṃ upaṭṭhapento sikkheyya

meaning_1: infatuated; greedy; strongly fixated on
Example2:
paṇītaṃ yadi vā lūkhaṃ, appaṃ vā yadi vā bahuṃ.
yāpan’atthaṃ abhuñjiṃsu, agiddhā n’ādhimucchitā.

meaning_1: set (on); intent (on); focused (on); fixed (on); inclined (towards); lit. with released towards
ru_meaning: установленный (на); сосредоточенный (на); сфокусированный (на); склонный (к); досл. освобожденный по отношению (к)
Notes: or maybe because (MW) √muc: gladden , delight , yield enjoyment
Example1: subhan’tv’eva adhimutto hoti — ayaṃ tatiyā disā
Example2:
sadā jāgaramānānaṃ, ahoratt'ānusikkhinaṃ,
nibbānaṃ adhimuttānaṃ, atthaṃ gacchanti āsavā.

meaning_1: dedicated (to); accustomed (to); habituated (to); lit. released towards
ru_meaning: преданный (чему-то); привыкший (к); приученный (к); досл. освобожденный по отношению (к)
Notes: or maybe because (MW) √muc: gladden , delight , yield enjoyment
Example1: yo so, bhante, bhikkhu arahaṃ khīṇ'āsavo vusitavā katakaraṇīyo ohita-bhāro anuppattasadattho parikkhīṇabhavasaṃyojano samma’d’aññāvimutto, so cha ṭhānāni adhimutto hoti

meaning_1: laid on; incubated
Commentary: (SNa) adhisayitānī'ti tāya ca janettiyā kukkuṭiyā pakkhe pasāretvā tesaṃ upari sayantiyā sammā adhisayitāni.
Example1: tān'assu kukkuṭiyā sammā adhisayitāni sammā pariseditāni sammā paribhāvitāni

meaning_1: higher virtue; higher conduct
Example1: tisso imā, bhikkhave, sikkhā yatth’etaṃ sabbaṃ samodhānaṃ gacchati. katamā tisso? adhisīla-sikkhā, adhicittasikkhā, adhipaññāsikkhā.

meaning_1: training in higher virtue; development of higher conduct
ru_meaning: тренировка высокой нравственности; развитие высшего поведения
Example1: tisso imā, bhikkhave, sikkhā yatth’etaṃ sabbaṃ samodhānaṃ gacchati. katamā tisso? adhisīlasikkhā, adhicittasikkhā, adhipaññāsikkhā.

meaning_1: lies flat (on); lies down (on)
Example2:
aciraṃ vat’ayaṃ kāyo, paṭhaviṃ adhisessati.
chuḍḍho apeta-viññāṇo, niratthaṃ’va kaliṅgaraṃ.

meaning_1: term (for); name (for); expression (for); epithet (of); designation (for); metaphor
Example1: 'orimaṃ tīran’ti kho chann’etaṃ ajjhattikānaṃ āyatanānaṃ adhivacanaṃ. ‘pārimaṃ tīran’ti kho channetaṃ bāhirānaṃ āyatanānaṃ adhivacanaṃ.
Example2: “daḷhe khīle vā thambhe vā'ti kho, bhikkhave, kāyagatāya satiyā etaṃ adhivacanaṃ.

meaning_1: pathway of expression; mode of designation
Example1: tayo'me, bhikkhave, niruttipathā adhivacanapathā paññattipathā asaṅkiṇṇā asaṅkiṇṇapubbā, na saṅkīyanti, na saṅkīyissanti, appaṭikuṭṭhā samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhi.

meaning_1: comes on; overwhelms; roll to; accrue to
ru_meaning: приходит (к); наполняет; катится (на); выпадает на долю
Example1:
patirūpe vase dese, ariya-mitta-karo siyā.
sammā-paṇidhi-sampanno, pubbe puññakato naro.
dhaññaṃ dhanaṃ yaso kitti, sukhaṃ-cetaṃ-adhivattatī;

meaning_1: enduring; patient
Example1: kharānaṃ kaṭukānaṃ asātānaṃ amanāpānaṃ pāṇaharānaṃ adhivāsaka-jātiko hoti.

meaning_1: who is patient; who endures; lit. patient type
ru_meaning: терпеливый; кто терпит; досл. терпеливого типа
Example1: kharānaṃ kaṭukānaṃ asātānaṃ amanāpānaṃ pāṇaharānaṃ adhivāsakajātiko hoti.

meaning_1: endurance; forbearance; patience
Example1: atthi āsavā adhivāsanā pahātabbā – duruttānaṃ durāgatānaṃ vacanapathānaṃ, uppannānaṃ sārīrikānaṃ vedanānaṃ dukkhānaṃ tibbānaṃ

meaning_1: enduring; tolerating; weathering
Example1: yañ’hi’ssa, bhikkhave, anadhivāsayato uppajjeyyuṃ āsavā vighāta-pariḷāhā, adhivāsayato evaṃsa te āsavā vighāta-pariḷāhā na honti.

meaning_1: agrees (to); consents (to); accepts
Example1: tam’enaṃ gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā upasaṅkamitvā svātanāya bhattena nimanteti. ākaṅkhamāno, jīvaka, bhikkhu adhivāseti.

meaning_1: patiences; bears; endures; tolerates
Example1: tañ’ce bhikkhu adhivāseti nappajahati na vinodeti na byantīkaroti na anabhāvaṃ gameti

meaning_1: agreed (to); consented (to); accepted
Example1: sādhu kira, bhante, āyasmā ānando yena bhikkhun'upassayo yena sā bhikkhunī ten'upasaṅkamatu anukampaṃ upādāyā'ti. adhivāsesi kho āyasmā ānando tuṇhībhāvena.
Example2: adhivāsesi bhagavā tuṇhībhāvena

meaning_1: higher; up to; completely; very; strongly
ru_meaning: выше; вплоть до; полностью; очень; сильно
Commentary:
adhicitta - lit. higher mind
adhigacchati – attains, reaches, goes up to
adhiggaṇhāti - possess; lit. totally gets
Notes:
adhimucchitā – infatuated, very greedy
adhiṭṭheyya -could stand firmly
Example1:
adhi-citta-sikkhā
ratiṃ so na-adhi-gacchati
adhi-ggaṇhāti paṇḍito
Example2:
agiddhā na-adhi-mucchitā
etaṃ satiṃ adhi-ṭṭheyya

meaning_1: belonging to; subject to; subservient to
Example1: seyyathā’pi puriso dāso assa anatt’ādhīno par’ādhīno na yenakāmaṃgamo. so aparena samayena tamhā dāsabyā mucceyya

meaning_1: recently; now; presently; at this time
ru_meaning: недавно; сейчас; в настоящее время; нынче
Example1: tasmā’t’iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ - ‘adhun’āgata-vadhukā-samena cetasā viharissāmā’ti

meaning_1: recently came (to); newly arrived (to)
Example1: ahaṃ kho, āvuso, navo acirapabbajito adhun'āgato imaṃ dhammavinayaṃ. na t'āhaṃ sakkomi vitthārena ācikkhituṃ.

meaning_1: like a recently arrived young wife
Example1: tasmā't'iha, bhikkhave, evaṃ sikkhitabbaṃ, adhun'āgatavadhukāsamena cetasā viharissāmā'ti. evañ'hi vo, bhikkhave, sikkhitabban'ti.

meaning_1: unstable; not enduring; not eternal
ru_meaning: не стабильный; не прочный; не вечный
Example1: bhayato upasaggato calato pabhaṅguto adhuvato atāṇato aleṇato asaraṇato rittato tucchato suññato anattato ādīnavato

meaning_1: going downwards; descending
Example1: yaṃ ajjhattaṃ paccattaṃ vāyo vāyogataṃ upādinnaṃ, seyyath'idaṃ, uddhaṅ'gamā vātā, adhogamā vātā, kucchisayā vātā, koṭṭh'āsayā vātā, aṅgam'aṅg'ānusārino vātā, assāso passāso

meaning_1: going downwards; descending; sinking
Example1: “seyyathā’pi puriso sappi-kumbhaṃ vā tela-kumbhaṃ vā gambhīraṃ udaka-rahadaṃ ogāhitvā bhindeyya. tatra yā assa sakkharā vā kaṭhalā vā sā adhogāmī assa

meaning_1: going downstream; going down
ru_meaning: спускающийся вниз по течению; двигающийся вниз
Commentary:
(VIN 2.1.28) adhogāminin'ti ojavanikāya.
(VINa) adhogāminin'ti adho anusotaṃ gacchantiṃ.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruheyya uddhaṃgāminiṃ vā adhogāminiṃ vā, aññatra tiriyaṃ taraṇāya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: (of the body) lower part; lower portion
Example1: yena ca asitapītakhāyitasāyitaṃ adhobhāgaṃ nikkhamati … ayaṃ vuccati, rāhula, ajjhattikā ākāsadhātu.

meaning_1: glum; downcast; dispirited; lit. face downward
ru_meaning: угрюмый; подавленный; унылый; досл. лицом вниз
Example1: evaṃ vutte, uttaro māṇavo pārāsiviy’antevāsī tuṇhībhūto maṅkubhūto pattakkhandho adhomukho pajjhāyanto appaṭibhāno nisīdi.

meaning_1: shaken off; tossed off
Example1:
upayo hi dhammesu upeti vādaṃ, anūpayaṃ kena kathaṃ vadeyya,
attā nirattā na hi tassa atthi, adhosi so diṭṭhim'idh'eva sabban'ti.

meaning_1: purgative; laxative; which induces diarrhoea; lit. purging down
ru_meaning: слабительное; что вызывает диарею; досл. опустошение вниз
Commentary: (DNa) adhovirecanan'ti adho dosānaṃ nīharaṇaṃ.
Example1: tassa so bhisakko sallakatto bhesajjaṃ kareyya, uddhaṃvirecanaṃ adhovirecanaṃ añjanaṃ paccañjanaṃ natthukammaṃ. so taṃ bhesajjaṃ āgamma cakkhūni uppādeyya, cakkhūni visodheyya.

meaning_1: below; under
Example1: ayaṃ kho me kāyo uddhaṃ pādatalā adho kesa-matthakā taca-pariyanto pūro nānappakārassa asucino
Example2:
mettañ’ca sabba-lokasmiṃ, mānasam’bhāvaye aparimāṇaṃ;
uddhaṃ adho ca tiriyañ’ca, asambādhaṃ, averaṃ, asapattaṃ.

meaning_1: downwards
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhuniyā saddhiṃ saṃvidhāya ekaṃ nāvaṃ abhiruheyya uddhaṃgāminiṃ vā adho-gāminiṃ vā, aññatra tiriyaṃ taraṇāya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: not; (negative prefix before consonants)
Example1: bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ n’ādhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti ana-bhāvaṃ gameti
Example2:
na cīvare na sayane, bhojane nupalimpati.
gotamo ana-ppameyyo, muḷālapupphaṃ vimalaṃva.
ambunā nekkhammaninno, tibhavābhinissaṭo.

meaning_1: indescribable; ineffable; indefinable; inexpressible; unspeakable; unnameable
Commentary: (DHPa) anakkhāte'ti nibbāne.
Example1:
chandajāto anakkhāte, manasā ca phuṭo siyā,
kāmesu ca appaṭibaddhacitto, uddhaṃsoto'ti vuccati.

meaning_1: unsaid; untold; uninformed; undeclared; unstated; not made known
ru_meaning: невысказанный; не выраженный; не объявленный; неустановленный; не обнародованный
Example1: etad'eva kho pana mayaṃ bhoto gotamassa ārocetu'kāmā. atha ca pana bhavaṃ gotamo anakkhātaṃ'y'eva akkhāsī'ti.

meaning_1: homelessness
Example1: yass’atthāya kulaputtā samma’d’eva agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajanti
Example2: yan’nūn’āhaṃ kesamassuṃ ohāretvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajeyyan’ti.

meaning_1: spotless; blemish free
Example1:
niṭṭhaṅ’gato asantāsī, vītataṇho anaṅgaṇo,
acchindi bhavasallāni, antimo’yaṃ samussayo.
Example2: so evaṃ samāhite citte parisuddhe pariyodāte anaṅgaṇe vigat’ūpakkilese mudubhūte kammaniye ṭhite āneñjappatte

meaning_1: more wonderful; most marvellous
Example1: apissu maṃ, bhikkhave, imā anacchariyā gāthāyo paṭibhaṃsu pubbe assutapubbā

meaning_1: not fallen into error; without mistake; guiltless
ru_meaning: не совершивший оплошность; без ошибки; невиновный
Example1: aladdhā ca cīvaraṃ na ca paritassissāma, laddhā ca cīvaraṃ agadhitā amucchitā anajjhāpannā ādīnavadassāvino nissaraṇapaññā paribhuñjissāma.

meaning_1: not blindly absorbed; not obsessed
Construction: na > an + adhi > adhy > ajjh + ava + √pad + na
Example1: so taṃ piṇḍapātaṃ agathito amucchito anajjhopanno ādīnavadassāvī nissaraṇapañño paribhuñjati.

meaning_1: not clinging; not fixating; not holding tightly
ru_meaning: не цепляясь; не привязываясь; не держась крепко
Construction:
na > an + adhi + ava + √sā + ya
na + ajjhosāya
Example1: tañ’ce bhikkhu n’ābhinandati n’ābhivadati n’ājjhosāya tiṭṭhati, tassa taṃ anabhinandato anabhivadato anajjhosāya tiṭṭhato nirujjhati nandī. ‘nandinirodhā dukkhanirodho, puṇṇā’ti vadāmi

meaning_1: not fixed in; not clinging to; unattached to
ru_meaning: в котором не установлен; к которому не цепляется; к которому не привязан
Construction: na > an + adhi > adhy > ajjh + ava + √sā + ita
Commentary: (MNa) anajjhositā'ti gilitvā pariniṭṭhāpetvā gahetuṃ na yutthā'ti pajānāti.
Example1: so sukhañ'ce vedanaṃ vedeti, sā aniccā'ti pajānāti, anajjhositā'ti pajānāti, anabhinanditā'ti pajānāti.

meaning_1: not another; no other
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.16) anaññan'ti na añño koci paccayo
Example1: `yassa sambādho bhavissati so pakkamissatī'ti, eta'deva paccayaṃ karitvā anaññaṃ, pācittiyaṃ.
Example2: āgatāni kho, tāta uttara, amhākaṃ mantesu dvattiṃsamahāpurisalakkhaṇāni, yehi samannāgatassa mahāpurisassa dve'y'eva gatiyo bhavanti anaññā.

meaning_1: not depending on another
Example2: “attadīpā, bhikkhave, viharatha attasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā, dhammadīpā dhammasaraṇā anaññasaraṇā.

meaning_1: not understood; not known; unknown
Example1: tīṇ'imāni, bhikkhave, indriyāni. katamāni tīṇi? anaññātañ-ñassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ'indriyaṃ, aññātāv'indriyaṃ
Example2: saddh’indriyaṃ, viriy’indriyaṃ, sat’indriyaṃ, samādh’indriyaṃ, paññ’indriyaṃ, anaññātañ-ñassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ’indriyaṃ, aññātāv’indriyaṃ.

meaning_1: faculty that senses 'I will know the unknown'
Construction: na > an + aññāta + ñassāmi + iti + indriya
Example2: saddh’indriyaṃ, viriy’indriyaṃ, sat’indriyaṃ, samādh’indriyaṃ, paññ’indriyaṃ, anaññātaññassāmī't'indriyaṃ, aññ’indriyaṃ, aññātāv’indriyaṃ.

meaning_1: non-arrogance; humility; non-haughtiness; meekness
Example1: atimānissa purisapuggalassa anatimāno hoti parinibbānāya. dubbacassa purisapuggalassa sovacassatā hoti parinibbānāya.

meaning_1: not conceited; humble; without arrogance; lit. not think too much
ru_meaning: не тщеславный; скромный; не высокомерный; досл. не думает слишком много
Example2:
karaṇīyam’attha-kusalena, yaṃ taṃ santaṃ padaṃ abhisamecca:
sakko ujū ca suhujū ca, suvaco c’assa mudu, anatimānī.

meaning_1: not left over; not remaining
Commentary: (VIN 2.1.35) anatirittaṃ nāma akappiyakataṃ hoti, appaṭiggahitakataṃ hoti, anuccāritakataṃ hoti, ahatthapāse kataṃ hoti, abhuttāvinā kataṃ hoti, bhuttāvinā pavāritena āsanā vuṭṭhitena kataṃ hoti, alametaṃ sabban'ti avuttaṃ hoti, na gilān'ātirittaṃ hoti
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu, bhuttāvī pavārito, anatirittaṃ khādanīyaṃ vā bhojanīyaṃ vā khādeyya vā bhuñjeyya vā, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: not overstepping; not overshooting; not overturning
Example1: kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, janapadaniruttiyā ca anabhiniveso hoti samaññāya ca anatisāro?

meaning_1: not past; not free from; not having got over; lit. not overcome
ru_meaning: несвободный (от); не избавленный; досл. не преодолел
Example1: assutavā kho puthujjano attanā jarā-dhammo samāno jaraṃ anatīto paraṃ jiṇṇaṃ disvā aṭṭīyati harāyati jigucchati attānaṃ’y’eva {na} atisitvā, aham’pi kho’mhi jarā-dhammo jaraṃ anatīto
Example2: jarā-dhammo’mhi jaraṃ anatīto

meaning_1: as impersonal; as not oneself; as nonsubjective; as essence-less
ru_meaning: как не персональный; как безличный; как без-самостный; как без сущностный
Commentary: (MNa) na att'aṭṭhena anattato
Example1: ye’pi hi keci, bhikkhave, anāgatam’addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā yaṃ loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ taṃ aniccato dakkhissanti dukkhato dakkhissanti anattato dakkhissanti rogato dakkhissanti bhayato dakkhissanti, te taṇhaṃ pajahissanti.
Example2: so yad'eva tattha hoti rūpagataṃ vedanāgataṃ saññāgataṃ saṅkhāragataṃ viññāṇagataṃ te dhamme aniccato dukkhato rogato gaṇḍato sallato aghato ābādhato parato palokato suññato anattato samanupassati.

meaning_1: in non-self
Example1:
aniccaṃ aniccato dakkhuṃ, dukkham’addakkhu dukkhato.
anattani ‘anattā’ti, asubhaṃ asubhat’addasuṃ.
sammādiṭṭhi-samādānā, sabbaṃ dukkhaṃ upaccagun’ti

meaning_1: irritated; annoyed; displeased; not delighted; lit. not own mind
ru_meaning: раздраженный; раздосадованный; недовольный; досл. не свой ум
Commentary: (VIN 1.4.3.5) kupito anattamano'ti anabhiraddho āhatacitto khilajāto.
Example1: tatra, bhikkhave, tathāgato na c’eva anattamano hoti, na ca anattamanataṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, anavassuto ca viharati sato sampajāno.
Example2: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhussa sāmaṃ cīvaraṃ datvā, kupito anattamano, acchindeyya vā acchindāpeyya vā, nissaggiyaṃ pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: irritation; annoyance; displeasure; lit. not own mind state
ru_meaning: раздражение; досада; неудовольствие; досл. состояние не своего ума
Construction:
na > an + atta + mana + tā
anattamana + tā
Commentary: (VINa) tāya ca anattamanatāyā'ti yāya anattamano'ti vutto ... imehi dvīhi vedanākkhandhaṃ dasseti.
Example1: tatra, bhikkhave, tathāgato na c’eva anattamano hoti, na ca anattamanataṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, anavassuto ca viharati sato sampajāno.

meaning_1: perception of not self; recognition of impersonality
Example1: iti imesu chasu ajjhattika-bāhiresu āyatanesu anatt’ānupassī viharati. ayaṃ vuccat’ānanda, anattasaññā.
Example2: yāvakīvañ'ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhū anattasaññaṃ bhāvessanti

meaning_1: which has frequently practised perception of impersonality (in)
Example1: dukkhe anattasaññāparicitena, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno cetasā bahulaṃ viharato imasmiñ'ca saviññāṇake kāye bahiddhā ca sabbanimittesu ahaṅ'kāramamaṅ'kāramān'āpagataṃ mānasaṃ hoti vidhāsamatikkantaṃ santaṃ suvimuttaṃ.

meaning_1: impersonal; not oneself; non-subjective; essence-less; non subject to identify with
ru_meaning: не персональный; без личностный; без самости; без сущностный; не следует само-отождествляться (с)
Example3:
“sabbe dhammā anattā”ti, yadā paññāya passati.
atha nibbindati dukkhe, esa maggo visuddhiyā.

meaning_1: which is impersonal; non-self; not subject to identification
ru_meaning: тот что безличный; не сущностный; с которым не следует отождествляться
Example1: sakkā evam’eva viññāṇaṃ pidaṃ ācikkhituṃ desetuṃ paññapetuṃ paṭṭhapetuṃ vivarituṃ vibhajituṃ uttānīkātuṃ — ‘iti’p’idaṃ viññāṇaṃ anattā’”ti?
Example2: “rūpaṃ, bhikkhave, anattā. rūpañ’ca h’idaṃ, bhikkhave, attā abhavissa, na’y’idaṃ rūpaṃ ābādhāya saṃvatteyya, labbhetha ca rūpe — ‘evaṃ me rūpaṃ hotu, evaṃ me rūpaṃ mā ahosī’ti.
English chant 2: The Discourse on the Characteristic of Not-Self

meaning_1: observing the impersonal nature (of); watching non-self
ru_meaning: наблюдающий безличную природу; созерцающий отсутствие самости
Commentary: (ANa) anattānupassī'ti avasavattan'ākāraṃ anattā'ti anupassanto.
Example1: iti imesu chasu ajjhattikabāhiresu āyatanesu anatt'ānupassī viharati. ayaṃ vuccatānanda, anattasaññā.

meaning_1: harm; damage; injury; misfortune; lit. un-benefit
ru_meaning: вред; ущерб; повреждение; беда; досл. не благо
Example1: idha yassa te honti aniṭṭhā akantā amanāpā rūpā saddā gandhā rasā phoṭṭhabbā dhammā, ye vā pan’assa te honti anattha-kāmā ahitakāmā aphāsukakāmā ayogakkhemakāmā
Example2: yo c’āyaṃ kāmesu kāmasukh’allik’ānuyogo hīno gammo pothujjaniko anariyo anattha-sañhito
English chant 2: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

meaning_1: not well-wishing; not benevolent; lit. not desiring benefit
ru_meaning: не желающий благо; не доброжелательный; досл. не желающий пользы
Example1: idha yassa te honti aniṭṭhā akantā amanāpā rūpā saddā gandhā rasā phoṭṭhabbā dhammā, ye vā pan’assa te honti anatthakāmā ahitakāmā aphāsukakāmā ayogakkhemakāmā

meaning_1: unbeneficial saying; unprofitable verse; useless poem
ru_meaning: не благое высказывание; невыгодная строка; бесполезное стихотворение
Example1:
sahassam’api ce gāthā, anatthapada-saṃhitā,
ekaṃ gāthā-padaṃ seyyo, yaṃ sutvā upasammati.

meaning_1: not profitable; meaningless; unbeneficial; lit. not connected with good
Example1:
yaṃ samaṇo bahuṃ bhāsati,
upetaṃ atthasañhitaṃ,
jānaṃ so dhammaṃ deseti,
jānaṃ so bahu bhāsati.
Example2: yo c’āyaṃ attakilamath’ānuyogo dukkho anariyo anatthasañhito.
English chant 2: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

meaning_1: unprofitable; meaningless; unbeneficial; lit. not connected with good
Example1: tatra, bhikkhave, yaṃ jaññā rahovādaṃ abhūtaṃ atacchaṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ sasakkaṃ taṃ rahovādaṃ na bhāseyya.
Example2: yo c’āyaṃ kāmesu kāmasukh’allik’ānuyogo hīno gammo pothujjaniko anariyo anatthasaṃhito

meaning_1: who speaks what is unbeneficial
Commentary:
(MNa) anatthavādī'ti akāraṇanissitaṃ vattā
(ANa) anatthavādī'ti atthaṃ na vadati, anatthaṃ vadati nāma.
(ANa) anatthaṃ vadati, no atthan'ti anatthavādī.
Example1: samphappalāpī hoti akālavādī abhūtavādī anatthavādī adhammavādī avinayavādī; anidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti akālena anapadesaṃ apariyantavatiṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ.

meaning_1: unbeneficial (for); unfortunate (for); lit. for the harm (of)
Example1:
yāva'd'eva anatthāya, ñattaṃ bālassa jāyati,
hanti bālassa sukk'aṃsaṃ, muddham'assa vipātayaṃ.

meaning_1: not reached; has not been attained
Example2: tasmā’t’iha, bhikkhave, vīriyaṃ ārabhatha appattassa pattiyā, anadhigatassa adhigamāya, asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.

meaning_1: not enduring; not tolerating; not weathering
ru_meaning: не выносящий; не терпящий; не выдерживающий
Example1: yañ’hi’ssa, bhikkhave, anadhivāsayato uppajjeyyuṃ āsavā vighāta-pariḷāhā, adhivāsayato evaṃsa te āsavā vighāta-pariḷāhā na honti.

meaning_1: not covetous; not greedy
ru_meaning: не жаждущий; не жадный; не испытывавший страстное желание
Example2:
santussako ca subharo ca, appakicco ca sallahuka-vutti,
sant’indriyo ca nipako ca, appagabbho kulesu ananugiddho.

meaning_1: unfitting; unsuitable; improper; lit. not following the skin; not along the skin
ru_meaning: несоответствующий; неподходящий; неуместный; досл. не следующий по коже; не вдоль кожи
Construction:
na + anu + chavi + ka
na + anucchavi + ka
Example1: ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisa, ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.

meaning_1: non-comprehension; misunderstanding
Example1: catunnaṃ dhammānaṃ ananubodhā appaṭivedhā evam’idaṃ dīgham’addhānaṃ sandhāvitaṃ saṃsaritaṃ mamañ’c’eva tumhākañ’ca

meaning_1: not devoted (to); not applying oneself (to); not practising; lit. not yoked near
ru_meaning: не посвящен (чему то); не применивший себя (к); не практикующий; досл. не запряженный рядом
Example1: bhāvan'ānuyogaṃ ananuyuttassa, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno viharato kiñ'c'āpi evaṃ icchā uppajjeyya, aho vata me anupādāya āsavehi cittaṃ vimucceyyā'ti
Example2: tassa vāt'ātape cārittaṃ ananuyuttassa rajosūkaṃ vaṇamukhaṃ n'ānuddhaṃseyya.

meaning_1: non-practice; non-devotion; non-pursuit; non-doing
ru_meaning: не практика; не преданность; не стремление (к); не выполнение
Example1: ananuyogo ca kho adukkho eso dhammo anupaghāto anupāyāso apariḷāho; sammāpaṭipadā’ti—iti vadaṃ dhammam’eva deseti.

meaning_1: improper; unsuitable; not in accordance (with); lit. not following the hair
ru_meaning: неподходящий; неуместный; не в соответствии (с); досл. против шерсти
Construction:
na > an + anu + loma + ika
ananuloma + ika
Example1: ananucchavikaṃ, moghapurisa, ananulomikaṃ appatirūpaṃ assāmaṇakaṃ akappiyaṃ akaraṇīyaṃ.

meaning_1: unheard
Example2: idaṃ dukkhaṃ ariyasaccan’ti me, bhikkhave, pubbe ananussutesu dhammesu cakkhuṃ udapādi, ñāṇaṃ udapādi, paññā udapādi, vijjā udapādi, āloko udapādi.
English chant 2: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

meaning_1: not blameworthy; praiseworthy; faultless; lit. not to be blamed (for)
ru_meaning: не заслуживающий порицания; достойный похвалы; безупречный; досл. не следует упрекать
Example1: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi aṅgehi samannāgatā vācā subhāsitā hoti, no dubbhāsitā, anavajjā ca ananuvajjā ca viññūnan”ti.

meaning_1: undiscoverable; untraceable; not able to be ascertained; lit. not to be found
ru_meaning: не обнаруживаемый; не отслеживаемый; невозможно установить; досл. не может быть найден
Example1: evaṃ vimuttacittaṃ kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuṃ saindā devā sabrahmakā sapajāpatikā anvesaṃ n'ādhigacchanti, idaṃ nissitaṃ tathāgatassa viññāṇan'ti. taṃ kissa hetu? diṭṭh'ev'āhaṃ, bhikkhave, dhamme tathāgataṃ ananuvijjo'ti vadāmi.

meaning_1: infinite; endless; boundless; without limit
Example1: nissaṭṭhena āvuso, pañcahi indriyehi parisuddhena manoviññāṇena ananto ākāso'ti ākās'ānañc'āyatanaṃ neyyaṃ, anantaṃ viññāṇan'ti
Example2: puññass’idāni katassa yān’aññāni katāni me, tesañ’ca bhāgino hontu satt’ānant’āppamāṇakā

meaning_1: contiguous; immediate; immediately following; lit. no space in between
ru_meaning: смежный; немедленный; сразу следующий; досл. нет места между
Example2: hetu-paccayo, ārammaṇa-paccayo, adhipati-paccayo, anantara-paccayo, samanantara-paccayo, sahajāta-paccayo, aññam’añña-paccayo,

meaning_1: endless; infinite; unlimited; lit. having no end quality
Example1: kiṃ pana, bhante, anantavā loko, idam'eva saccaṃ mogham'aññan'ti? etam'pi kho, poṭṭhapāda, mayā abyākataṃ, anantavā loko, idam'eva saccaṃ mogham'aññan'ti.

meaning_1: not blind; who can see; not spiritually ignorant; lit. not dark
ru_meaning: не слепой; кто может видеть; не духовно невежественный; досл. не темный
Example1: evaṃ pasanno ahaṃ bhoto gotamassa! pahoti me bhavaṃ gotamo tathā dhammaṃ desetuṃ yath'āhaṃ imamhā āsanā anandho vuṭṭhaheyyan'ti.

meaning_1: unafflicted; undistressed; unperturbed; unagitated; lit. not beaten
ru_meaning: не пораженный; не страдающий (от); невозмутимый; не взволнованный; досл. не побитый
Construction: na > an + anu + ā > anvā + √han + ta
Example1:
anavassuta-cittassa, ananvāhata-cetaso,
puññapāpa-pahīnassa, n'atthi jāgarato bhayaṃ.

meaning_1: without reason; without grounds; unreasonable; (comm) without foundation in the discourses
ru_meaning: без причины; безосновательный; необоснованный; (комм) не основывающийся на лекциях
Commentary:
(MNa) anapadesan'ti sutt'āpadesavirahitaṃ.
(ANa) anapadesan'ti apadesarahitaṃ, sāpadesaṃ sakāraṇaṃ katvā na katheti.
Example1: samphappalāpī hoti akālavādī abhūtavādī anatthavādī adhammavādī avinayavādī, anidhānavatiṃ vācaṃ bhāsitā hoti akālena anapadesaṃ apariyantavatiṃ anatthasaṃhitaṃ

meaning_1: never leaving; always following; lit. not going away
ru_meaning: никогда не покидающий; всегда следующий; досл. не уходящий (от)
Example1:
mano-pubbaṅ’gamā dhammā, mano-seṭṭhā mano-mayā.
manasā ce pasannena, bhāsati vā karoti vā.
tato naṃ sukham’anveti, chāyā’va anapāyinī

meaning_1: indifferent (to); disinterested (in); unconcerned (with); without desire (for); lit. not looking out (in)
ru_meaning: безразличный (к); не заинтересованный (в); равнодушный; безучастный; без желания; досл. не смотрящий вовне (на)
Example1: so iti paṭisaṅkhāya atītasmiṃ rūpasmiṃ anapekkho hoti; anāgataṃ rūpaṃ n’ābhinandati; paccuppannassa rūpassa nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya paṭipanno hoti.

meaning_1: indifferent (to); unconcerned (with); disinterested (in); lit. not looking out (in)
ru_meaning: безразличный (к); равнодушный (к); незаинтересованный (в); досл. не смотрящий вовне (на)
Example1:
eṇijaṅghaṃ kisaṃ vīraṃ, app'āhāraṃ alolupaṃ,
sīhaṃ v'ekacaraṃ nāgaṃ, kāmesu anapekkhinaṃ,
upasaṅkamma pucchāma, kathaṃ dukkhā pamuccatī”ti.
Example2:
etaṃ daḷhaṃ bandhanam'āhu dhīrā, ohārinaṃ sithilaṃ duppamuñcaṃ,
etam'pi chetvāna paribbajanti, anapekkhino kāmasukhaṃ pahāya.

meaning_1: great; considerable; not insignificant
Example1:
asso yathā bhadro kasāniviṭṭho, ātāpino saṃvegino bhavātha,
saddhāya sīlena ca vīriyena ca, samādhinā dhammavinicchayena ca,
sampannavijjācaraṇā patissatā, jahissatha dukkham'idaṃ anappakaṃ.
Example2: so ñātidhammo ca ayaṃ nidassito, petāna’pūjā ca katā uḷārā. balañ’ca bhikkhūnam’anuppadinnaṃ, tumhehi puññaṃ pasutaṃ anappakan’ti.

meaning_1: not rehabilitated; not reintegrated; not readmitted; lit. not called back
ru_meaning: не реабилитированный; не восстановленный; досл. не призванный назад
Commentary: (VINa) anabbhito'ti na abbhito, asampaṭicchito, akatabbhānakammo'ti vuttaṃ hoti, anavhāto'ti vā attho.
Example1: ekena'pi ce ūno vīsatigaṇo bhikkhusaṅgho taṃ bhikkhuṃ abbheyya so ca bhikkhu anabbhito te ca bhikkhū gārayhā. ayaṃ tattha sāmīci.

meaning_1: obliteration; annihilation; total destruction
Example1: bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ n’ādhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti;
Example2: te tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tāl’āvatthukatā anabhāvaṃ-katā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā. tasmā tathāgato ‘anokasārī’ti vuccati.

meaning_1: utterly obliterated; totally annihilated; lit. made non-existent
ru_meaning: полностью удаленный; совершенно уничтоженный; досл. сделанный несуществующим
Example1: te tathāgatassa pahīnā ucchinnamūlā tāl’āvatthukatā anabhāvaṃkatā āyatiṃ anuppādadhammā. tasmā tathāgato ‘anokasārī’ti vuccati.

meaning_1: obliterates; totally destroys; lit. cause to go to annihilation
ru_meaning: удаляет; разрушает; досл. приводит к полному уничтожению
Example1: bhikkhu paṭisaṅkhā yoniso uppannaṃ kāmavitakkaṃ n’ādhivāseti pajahati vinodeti byantīkaroti anabhāvaṃ gameti;

meaning_1: not directly knowing; not understanding experientially; not knowing for oneself
ru_meaning: не знающий напрямую; не понимающий на опыте; не знающий для себя
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu, anabhijānaṃ, uttarimanussadhammaṃ att’ūpanāyikaṃ alam’ariyañāṇadassanaṃ samudācareyya: “iti jānāmi, iti passāmī”ti,

meaning_1: not covetous; not greedy
Example1:
‘abhijjhālu vā anabhijjhālu nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi?
byāpanna-citto vā abyāpanna-citto nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi?

meaning_1: who does not covet; who does not crave
ru_meaning: кто не желает; который не жаждет
Example1: idha cunda ekacco anabhijjhālu hoti. yaṃ taṃ parassa paravitt'ūpakaraṇaṃ taṃ anabhijjhitā hoti, aho vata yaṃ parassa taṃ mamassā'ti

meaning_1: not delighting (in); not being pleased (with); not finding pleasure (in); not looking forward (to)
ru_meaning: не наслаждающийся (в); не радующийся; не находящий удовольствие (в); не предвкушающий
Example1: tañ’ce bhikkhu n’ābhinandati n’ābhivadati n’ājjhosāya tiṭṭhati, tassa taṃ anabhinandato anabhivadato anajjhosāya tiṭṭhato nirujjhati nandī. ‘nandinirodhā dukkhanirodho, puṇṇā’ti vadāmi

meaning_1: without delight in; not enjoyed in; not pleased with
ru_meaning: которым не восторгается; которым не наслаждается; которым не доволен
Commentary: (MNa) anabhinanditā'ti taṇhādiṭṭhivasena abhinandituṃ na yuttā'ti pajānāti.
Example1: so sukhañ'ce vedanaṃ vedeti, sā aniccā'ti pajānāti, anajjhositā'ti pajānāti, anabhinanditā'ti pajānāti.

meaning_1: having not approved (of); having not applauded; having not delighted
Example2: anabhinanditvā appaṭikkositvā tāni padabyañjanāni sādhukaṃ uggahetvā sutte otāretabbāni, vinaye sandassetabbāni.

meaning_1: not adhering (to); not sticking (to); not clinging (to); non-insistence; lit. not settling (into)
Construction:
na > an + abhi + ni + √vis > ves + *a
an + abhi + nivesa
Example1: kathañ'ca, bhikkhave, janapadaniruttiyā ca anabhiniveso hoti samaññāya ca anatisāro?

meaning_1: does not invite; does not lead towards
Example1: sārambhe ce bhikkhu vatthusmiṃ aparikkamane saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kāreyya bhikkhū vā anabhineyya vatthu-desanāya pamāṇaṃ vā atikkāmeyya, saṅghādiseso.

meaning_1: unconquered (by); unvanquished (by); undefeated (by)
Example1: aluddho pan'āyaṃ, kālāmā, purisapuggalo lobhena anabhibhūto apariyādinnacitto n'eva pāṇaṃ hanati

meaning_1: dissatisfied; discontent; lit. not taking delight in
Example1: asubhasaññā, maraṇasaññā, āhāre paṭikūlasaññā, sabbaloke anabhirata-saññā, aniccasaññā, anicce dukkhasaññā, dukkhe anattasaññā, pahāna-saññā, virāgasaññā, nirodhasaññā

meaning_1: recognition of dissatisfaction; perception of discontentment
Example1: asubhasaññā, maraṇasaññā, āhāre paṭikūlasaññā, sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā, aniccasaññā, anicce dukkhasaññā, dukkhe anattasaññā, pahānasaññā, virāgasaññā, nirodhasaññā
Example2: idh’ānanda, bhikkhu ye loke upādānā cetaso adhiṭṭhān’ābhinives’ānusayā, te pajahanto viharati anupādiyanto. ayaṃ vuccat’ānanda, sabbaloke anabhiratasaññā.

meaning_1: which has frequently practised perception of dissatisfaction (in)
Example1: sabbaloke anabhiratasaññāparicitena cetasā bahulaṃ viharato lokacitresu cittaṃ patilīyati patikuṭati pativattati, na sampasāriyati upekkhā vā pāṭikulyatā vā saṇṭhāti.

meaning_1: not enjoying; not fond (of); not taking pleasure (in); not indulging (in)
ru_meaning: не наслаждающийся; не любящий; не получающий удовольствие (в); не потворствующий (чему-л.)
Example1: te jātisaṃvattanikesu saṅkhāresu anabhiratā, jarāsaṃvattanikesu saṅkhāresu anabhiratā, maraṇasaṃvattanikesu saṅkhāresu anabhiratā ... jātisaṃvattanike'pi saṅkhāre n'ābhisaṅkharonti

meaning_1: dissatisfaction; discontent; not delighting in
Example1: “alābhā vata me, na vata me lābhā; dulladdhaṃ vata me, na vata me suladdhaṃ; yassa me anabhirati uppannā, rāgo cittaṃ anuddhaṃseti,

meaning_1: dissatisfaction; displeasure; annoyance
Commentary: (VINa) tāya ca anabhiraddhiyā'ti yāya anabhiraddho'ti vutto. imehi dvīhi vedanākkhandhaṃ dasseti.
Example1: tatra ce, bhikkhave, pare tathāgataṃ akkosanti paribhāsanti rosenti vihesenti, tatra, bhikkhave, tathāgatassa na hoti āghāto na appaccayo na cetaso anabhiraddhi.

meaning_1: having not constructed; having not generated; having not fabricated
ru_meaning: не соорудив; не породив; не сфабриковав
Construction:
na > an + abhi + saṃ + √kar > khar + itvā
an + abhisaṅkharitvā
Example1: te jātisaṃvattanike'pi saṅkhāre anabhisaṅkharitvā, jarāsaṃvattanike'pi saṅkhāre anabhisaṅkharitvā ... jātipapātam'pi nappapatanti, jarāpapātam'pi nappapatanti

meaning_1: not creating; not imagining; not forming ideas
ru_meaning: не создающий; не воображающий; не формирующий идеи
Construction:
na > an + abhi + saṃ + kharo + nta
an + abhisaṅkharonta
Example1: tassa acetayato anabhisaṅkharoto tā c'eva saññā nirujjhanti, aññā ca oḷārikā saññā na uppajjanti. so nirodhaṃ phusati.

meaning_1: not thinking (about); not devising (for); not planning (for)
ru_meaning: не думающий; не разрабатывающий; не планирующий
Construction:
na > an + abhi + saṃ + cetaya + nta
an + abhisañcetayanta
Example1: so anabhisaṅkharonto anabhisañcetayanto bhavāya vā vibhavāya vā na kiñci loke upādiyati, anupādiyaṃ na paritassati, aparitassaṃ paccattaṃ'y'eva parinibbāyati.

meaning_1: not gained full enlightenment; not woke up completely
ru_meaning: не достигший абсолютного просветления; не проснувшийся полностью
Example1: “yam’pi tathāgato arahaṃ sammāsambuddho pubb’eva sambodhā anabhisambuddho bodhisatto’va samāno mahato mīḷha-pabbatassa upar’ūpari caṅkamati alippamāno mīḷhena

meaning_1: not welcoming; does greeting respectfully; not saying hello
ru_meaning: не приглашающий; не здоровающийся уважительно; не приветствующий
Example1: tañ’ce bhikkhu n’ābhinandati n’ābhivadati n’ājjhosāya tiṭṭhati, tassa taṃ anabhinandato anabhivadato anajjhosāya tiṭṭhato nirujjhati nandī. ‘nandinirodhā dukkhanirodho, puṇṇā’ti vadāmi

meaning_1: with inconceivable beginning; lit. with not measuring point
ru_meaning: с непостижимым началом; не имеет постижимого начала; досл. с отсутствием измеряемой точки
Example1: “anamataggo’yaṃ, bhikkhave, saṃsāro. pubbā koṭi na paññāyati avijjānīvaraṇānaṃ sattānaṃ taṇhāsaṃyojanānaṃ sandhāvataṃ saṃsarataṃ.
Example2: ariyasāvakassa āraddhavīriyassa upaṭṭhitassatino samāhitacittassa etaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ yaṃ evaṃ pajānissati, anamataggo kho saṃsāro.

meaning_1: this (has) an inconceivable beginning
ru_meaning: это (имеет) непостижимое начало; это не имеет постижимого начала
Example1: “anamataggo’yaṃ, bhikkhave, saṃsāro. pubbā koṭi na paññāyati avijjānīvaraṇānaṃ sattānaṃ taṇhāsaṃyojanānaṃ sandhāvataṃ saṃsarataṃ.

meaning_1: trouble; tragedy; misfortune; (comm) suffering; lit. not good luck
ru_meaning: беда; трагедия; несчастье; (комм) страдание; досл. не удача
Commentary: (DNa) ayo'ti sukhaṃ, na ayo anayo, dukkhaṃ.
Example1: evañ’hi so, bhikkhave, maccho gilabaḷiso bāḷisikassa anayaṃ āpanno byasanaṃ āpanno yathākāmakaraṇīyo bāḷisikassa”.

meaning_1: ignoble; vulgar; coarse
Example2: yo c’āyaṃ kāmesu kāmasukh’allik’ānuyogo hīno gammo pothujjaniko anariyo anatthasañhito
English chant 2: Setting in Motion The Wheel of Dhamma

meaning_1: ignoble nature; poor in character
Example1:
yo attano sīlavatāni jantu, anānupuṭṭho'va paresa pāva,
anariyadhammaṃ kusalā tam'āhu, yo ātumānaṃ sayam'eva pāva.

meaning_1: ignoble happiness; vulgar pleasure
Example1: yaṃ kho, bhikkhave, ime pañca kāmaguṇe paṭicca uppajjati sukhaṃ somanassaṃ idaṃ vuccati kāmasukhaṃ mīḷhasukhaṃ puthujjanasukhaṃ anariyasukhaṃ.

meaning_1: with insatiable appetite (for); unsatisfiable (by); lit. not made enough (in)
ru_meaning: с ненасытным аппетитом (к); который невозможно удовлетворить; досл. недостаточно сделанный
Commentary: (SNa) analaṅkatā'ti atittā apariyattajātā.
Example1:
mahaddhanā mahābhogā,
raṭṭhavanto'pi khattiyā,
aññam'aññ'ābhigijjhanti,
kāmesu analaṅkatā.

meaning_1: and is not able (to); and is not possible (to); and is incapable (of); and not enough (for)
ru_meaning: и не годный (для); и невозможно (чтобы); и неспособен (на); и недостаточно (для)
Example1: ambho purisa, ubbhataṃ kho te sallaṃ, apanīto visadoso anupādiseso. analañ'ca te antarāyāya.

meaning_1: undefiled (by); not drowned (in); not intoxicated (by); lit. not flowing (in)
ru_meaning: не запачканный (чем-то); не утопленный (в); не опьяненный (чем-то); досл. не текущий (в)
Example1:
sātiyesu anassāvī, atimāne ca no yuto,
saṇho ca paṭibhānavā, na saddho na virajjati.

meaning_1: impossibility; inconceivability; lit. no chance
Example1: aṭṭhānam'etaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ tathāgato aparisuddhāya parisāya uposathaṃ kareyya, pātimokkhaṃ uddiseyya
Example2: so tena ñāṇadassanena na majjati nappamajjati na pamādaṃ āpajjati, appamatto samāno asamayavimokkhaṃ ārādheti. aṭṭhānam'etaṃ, bhikkhave, anavakāso yaṃ so bhikkhu tāya asamayavimuttiyā parihāyetha.

meaning_1: blamelessness; faultlessness; lit. not blameworthiness
Example2: iti purāṇañ’ca vedanaṃ paṭihaṅkhāmi navañ’ca vedanaṃ na uppādessāmi yātrā ca me bhavissati anavajjatā ca phāsuvihāro cā’ti

meaning_1: pleasure of being blameless; happiness of being faultless
ru_meaning: удовольствие в безупречности; счастье в отсутствии порицания
Example2: so iminā ariyena sīlakkhandhena samannāgato ajjhattaṃ anavajjasukhaṃ paṭisaṃvedeti

meaning_1: irreproachable; faultless; blameless; innocent; lit. not to be spoken ill of
ru_meaning: безукоризненный; безупречный; невинный; досл. о котором нельзя плохо сказать
Example1: imehi kho, bhikkhave, pañcahi aṅgehi samannāgatā vācā subhāsitā hoti, no dubbhāsitā, anavajjā ca ananuvajjā ca viññūnan”ti.
Example2:
dānañ’ca dhammacariyā ca, ñātakānañ’ca saṅgaho.
anavajjāni kammāni, etaṃ maṅgalam’uttamaṃ.

meaning_1: (what is) irreproachable; faultless; blameless; lit. not to be spoken ill of
ru_meaning: (что то) безупречное; безукоризненное; не заслуживающее порицания; досл. о котором не говорится плохо
Example1: so attānaṃ'y'eva adhipatiṃ karitvā akusalaṃ pajahati, kusalaṃ bhāveti, sāvajjaṃ pajahati, anavajjaṃ bhāveti, suddhaṃ attānaṃ pariharati. idaṃ vuccati, bhikkhave, att'ādhipateyyaṃ.

meaning_1: reputation; social standing; lit. not being disrespected
ru_meaning: репутация; социальное положение; досл. не быть презираемым
Example1: tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate santi adhicittam'anuyuttassa bhikkhuno sukhumasahagatā upakkilesā ñātivitakko janapadavitakko anavaññatti-paṭisaṃyutto vitakko

meaning_1: concerning with one's reputation; about one's social standing
ru_meaning: относящийся к своей репутации; о социальном положении
Example1: anavaññattipaṭisaṃyutta-vitakkavaḍḍhananti — sabbaṃ taṃ takkavaḍḍhanaṃ.
Example2: tasmiṃ pahīne tasmiṃ byantīkate santi adhicittam'anuyuttassa bhikkhuno sukhumasahagatā upakkilesā ñātivitakko janapadavitakko anavaññattipaṭisaṃyutto vitakko

meaning_1: unstable; ephemeral; not dependable; unreliable; lit. cannot stand on
ru_meaning: нестабильный; эфемерный; ненадежный; досл. невозможно стоять (на)
Example1:
anavaṭṭhita-cittassa, saddhammaṃ avijānato,
pariplava-pasādassa, paññā na paripūrati.

meaning_1: unstable; ungrounded; ephemeral; not dependable; unreliable; lit. cannot stand on
ru_meaning: нестабильный; лишенный основания; недолговечный; ненадежный; досл. на котором нельзя стоять
Example1: ‘sabbasaṅkhārā ca me anavatthitā khāyissanti, sabbaloke ca me mano n’ābhiramissati, sabbalokā ca me mano vuṭṭhahissati

meaning_1: all; without exception
Example3:
ye keci pāṇa-bhūt’atthi, tasā vā thāvarā vā anavasesā,
dīghā vā ye mahantā vā, majjhimā rassak’āṇuka-thūlā.

meaning_1: not seeping; not oozing (with lust); not festering; not leaking; lit. not flowed down
ru_meaning: не просачивающийся; не сочащийся (похотью); не гноящийся; не протекающий; досл. не текущий вниз
Commentary: (DHPa) anavassutacittassā'ti rāgena atintacittassa.
Example1:
anavassuta-cittassa, ananvāhata-cetaso,
puññapāpa-pahīnassa, n'atthi jāgarato bhayaṃ.

meaning_1: unmoved; unaffected; undefiled; lit. not flowed down
ru_meaning: нетронутый; не пораженный; не загрязненный; досл. не текущий вниз
Commentary: (MNa) anavassuto'ti paṭigh'āvassavena anavassuto.
Example1: tatra, bhikkhave, tathāgato na c’eva anattamano hoti, na ca anattamanataṃ paṭisaṃvedeti, anavassuto ca viharati sato sampajāno.

meaning_1: not overcrowded; not full of; not overburdened; (comm) not entangled; lit. not too close
ru_meaning: не переполненный; не перегруженный; (комм) не вовлеченный; досл. не слишком близок
Commentary: (SNPa) na ākulā anākulā.
Example2:
mātāpitu upaṭṭhānaṃ, puttadārassa saṅgaho.
anākulā ca kammantā, etaṃ maṅgalam’uttamaṃ.

meaning_1: yearning for the future; longing for what is to come; praying for the future; lit. muttering for the not come
ru_meaning: тоска по будущему; сильное желание по грядущему; молитва о будущем; досл. бормотание за то что не пришло
Commentary: (SNa) anāgatappajappāyā'ti anāgatassa patthanāya.
Example1:
anāgatappajappāya,
atītass'ānusocanā,
etena bālā sussanti,
naḷo'va harito luto'ti.

meaning_1: in the future; lit. future time
Example1: na nu kho bhavissāmi anāgatamaddhānaṃ? kiṃ nu kho bhavissāmi anāgatamaddhānaṃ? kathaṃ nu kho bhavissāmi anāgatamaddhānaṃ?
Example2: ye’pi hi keci, bhikkhave, anāgatam’addhānaṃ samaṇā vā brāhmaṇā vā yaṃ loke piyarūpaṃ sātarūpaṃ taṃ aniccato dakkhissanti dukkhato dakkhissanti anattato dakkhissanti rogato dakkhissanti bhayato dakkhissanti, te taṇhaṃ pajahissanti.

meaning_1: in the future; lit. future time
Example1: anāgataṃ vā, bhikkhave, addhānaṃ ārabbha kathaṃ katheyya, evaṃ bhavissati anāgatam'addhānan'ti.

meaning_1: not come (yet); not yet arrived; future
Example2: ‘kin’ti anāgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī āgaccheyyuṃ āgatā ca pesalā sabrahmacārī phāsuṃ vihareyyun’ti
Example3:
ye ca atītā sambuddhā, ye ca buddhā anāgatā.
yo c’eta’r’ahi sambuddho, bahunnaṃ soka-nāsano.

meaning_1: future (time); lit. not come
Example1: evaṃ vutte aññataro bhikkhu there bhikkhū etad’avoca, atītaṃ kho, āvuso, eko anto, anāgataṃ dutiyo anto, paccuppannaṃ majjhe, taṇhā sibbinī
Example2:
nirāsatti anāgate, atītaṃ n'ānusocati,
vivekadassī phassesu, diṭṭhīsu ca na nīyati.

meaning_1: who does not reach; who does not arrive at; who does not visit
ru_meaning: кто не доходит; кто не прибывает; кто не посещает
Commentary: (SNa) apunāgamanaṃ anāgantā puriso maccudheyyā'ti tebhūmakavaṭṭasaṅkhātā maccudheyyā apun'āgamanasaṅkhātaṃ nibbānaṃ anāgantā. nibbānañ'hi sattā na pun'āgacchanti, tasmā taṃ apun'āgamanan'ti vuccati. taṃ kāmesu baddho ca pamatto ca anāgantā nāma hoti, so taṃ pāpuṇituṃ na sakkoti, tasmā evam'āha.
Example1:
na santi kāmā manujesu niccā,
sant'īdha kamanīyāni yesu baddho,
yesu pamatto apun'āgamanaṃ,
anāgantā puriso maccudheyyā'ti.

meaning_1: non-returning; lit. not returning state
Construction:
na > an + ā + √gam > gām + *ī + tā
anāgāmī + tā
Example1: evaṃ sammā dvayat'ānupassino kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno appamattassa ātāpino pahit'attassa viharato dvinnaṃ phalānaṃ aññataraṃ phalaṃ pāṭikaṅkhaṃ, diṭṭh'eva dhamme aññā, sati vā upādisese anāgāmitā'ti.

meaning_1: who does not return; non-returning (in this world)
ru_meaning: кто не возвращается; кто не вернется (в этот мир)
Example1: sant'ettha, bhikkhave, upāsikāyo sot'āpannā, santi sakadāgāminiyo, santi anāgāminiyo. sabbā tā, bhikkhave, upāsikāyo anipphalā kālaṅ'katā'ti.

meaning_1: homeless wanderer; monk
Example1:
asaṃsaṭṭhaṃ gahaṭṭhehi, anāgārehi c'ūbhayaṃ,
anokasārim'app'icchaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.
Example2:
yo'dha kāme pahantvāna, anāgāro paribbaje,
kāmabhavaparikkhīṇaṃ, tam'ahaṃ brūmi brāhmaṇaṃ.

meaning_1: homelessness; homeless state
Example1: atha kho āyasmā soṇo ... yass'atthāya kulaputtā samma'd'eva agārasmā anāgāriyaṃ pabbajanti tad'anuttaraṃ brahmacariyapariyosānaṃ diṭṭh'eva dhamme sayaṃ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihāsi.

meaning_1: not angry; without malice
Example1: 'mettaṃ nu kho me cittaṃ paccupaṭṭhitaṃ sabrahmacārīsu anāghātaṃ?’

meaning_1: healthy; free from suffering; lit. not diseased
ru_meaning: здоровый; свободный от страданий; досл. не болен
Example1:
susukhaṃ vata jīvāma, āturesu anāturā,
āturesu manussesu, viharāma anāturā.

meaning_1: name of the Buddha's chief lay disciple; lit. feeder of the destitute
ru_meaning: имя главного мирского последователя Будды; досл. кормилец обездоленных
Example1: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
Example3: anāthapiṇḍiko gahapati yāvatako ahosi tehi aññatitthiyehi paribbājakehi saddhiṃ kathāsallāpo taṃ sabbaṃ bhagavato ārocesi.

meaning_1: unprotected; helpless; without support
Example1: evaṃ me sutaṃ, ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati jetavane anātha-piṇḍikassa ārāme

meaning_1: disrespect; rudeness; contemptuous behaviour
Commentary:
(VIN 2.1.54) anādariyaṃ nāma dve anādariyāni, puggal'ānādariyañ'ca dhamm'ānādariyañ'ca.
(KVa) anādariye'ti ... tasmā yo bhikkhu upasampannena paññattena vuccamāno tassa vā vacanaṃ akattu'kāmatāya, taṃ vā dhammaṃ asikkhitu'kāmatāya anādariyaṃ karoti, tassa tasmiṃ anādariye pācittiyaṃ.
Example1: anādariye, pācittiyaṃ.
Example2: hirīmā’yaṃ, bhikkhave, ottāpī appamatto hoti. so appamatto samāno bhabbo anādariyaṃ pahātuṃ dovacassataṃ pahātuṃ pāpamittataṃ pahātuṃ.

meaning_1: not taking; not including; not applying
ru_meaning: не беря; не включая; не применяя
Commentary: (VIN 1.4.13) anādā ... anādiyitvā
Example1: anādā ce bhikkhu dve bhāge suddha-kāḷakānaṃ eḷaka-lomānaṃ, tatiyaṃ odātānaṃ, catutthaṃ gocariyānaṃ
Example2: anādā ce bhikkhu tiṇṇaṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇānaṃ aññataraṃ dubbaṇṇakaraṇaṃ navaṃ cīvaraṃ paribhuñjeyya, pācittiyaṃ.

meaning_1: free from attachment; not grasping; not taking anything as one's own; lit. not taking
ru_meaning: свободный от привязанности; не цепляющийся; не принимающий ничего как свое; досл. не берущий
Example1:
vītataṇho anādāno, niruttipadakovido,
akkharānaṃ sannipātaṃ, jaññā pubb'āparāni ca,
